I ordered these for my 8 year old son. He was so excited he took them out of the box and tried to put them on only to discover that we were sent two left shoes. Now I am stuck with two left feet. Need to order a second pair, they say only one pair left in his size 4.5, must be two right shoes.
I bought the Eurelle Slippers for my husband's birthday. They arrived quicker than I expected. He loves them and wears them every day.

These shoes arrived quicker than I imagined (next day, when I only have prime 2-day shipping), and fit great. They are comfortable, and they are still great today, 2 months later. The only problem is that the shoes aren't the same color as the ones in the picture. The picture depicts it as a whiter shade, while in reality they are much browner. love these boots, and love amazon's better pricing! the boots got here just in time for family christmas pictures!!

This shoe holds up well under my 210 pound frame. The shoe also supports my orthotics well and fits perfectly (I am actually about a size 12 1/2). I still think this is the best heavy duty shoe for the money.
I had a pair of these stolen while returning from a cruise. I am so happy to have a new pair. They are my favorite shoes.

There is no doubt about the quality from Sperry, you buy any design or any style but quality remains the best. I have not seen any brand having such excellent quality. I would say people who look for quality, long life as well as long term satisfaction, would love to buy Sperry.

Just what you would expect if you owned a pair of these 10, 20, 30 years ago, except with a custom peace sign logo on the outside only.They do sure highlight however just how far shoe technology has come by comparison to a pair of ASICS running shoes - in terms of support, comfort etc. They are 30 year old or more shoe technology.I hoped that logo would be on both sides but the inseam side of the shoe bears the traditional converse chuck taylor logo.Still, 5 stars from my view. They are what they are supposed to be.

I have been wearing this Propet Walking Shoe for several years. It has held up very well and is extememly comfortable. I need to replace them and could not find them locally. I own five pairs of these shoes. All different colors. They are the most comfortable shoe I own. I am a plus size person and I can shop all day in these shoes without pain or fatigue. I wear them year round with or without socks. The best thing is I can wash them in my washing machine. I usually wash them with a load of towels. Take the insoles out first. I wouldn't wash the patent look shoe in the machine since it might damage the shiny parts. I am now looking for a good buy on the fur lined winter shoes. I highly recommend them.
they are a perfect fit for my foot, and they are very durable. they are a decent looking all around shoe. ariat my favorite

These boots seem to be very well made, and I have yet to slip on ice due to the super grippy soles. Of course, they look awesome.However, I bought the smallest size that Demonia makes (6), and they are too big all around. Also, the boots stay up because they are stiff, but they are also loose on my calves and ankles. These are not designed for small and slender people.

These shoes look really nice but they do seem too narrow and are just too snug all the way around. I wear a size 8 medium. I will need to return them but not sure if a larger size will work as then they will be too long and still too narrow probably. The shoes also feel like they slant towards the inside, which would not be good for walking very far. Even when I am just looking at them when they are not on I see how they slant inwards a little, or at least to me that is what I see.

Certainly the best pair of hiking shoes I've ever had (I haven't had too many).The shoes are perfect for what they were made, they really are waterproof, they are quite comfortable, reliable and look nice.Points to improve: waterproofing, for showing your friends it's ok, but for real hiking... well, it can be improved.

I knew I'd made the right choice the minute I put them on. They feel like shoes made by craftsmen. Within seconds I was climbing higher on the boulder than I wanted to go-- that's how much difference they made (o.k-- I'm comparing them to climbing in running shoes!) The other point worth making is that my feet stayed comfortable while climbing.Maybe the most telling comment I can make is this one. I ran into another climber with the same shoes. When I asked him if he liked them, his face lit up. And then all the other climbers (all wearing other brands) joined in the conversation-- everyone agreed that La Sportiva Mythos was the best.

These shoes are worn very regularly by most of my family for nearly barefoot comfort. We like the colors and the look of them. My daughter loves her Skydiver Blue pair.They don't offer any support and they do run large. But as long as you aren't doing a lot of walking, they are very comfortable and light weight. my feet grew during my pregnancy and these were the cutest shoes on my size 11 feet! not easy to find that! i bought the silver ones and just adore them and get compliments on them. they are roomy for my feet. i can wear them with or without socks. i love wearing them in my garden and they are super easy on and off!

These shoes are great for skating, the soles of the shoe have a nice flat bottom with thick rubber that gives a solid feel on the deck of the skateboard with padding on the inside. I skate ditches a few times a week and can usually get a few months out of a pair of these shoes before wearing holes in the soles of the shoes.

While I've always been a 608 fan the last ten years or so I was tempted to try the 609 model out. Very comparable in design and quality but it does appear they have ramped back a bit. Still all leather (assuming) upper and comfortable sole but the logo and some stitching has been sacrificed. I wear my sneakers to work as well as play and the 608 would give me a solid year and a half of daily abuse before needing replacement. I'll give the 609 a year at best. New Balance makes a decent shoe for the $$. I've paid more for less for sure.

I bought these a couple months ago and immediately put them to use by going hiking through streams and climbing mountains and boulders. I was surprised how amazing well these shoes work. They have great grip on rock and the solid sturdy frame holds your foot in place even on uneven rocks and boulders. These boots are 100 times better than the Merrell Boab which are very flimsy and quite a bit more expensive. These boots also would make great winter boots as the waterproofing is fantastic. The insoles have fantastic arch supports so these boots are really great for someone like me who has high arches.Cons: Although the grip is great on rock it is not so great on water covered rocks. But I guess that is the case with all boots. These boots need some getting used to so I would wear them and walk around the city and change the way you tie the lases and how far up you tie them and just play around until you get a comfortable fit. The boots has a significant volume so if your foot volume is small like me then you will need to use padded insoles like superfeet.Also, these boots can get really warm in summer but that turns into a pro quality in winter.I would highly highly recommend these Bootz especially for a person with high arches.

I have gone through several shoes over the years. I finally went to a specialty shop for advice and to get fitted. I tried on 5 pair and ended up with the Grid Omni. The shoe is very stable and has eliminated any of the lingering aches and pains that I had experienced with the other shoes I have tried. I highly recommend them.

These are my second pair of UGGs and just like the first pair, they did not disappoint! They are very warm and comfortable. They are a perfect fit! I had them in 2 days which is GREAT! I will definitely return when I'm interested in another pair!

I have an older pair of rockport suede oxfords and they are one of my favorite pair of shoes. When I got these (took forever) I was very disappointed with the quality, they seemed very stiff and overall just a much cheaper looking and feeling product than what I am used to from rockport.
OUTSTANDING! it's a happy day when my mom can actually find a shoe to fit her comfortably and at such a low price. She loves the color and comfort. Fast, excellent shipping.

This item was a gift. It was received in time for Christmas 2011. received in great condition. The shoes are super comfortable and very stylish. Great buy! 2 thumbs up!

I am not sure why, but these particular shoes are getting rather difficult to find in retail stores in our area. I am on my feet a lot at work and do a lot of walking. For the price, these are probably the most comfortable and long lasting shoe I have ever worn. I have several pair of them because when I do find them, I buy two pair at a time.I must admit to being rather rough on shoes but these things hold up just as well as shoes that I have paid four and five times more for.These shoes give you plenty of toes room and the cushioning is wonderful. I tend to land rather hard on my heels when I walk and the cushion in these shoes is perfect.Of course as the shoes become a bit worn for the work place, they go into my outdoor walking and scrounging around shoe pile; they work wonderfully for that purpose also. The sole is quite even and stable which helps prevent ankle strain or sprain when moving over rough ground. I have one old pair; really, really old and beat-up, which I use for my creek wading. Of course it does take awhile to wear a pair of these out and they clean up quite well using only a damp cloth and a brushing now and then.For the price it is really rather difficult to beat these things.Don BlankenshipThe Ozarks

The person I purchased them for feel they are very comfortable. I was worried at first with buying boots from on line, but it turned out ok.

I've owned two pair of these shoes over the years and they're wonderful! When you first buy them they will fit very tightly across the top of the foot; they're VERY comfortable to wear right out of the box, just difficult to get on at first but this soon loosens up. Each pair that I have owned has lasted several years with near daily wear with lots of getting wet/muddy & stepping in things at livestock shows that we don't like to think about. They clean right up and are ready to go anywhere. I wear them for everyday, shopping, casual day at the office, feeding livestock, and going to my kids stockshows(LOTS of walking, standing, grooming, etc.) The lighter color doesn't show scuffing as much as the darker color, but the darker color looks better with dark-wash jeans. They're both great, though, and I would highly recommend these to anyone needing long-wearing, comfortable, workhorse-but-still-look-good shoes.
I love these sandals. I think this is my 7th pair! They last for many, many miles and stay comfortable!

Comfortable shoes but they felt a size larger. The color was black yet the strap lining was a light tan color -- I had to take extra time when closing the velcro (folding over the strap) to cover the lighter color.
I love these shoes. They are so comfortable and are cushioned so I can walk with a bounce in my step.
If you want a great sneaker for walking and everyday use... this is it. Very comfortable and lasts a good long time.
Love them! So comfy! I've had Minnetonkas in the past and always thought they were great. I just might be buying some more!
Love them! It's an unknown what you'll actually get when you order online,and I am extremely pleased with the quality of the ballet shoes. Thanks!
These shoes look amazing. They are definitely legit Chuck Taylors. They are worth every penny.

When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.

These sandals are the most comfortable shoes I have worn in a long time. I have several pairs in different colors and practically live in them all summer. I would recommend them to anybody who wants a pair of sandals.

The pearl white shoe in the picture looks much more white than real-life. As for the fit, I am going to return them. They run small. I ordered 8 1/2 M, they say 8 1/2 but they are narrow and fit like an 8. There is no way I could walk comfortably in these shoes.
First pair lasted a couple of years and served me well; paid a little more for a full leather upper a year ago and these babies still keep my feet warm and dry. Good value boot for the money.

I like the comfortable feel of leather. It has a lot of cushion inside and provides plenty of support. I wear a 14, but needed to go with the 15 for this shoe--runs a little small.

These are excellent shoes, I have had 3 pairs of this exact model. My first pair was recommended by one of the fitting experts at my local running specialty store. The brooks helped my knees considerably. I'm a big guy (6' 248lbs) was (289lbs when I started running) and these shoes provide the necessary support for my weight. I experience no joint pain and much less fatigue running in these shoes. My last two pairs have been from Amazon because I can't resist the great price and having them delivered! :) Do consider getting fitted by an expert at a local running specialty store in your area. An expert will ensure that you have the correct shoe for your gate, pronation, and other technical running criteria. They will also make sure your shoe is the right size. I've taken a few of my running buddies down to the local store and the most common problem with their old shoes was they were too small. So go get a fitting and then when you go to replace the shoe save at amazon!

If you read my reviews you will find that I like Donald J. Pliner shoes.Beautiful design, beautiful quality, the best leathers. Like all theDonald J Pliners I own --AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA +++++. And they sell at greatprices on Amazon.

I usually wear a 7.5 but in this slipper I need an 8.5. I have slim feet, so even after I pulled the elastic strings as far as they could go, the slipper was still loose around the edges. I was hoping for a comfy slipper, instead I got an ill-fitting mess! I returned them. They might work for some, but they just weren't for me.

I also like the fact I don't have to worry about tying them. CHEAP!DO NOT BUY! Strings in front broke apart when I tried them on for the FIRST time. I've never been much of one for fancy shoes. Sure, I love the way they look, but I end up wearing them once, then stowing them to the ever-growing stash in the bottom of my closet.When I bought this shoe in the blushing bride/heather color last fall from a catalog, I expected another candidate for that stack in my closet. A shoe with the playful, sporty, yet somehow feminine details of this one simply isn't practical...right?Then they came and I tried them on.I hate to admit it, but I am now a Puma athletic shoe addict. Every pair is sporty and trendy, yet has a classical styling that is somehow sophisticated and traditional. They work for me because they're pracitcal enough to go running in, but stylish enough to wear with jeans or a sporty minidress.There's not much else to say. These are the most comfortable cute shoes I've ever had, plain and simple. They are, by far, the most versatile shoes I've ever owned. BUY THEM!

My son has dropped arch's and severe pronation from fast weight gain from all chemo meds. We went the route of medical orthotics and in grade school all he got was blisters and couldn't walk or any extra activities. We found these shoes and have purchased them ever since. Not only can he walk without pain, he's proud to say he's not last doing the mile run at school!!!!! I greatly recommend these shoes to any one I talk to, they've made a extreme difference in his life!!!!!!!!
These are the only Brand of Sandals I can buy and be guaranteed to be able to wear without taking time to "break them in." They are comfortable for walking and very nice looking to wear.
Very Fast! I had the item within 2 days of placing the order, color and size correct. I was very pleased with the service.

Received these shoes just TWO days after ordering. Gotta love that. The shoes themselves are great. As soon as I took them out of the box and slipped them on, they fit like a glove. I walked around the house for a short while and they seem to have good cushion & support. Haven't walked around in them long enough to see how they hold up in distance, but they are not "running" shoes. These are meant to be just a nice comfortable casual shoe. They look great (I got the black & gray combo), feel great and the price was great. Another great purchase from my favorite place to shop online. Highly recommended.

Went shopping for a pair of slippers after Christmas. Didn't realize that men's slippers are such a seasonal item. There were very few choices available in the stores in January. And the ones that were available were almost all at least $50. Purchased these through Amazon at an excellent price and with Prime delivery they were here in two days.Sizing for slippers is typically a challenge. I wear a size 8.5 to 9 shoe and experience suggests that I needed to order a larger size. (Many slippers come only in S/M/L/XL and oddly enough, I usually require an "L" or "XL." I can't imagine what men with truly large feet do.) In this case, I ordered a size 10. Out of the box they fit a bit tight (with socks) but I expect them to stretch a bit and will fit perfectly.The materials seem good though I have some concerns about the longevity. (But at the price I paid it's not a big concern.) The tread is excellent. Not too noisy on hardwood floors but grippy enough for going outside in the rainy season in Seattle. (I nearly broke my neck a few times in my last pair of slippers.)All in all an excellent value for less than 20 bucks.
Exactly what it said in the description and in excellent quality with a great price. I wear them nearly every day.

My Dad has very flat and painful feet. He has had quite a few surgeries on his feet. He says these shoes are so comfortable they are like slippers. That is high praise from him. At 87 comfort is very important to him. I highly recommend these shoes.

I just love my black moccasins! There just like I remembered them back in the day. I wear them all the time and everyone is complimenting them and are reminising about the days when they wore them. Of course, I gave them the website AMAZON.COM. Thanks Amazon.com and Minnetonka.Rubyred

lots of comments about size ...so much so that i anticipated having to send them back.here's my advice - don't use the size charts listed because its way off. Do this:get a tape measure - stand on it, measure from the bottom rear of your foot up to the tip of your big toe...then match that with the size next to it... (skip all the US/ EU / GB size... they are clearly wrong on the size listing)So, my daughters measurement was 10" from back to tip - we ordered size 9. Perfect fit.okay, material quality is nice for wearing around the house or art school... but from what i could tell, it won't stand up to constant use. But hey, they're inexpensive (relatively speaking) so buy a few pair.m

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE COLOR THEY WOULD HAVE GONE RIGHT BACK.THEY ARE DRESSY ENOUGH FOR WORK ON IN CLEMENT DAYS BUT THAT HARD FOOT BASE ALMOST GOT THESE A 1 STAR RATING.

I ordered these in a size 8. I typically wear a 7 1/2 and usually have to order size 8 in a flip flops and/or sandals. I loved the way the straps fit but wasn't happy with the length of the flip itself. My heel was at the very end of the flip. So I ordered a 9 to compare. The 9 fits much better heel to toe but the straps are a little looser. I can't stand having my foot on the very edge. It makes them look too small. So for me, I went with the 9. The comfort of both the 8 and 9 was/is great! These are easy to wear straight out of the box. No rubbing, no blisters... overall a great, comfortable flip flop. My husband has very narrow feet (between an A and a B width) and we have a terrible time finding shoes for him. I had high hopes for these (ordered an 8B), but the fit was very uncomfortable -- the shoes pinched when he tried to walk in them. Since we didn't keep them, we can't speak to how well they might wear over time.If you're looking for good shoes for a man with extremely narrow feet, I strongly recommend the Rockport Pro-walker 7100 we later found at shoebuy.com .... so comfortable, my husband hates to take them off!!

... almost as necessary for Modern Living as Duct Tape! But totally misunderstood by the low-star reviewer who took the "Goo" to mean "Glue". It isn't a glue; it's a patch product for worn spots on the soles. I've used it for years on favorite tennis shoes, and now I'm using it on my "Vibram Five_Finger" shoes. The latter are wonderfully comfortable, but the thin soles do develop holes ...I've also used it in a pinch on socks - I never learned to darn - and on my backpack. On a long trek, I carry a partial tube of it as well as a small roll of the invaluable duct tape ... for blisters!The low-star reviewer was incorrect about the 'keeping' quality of the stuff also. Don't close the cap too tightly, lest you need to puncture the tube to get it open, store it in a cool place, and it'll keep as long as you like.This seems to be the cheapest of the various sources in the 'zoo, once you calculate free shipping.
I'm a converse wearing kind of girl, And these are my favorite by far! I have roughly about 10 pairs of converse they are the only shoes I wear. They we're affordable and so comfortable! Great buy!

Want to add my recommendation for a great waterproof boot. Why pay more? Going on two years of use, trail hiking, backpack camping, urban hiking and an occasional run. It's that comfortable. Need the support of a full-height boot and this one gives good ankle protection. Waded through streams up to my ankles and kept my feet absolutely dry partly due to the gusseted tongue. Deep multi-directional lugs give great traction even on the muddiest trail. Cleans up pretty well also. Showing a little wear around the heel and toe, but attribute that to walking and jogging on concrete and asphalt since the lugs look in perfect shape. Otherwise bullet-proof. Could be lighter but would not trade this for a less durable boot. Will probably buy this boot again when this one wears out, but who knows when that will be?

CAUTION - likely over 75% of the positive reviews that apply to these boots, do not actually apply anymore to these boots. After wearing out a set of these boots over the years and proclaiming them my favorite ever - I asked 'Santa' to bring me a new pair for Christmas. I was very bummed to find out the boots are not made the same as they were before. There are some minor exterior differences which indicate a lower quality manufacturing process, such as the poor quality detail of the Hitec logo on the metal quick lace points as compared to my first pair, or the rubbery look of the leather. But the biggest change is that a low quality insole has been substituted for what was a very comfortable insole.In my first pair of these boots was a very comfy insole with a much thicker arch cushion. In these new boots the insole is stamped out of one uniformly thin piece of rubber foam from heel to toe, with not nearly enough cushion to protect your arch from the rigid boot frame. The old insoles were contoured with varying thickness along the insole, and with at least 5x thicker cushion in the arch. So these new boots are digging into my arch and they are basically unwearable.*** UPDATE JANUARY 15 2013*** I called Hi-Tec customer service and discussed the difference in the insoles. They offered to send me a pair of MAGNUM 3D2 Contoured Comfort Insoles - they are much better in every respect. I am revising my review up to four stars based on the excellent customer service I received.

I purchased these boots to replace a pair of burlys that were quite old; they had cracked along the top of the foot near the ankle. My husband uses them to slosh through the hilly woods on particularly soggy days as well as for wading in streams. I am told they are completely waterproof, quite comfy, have awesome traction and the fit is mostly true to size. They maybe run a fraction big, so to be a perfect fit when wearing thick socks. He's very happy with these boots. My father has been wearing LaCrosse boots for as long as I can remember and these latest boots continue in the tradition. I didn't give them a 5 for a purely girlie minor detail. I think some people might roll their eyes now, but here goes, they smell bad. Despite the advertising that they are scent free, it took a couple weeks of airing out to get rid of the rubber boot smell. It doesn't matter so much for us, but if you are planning to use them for hunting I would recommend buying them early so that they have time to lose that smell. Otherwise they are perfect!

I have put about 15-20 miles on the boots already, but they seemed to work well the first time out. The sole is structurally sound, and the uppers supportive. I am confident to hike over rough, rocky terrain with these boots. They looked especially good after applying Danner's Boot Dressing suitable for gortex lined boots. The uppers are a little stiff if laced tight; which is good for steep downhill to keep your toes out of the end. However, on flat ground I have installed 2 sets of shorter laces. The first set for the first five holes (like a low hiking boot), and the second lace for the upper four holes ...tied looser so I don;t spend so much energy flexing the uppers all day long.

I have been looking for bronze boots for several years now and I have to say that I am very happy with these boots. They are very, very comfortable and of course, very stylish. The most important feature (for me) is that they are not too high of a heel and that they provide some support, as far a boot is concerned. These boots meet my requirements. See, I am usually a fan of the Clark's Wallabee, but I wanted to try something new. I ordered these bad boys (*knowing they run a little large!!!*) and I was impressed! I wish they were not so dumbo-toed (aka: flare out larger around the tip of the shoe), but whatever... I love em'

I had heard a lot of really great things about these boots from a friend of mine who is an ironworker. I asked him to recommend a quality work boot under the $200 range (Red Wings are just too pricey for me), and he suggested I try these because he has owned a pair for a while and wears them to work every day. Also, many of his coworkers were really fond of them because they are union made / American made. The styles and quality of construction are very much on par with RW boots, but these are half the price or less that what you would pay for RW's. I knew as soon as I took them out of the box that these were very well made, and the leather is soft and supple. The quality shows in every little detail. I had done a bit of research and read that they run large in their sizing. Some even suggested trying a whole size down. I've always worn a size 10, so I purchased two pairs; a 10 and a 9.5. Sure enough, the 10's were way too big for me, and the 9.5's were right on. So, please be advised when ordering these - it may be safer to buy a half-size down to start with.My only minor complaint is that there seems to be a lot of room in the heel of the boot. At first it bothered me, but as they have worn in, the boots have seemed to conform to my feet a little better and the roominess in the heel is less noticable.

I have used this wallet for 4 years now. For $20, it is a great wallet to get. The best thing about this wallet is the small form factor: if you dont hold alot of cards and cash, this is a great wallet to have. It also limits the amount of cards you can hold. I would say that you could hold 8 cards in the back and maybe 3 in the clear sleeve if you wanted to. Occasionally, I end up with that many cards, but this is achieved after considerable stretching of the leather.The only negative thing about this wallet is the clear leather front: it started chipping away/breaking over time. This was because I kept removing and returning my ID into that pouch area. If you simply keep the ID in that pouch, I do not believe that it will break.Anyway, I'm buying another one of these wallets to replace my breaking one. I highly recommend this product if you want a slim fitting wallet and dont have too many cards.

I'm a commercial HVAC contractor in the mid-atlantic. I am on a roof 6a-2p 5 days a week. We get snow a few times a year, and the temps sometimes fall into the teens. I got these boots as a christmas gift; my steel toe belleville's were freezing my toes off at work. my standard boot size 11R fit just fine.However, after 1 good year of solid wear everyday for 3.5 months; and the occasional use after that: they have worn out. The tread is more than 60% gone. The 400 gr insulation was never enough, my feet were warmer than in steel toes- but they were frozen. Water soaked through in numerous places, and trudging across a roof during snow-maggedon was cold. I will not buy another pair of these; and for my line of work it's not recommended. The insulation has also worn out, and as it gets cold again- it's almost as bad as wearing steel toes.Tradesman's verdict: tradesman, don't buy em. harry homeowner/ hiker/ guy who needs a good winter boot; Highly recommended. If you don't wear these day in day out and aren't rough on boots- these would be great. But for what I do everyday- wolverine- y'all gotta try Harder

These are my 4th pair of chucks and I love them. I know exactly what I'm getting and I don't have to try them on. I normally wear a 8.5 in womens, but I order a 6 in mens when I buy chucks. It took almost a week from when I placed my order to receive the shipping notice, but the shoes arrived 2 days after I got the email. Just wish they got here sooner!

This is the 5th pair of these shoes I've purchased. I buy at least 2 pairs a year. They're comfortable and I like the way they look. However the last 2 pairs have had problems with the stitching coming undone very soon after purchase. I still like them, but I'm definitely looking for a new boat shoe.
Very comfortable & stylish. I use these for my work where dress code is dress shirt/slack. They blend in just fine.
very good shoe, if you want something other then sneakers, comfort is great for walking or standing. had no problems with the order or shipment, price was ok also.
Francisco Peinero (Barcelona, Venezuela)Recomiendo 100% este producto, todo llego tal y como salia en las especificaciones del mismo. Vendedor muy serio y atento.aun las tengo

These shoes are well made, durable, comfortable and always fit the same. No surprises when you wear them out and get another pair! Highly recommended to anyone who is on his feet all day and needs a comfortable, durable and well made shoe!

I think Chuck's look cool, which is why I bought these, but I had no idea they were so uncomfortable. If you can deal with a shoe that has almost no cushion and no arch, then by all means get them (I still wear them every once in a while). But if comfort is a big thing to you, I would look elsewhere.

I LOVE Dansko. They are my favorite shoe. I don't wear anything else to work (since I am on my feet ALL day). I wanted to wear some heels since my new job and thought who better than Dansko? Well, I loved the look of the Remy the best and bought a pair at my friends shop. When I got them, I wore them around a little on my day off. The only problem with this shoe is that my toes literally get cramped. And I don't have wide feet. In fact, some shoes are too wide for me. Especially if they have been tried on too many times and have been stretched out or broken in. Other than that the arch is fine. But I couldn't get past the cramped toes. I didn't even know your toes could get cramped. Unfortuneatly, I do not wear them for more than an a couple of hours at a time. If it weren't for that, they would be the perfect heel!
The shoes came earlier than expected and were in good shape. They were brand new and in the box and the size was correct.
$300.00 seems like a lot of money for a pair of shoes, but I have been very happy with these. They are very comfortable for everyday use and walking.
buen zapato de paseo , cómodos, transpiración y ventilación por su malla muy buena, suela cómoda en amortiguar pero no posee tracción es solo pa pasear no lo recomiendo para actividades intensas

In nostalgic moment, I decided I needed some Chucks. As a teen I wanted red ones but never got any, so now at 55, I said what the heck. They are as lightweight and comfortable as I remember. A great buy.
A very nice looking, comfortable shoe. My husband's favorite was the Venetian shoe. He liked the comfort sole as he walks on concrete floors all day.

i've owned a pair of these for 6 years now. they are still going strong and i wear them everyday. i have taken these boots from jungle terrain to salt water and they are still going strong. the only thing i have ever had to do to them is have them re-soled. everything else on them is perfect.
True Minnetonka Moccasins are extremely comfortable. I live in mine and they still last at least several years. I find the smooth leather much more durable and stay in good condition longer. Enjoy!
Overall not a bad shoe for the price, the buckle can come off at times and does too..Soles wear out pretty quick, definetly needs some inserts.Light, easy on maintanence...good one..
Product line is favorable...prices fair...I ahd a pair just like this 3 years it lasted...then the inside collapsed at the heal...into the trash they went...was happy to find them again...
Comfortable shoe. Nice deep white. Good leather uppers. Shoes really last. True to size. Wear at work at least 10 hours per day. Good support.

Sketchers have been the only shoes I have bought for years. They fit as though you have broken them in as soon as you get them and they last a long time. I really like these all white shoes. They look classy (as long as you keep them clean) and really pull outfits together. My only complaint would be that I can't figure out a way to get the tongue of the shoe to not scunch down. I have to keep pulling it up. I even ran the laces through the loop but that didn't help either. Maybe once I get them fully broken in.
my husband said they where good for his job but they only last him 8 months in his job because he works outside in all type of weather.
Not what I expected but I was pleasantly surprised once they arrived. Delivery took forever because of the processing of the order...
the shoes were awesome quality, shipped very quickly, but i guess that style runs big, i usually wear an 11, ordered that. they were huge, had to send them back.

I bought a pair of these boots some months ago. I was initially nervous about the price, as they are neither cheap nor are they Redwings. After wearing them to work for months, I'm sold. These are probably the most comfortable boots I've ever worn. First off, they make these boots in my size, which is not something I find often -- I wear an 11-1/2 EEE. Second, they require no breaking in or additional insoles. They were more comfortable right out of the box than my favorite, most worn-in old boots. I work as an inside wireman, or construction electrician, mostly in heavy industry. They are standing up well, so far, to the daily beating I put them through, which includes walking through, scuffing on and kicking rocks, rusty metal, concrete, sand, muck, water and about anything you can think of.Pros:- Amazingly Comfortable- Manufactured in a wide range of sizes- Tough, easy to clean off- Steal toed with EH rating- Water-resistant (My feet haven't gotten wet yet)- Union made in the USA by UFCW workersCons:- Soles wear a bit faster than Redwings- Insoles will start to wear after about 4-6 months, may need to be replaced in a year or so

Saucony Jazz shoes are well-made and comfortable. They're great for casual wear, for athletic outings, and for traveling. I wear a half-size, which makes it difficult to find comfortable shoes, but these fit me perfectly. I've had them for several months, and they have continued to be comfortable and supportive. People tell me that they make my feet look small, which is an added bonus. Another nice aspect of these shoes is that Saucony rarely changes their style, so if you'd like to own the same pair of shoes ten years from now, they'll probably have them. I have one frivolous complaint about these shoes : the shoe laces that came with them are a little bit too long. I have a tendency to step on them and untie my shoe laces. I didn't think that such a trivial complaint was worth changing my rating for. These shoes are also very easy to wash. Overall, these shoes are reliable, and completely worth their price.

It's a very good product (Capezio), high quality but the heel is too high for students that are doing character dancing for the first time; beginners should start with a 3/4" heel... ...unfortunatelly, I just learned that!

i've always hated seeing people wear these shoes out in town as a regular shoe... but i got a pair after a training deployment to Thailand and blew out 2 pairs of flipflops (shower shoes) walking over gravel and dirt going to and from the showers. I got the Realtree cammo special just to be different from everyone else and i love them for what they are. great on the beach, at the river, around the yard and house. i just wish they made the XXXXL in white. id really like to get a white pair in my size for my dads wedding comming up later this year. hes getting married on a boat on the river and were all doing a casual dress up.all in all, great shoe. but i still wont wear them out in town.
Very comfortable and cute shoe. I wear a 9 AA and rarely find great colored shoes in my size. I bought these in aqua and am very happy with the fit and the look.
Versatile shoe appropriate for both jeans and skirts-- comfortable enough to wear all day long without blisters or foot pain. Highly recommend.
I like the way they look-nice and neat.They are soft and comfortable. One thing though-when I wore them on a rainy day it felt kinda slippery on the road.
This is my daughters second pair of Mizuno and she loves them...plan on buying another! They fit right out of the box like a glove, very comfortable and stand up to all the foot action!
I love the shoes they are just what I wanted the fit is great.I got the Black ones.KEEN Barcelona Mary Jane Shoe - Women's

Comfortable, functional, and the price was right. They might not be highest quality, but they also don't cost $100+. I used them for a tango class I took. They aren't too tall of heels, and they have just the right amount of slide vs. traction. I love the T strap style too.
el articulo me encanta.. me parecen demasiado lindos... y me llegaron en perfecto estado! muchas gracias por sus servicios !!
I would have like the shoes to be just a little softer....but I can be quite satified with what I got for my value. People look at the shoes and say how nice they look.

I thought I finally found a perfect pair of shoes. I'm on my feet all day so it's important for me to get a good cushioned shoe. According to the reviews I ordered a wide yet I always wear medium width. When I received them I immediately triedthem on. I had to double check if I ordered the right size. They fit tighter than any shoe I ever bought. I was very disappointed to say the least. And the next day they were back in the mail on their way to you.

This is the third time I have purchased this shoe, it isso comfortable, my other shoes are jealous as they sit silently in the closet collecting dust. If you want a comfortable shoe, a good looking shoe, I recomment this one. And the price was right!

Was very thankful these arrived so soon after ordering,was a last minute item...and my daughter loves them....she now has 2 pairs..and is planning on collecting them for different colors....Thank youShelia Sale/VA
Pretty shoe, but they aren't shoes you wear if it is going to be a long evening....OW

I recently had foot surgery and was looking for a nice wide plain sneaker. These are really cute but not wide enough. I would order the widest they offer. I will be giving these away and ordering the wider one. I really like them

I was reluctant to try out these ugly clogs, but finally decided to see what the fuss was all about and took them on a trek in the Panama rain forest and wore them as a camp shoe for a week. Even though the Caymen is supposed to be a closer fit than the Beach, they still feel very loose, as if they're going to fall off, at first. But after getting used to them and forgetting I had them on, I realize that this contributes to the comfort. Unlike my usual sandals, these dry by simply wiping them off which is a huge benefit in wet environments. I still think they're fugly but they're extremely comfortable for wear around the house or camp, and light enough to always take with you on your travels.

I don't know if it is the shoe or my foot, but I am finding them too large at the heels so they slip there causing irritation when I am walking/jogging on the treadmill. I would not buy this style again.

I broke an outer bone in my foot 4 years ago. Never had therapy. Bought these shoes and discovered that since the break, I had changed my gait to put pressure on the inner foot in order to take pressure off the healing outer bones. In doing so, I'd changed the line-up of my whole leg. The pain in my hip made me think my running and walking days were over. The Kayanos keep my foot in it's natural position and since that first day wearing them I've never had hip pain. The shoes feel like clouds on my feet. I cried. Freedom to run and walk never felt better!

These are pretty nice casual sandals, but my feet tend towards the narrow side and the straps don't fit snugly around my feet...perhaps it would have worked out better in a narrow width, but all they had was medium width.

I received my 9.5 N ballet shoes today. Before ordering, I measured my foot from tip of big toe to end of heel.Using that number, I decided to go a half size larger "just in case" some of the people who warned "too small" were talking about my kind of foot. Well, the shoes are even too small at half a size larger!! I always buy athletic shoes one whole size longer. If I buy these again, I will do that---so if you wear a 9, get a 10! The ballet shoes have the curved toe, and that design makes the big toe land on one of the short curved sides...well, mine anyway. Also, I have a very narrow heel, and they are too big in the heel...so too short and too wide a heel if you need a narrow size. However, I will keep them and maybe order a size 10N. Do measure your foot standing on a tape measurer, and to whatever size it says to get in the measurement instructions add one full size. I want to kick myself! : kkp

Shoes arrived in wonderful shape; packaged well; exactly what I ordered.However, we ordered the wrong size. Return went well; advised my account would be credited for purchase price only; but there was no stock available nor could they tell me when they would receive more in the size we needed. If you need a specific size, order it ASAP.

I bought these sandals for my mom because they looked nice and were from Softspots a company I love. She hasn't worn them out yet but reportrd them to be very comfortable. Just what we were looking for. Excellent product as usual. I highly recommend,

The last time I wore a pair of chucks was back in the early 80's. They are just as I remembered them. They are comfortable and easy to break in, plus my feet don't hurt after wearing them all day. Awesome shoes!! I'll be buying another pair.
I love, love, love these sandals, they are the most comfortable sandals I have ever worn. Wish I could find them in more colors!

I ordered thise for my son for Christmas. He usually wears a 13 but would have needed a 12 in these. He didn't really like them for hiking; they are more of a work boot. You can't just ship these back to amazon; you have to pay to do it.
excellent converse all star. the product was well described and satisfied my needs. the shipment has been quick
I got these shoes for less than $25, and have a hard to fit (narrow) foot. The shoes fit great, and are very comfortable. I would buy these again.

I had a pair of Skechers (of another model) that I really liked but they got covered in mud. So I had to buy a new shoe that looked more professional than sneakers but was still comfortable to wear. After looking in many stores and not finding anything I liked, I came here and looked for a new Skechers. This shoe is great. It is comfortable and looks good. I really enjoy it and recommend it.

Thios show is great! Comfortable for my daughter to wear, and excellent capezio manufacturing. However, my daughter wears a 6.5, size 7 she has some room. I ordered a 7.5 wide, I danced for years and know ballet slippers are narrow. The 7.5 barely fits! I would return them but even the 10 minutes she wore them around the room showed too much wear to return. She will be able to wear them a few wooks before having to order new ones.

I bought these around New Years, and by June, the sole was already breaking apart and the back of the heel was deteriorating. I stopped wearing them regularly and they eventually wore down further and got few holes in the canvas right above the sole. I was expecting a little higher quality unfortunately. :\
I love these boots they are perfect for my six year old. They are durable and I love the darker color so the dirt does not show as much. The price was great and shipping was fast

I bought these Sperry's in the same size that I bought my last pair because they don't change from pair to pair and they just work. Do not hesitate to get these, they're some of the best casual dress shoes money can buy and they work for almost any occasion.

A friend asked me to recommend a pair of hiking/camping boots. These are the one and only pair boots I owned in the USMC Infantry, GI boots will ruin your feet, I threw them away right after boot camp! Re-soled them many times, never gave me blisters. The tongue will sink if you don't "break" them in, completely soaking them and wearing them until they dry changing socks regularly for 1-2 days to 'shrink' to fit. Don't take them off until they are "completely dry", then kiwi them regularly, soft/supple. If you are really serious, upgrade them by re-sole-ing them with the most flexible soles you can find, your feet will thank you after 30 miles everyday weeks on end ;-)
Have been pleased with these boots 2nd pair I have bought. Great water proof and very comfortable soles. I like that the laces don't break easy because of they have eyelets all the way to the top.

These shoes fit like a glove. They are very comfortable and true to size. The inside is soft suede-type leather with padding in just the right places. I thought there was going to be a break-in period but these shoes were comfortable to walk in from day one. A very sturdy and comfy shoe at a great price.

I love Crocs. They're a great substitute for slippers around the house and you can wear them outside. Your feet stay cool and breathe. They won't get sweaty like they do in sneakers/tennis shoes. One warning: don't wear them on the treadmill. I didn't find they gave me enough support there, but they are great for casual wear around the house or running errands. They wear very well. I wear mine almost every day and have had them for 4 years. Might try some other styles in the Crocs brand.
6 N is a hard to find shoe size. This white sandal was perfect in every way. It's exactly what I was looking for !!

I bought these for my husband they look great, and he loves them! They have a suede look to them that makes them a little more dressier than your typical boat shoe. Very breathable material! Highly recommend!

the shoes were perfect and came right on time. however, the very first time i wore them, they got scuffed by a tricky curb. i wish you could have installed some kind of invisable force field around them so that they would stay so white. you really need to work on that.
... you know the aggravation when you get a pair of shoes that make your socks slip down at the heel ...
I have the one in tan as well. Very classy looking and comfortable...typically that's a hard combo to come by in a shoe. I highly recommend this show!

I was excited to read in the description that the flip flops were black and yellow. I'm happily thinking Washington Redskins yellow. They were actually black and light blue which is the Reebok color for this type of sandal. Fortunately, they were a gift and the recipient was pleased, even though I was not.
Great shoe for the price. Compared to other sites, best value offered for a shoe that fits true to size and of good quality. Seller A++ with fast delivery.
My daughter very much liked her slippers, however they were not like the one pictured. I think she likes hers better than she would have liked those pictured.
It is exactly as described on the post. I'm very pleased and I highly recommend the product if you like converse products of course

Excellent value, comfortable fit. Especially just above the heel the leather has a concave shape that is very comfortable when I prop up my feet so that the tendon gets no pressure. I also like the saltwater proof eyelets.
I love these shoes. They are very comfortable, and people compliment me about these shoes all the time.

Looking all over for a 'cute' shoe/boot to wear while riding my motorcycle. This shoe FITS!Sizing: is great-right on the mark. I was not used to a high top and was a bit difficult to get on and off for the first few wearings.Comfort: wore these on a weekend ride to upstate NY and was very comfortable. Another day wore them shopping all day...still kicking!Price: alot to me...but I really liked them, HAD to have them. Best buy here... $75 and up at other sites!
These shoes are the best. They are so comfortable and really cute. I got the lilac patchwork ones and I wish I had gotten a couple of more colors before they sold out.

Two friends with narrow feet had purchased these sandals so I ventured forward ordering two pair on sale. Had to send them back. The straps were not nearly snug enough to keep them on my feet. Each step was an effort.
They fully met my expectations. Very light weight and comfortable. I bought them to wear only on the beach, but ended up wearing them home from Hawaii on the airplane!
I now own five pairs!!! All in different colors! Hope they never stop selling them!

I live in northern Minnesota and these are great for winter. Warm, waterproof and good grip on the icy sidewalks. Very comfortable too. I have a very nice pair of Sorel winter boots but they are HEAVY for day to day activities. During the winter I wear the Sorels to work and then keep a pair of tennis shoes in my office to change into once I get there. No need for that any more. Driving is nicer too. Have you ever tried to drive a vehicle with giant winter boots on? Not fun.

Love these but my only issue is with the fit- they are a bit smaller and more narrow than other Reef's of the same size- I should have ordered up a size with this style. Other than that, they are great.

I bought the size I would typically in the glass, and they are seriously tight. I would have probably gone up a half size if I had been able to try them on. I think it is fixable with a shoe stretcher, and this is just a warning.

These are good shoes. I have only had them for a little while but I have already put a lot of miles on them. They are holding up quite well but the tread on the ball of the foot on both sides is showing significant wear. I'm not sure how long these will last but so far a very comfortable and servicable shoe.
MuCh more comfortable than they look. Everything old becomes new again. Platforms are in once more.

These shoes,Converse Chuck Taylor All Star Hi Top are the ones that I've looked for all my life.They are extremely comfortable, well made, fit just right, keep you warm in cold weather and cool in the summer. I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Please, follow the advice stated in the link regarding women's and men's zises.This is very important.Don't get confused with other brands or models. I wish they'd come in different colors, I'd get one of each.

These do promote a more stable stride especially on slick surfaces. I only buy Propet for walking shoes. They are quality made. My only disappointment was the sizing. They run wider in the heel and toe than other shoes I've purchased from them in the same size.

These shoes are very comfortable and good looking for casual dress. Furthermore, on a really rainy day I found out how waterproof they are. I stood in 2 inch deep puddles and my feet stayed perfectly dry. 5 stars from me.

good morningthe excellence of the purchase is that I arrive in the estimated time and are products that people want to buy is a great way to buy cards by providing this optionto shop and provide good service and hope to continue buying the best of you waiting felicitacciones

I have been wearing all stars for way to long now, and these are just as good as I remember. These shoes are iconic, we all know how good these are, the oxfords are a great change of pace from my high tops. These shoes will never go out style!
Received the promptly ,they are made very well .This is my second pair and just love the way they fit .
Well made and very versatile. I wear them casually and to work in the yard. They hold up well and are easy to clean. HIghly recommend.

They are the shoe of shoes. I own multiple pair in different colors. They are great shoes and will last you... Be carful they can rub your skin raw if you don't properly tighten them.i could wear these shoes for days.

After reading many of the reviews I ordered a half size bigger. My daughter is a 11.5 in street shoes and the 12M I ordered are too big and too wide. I am glad I did not order a full size larger, as many reviews suggested.
These are a nice pair of casual work shoes. Very comfortable and decent looking worn with a pair of slacks. They run true to size and I would recommend to anyone looking for work loafer.
Buenos tiempos de entrega y el producto llegó en buenas condiciones, Pueden comprar en esta tienda cuando quieran, 100% recomendable
I LIKE THESE SHOES THE STYLE AND WEAR IS VERY COMFORTING. THEY CAN BE DRESS DOWN AND UP IN WHAT EVER YOU WEAR.

I just received my large Harvey tote except it is not large at all I wanted a medium but I am glad I ordered the large, it is a lot smaller than I expected, but it is well made and sturdy! I really like!

AND I WEAR A LOT OF FILA'S I HAVE WORN FILA'S SINCE I STARTED WALKING AND NOW I HAVE GOTTEN TO THE POINT WHERE I WOULD LIKE TO SEE SOME BB84 MID IN LADIES I WOULD LOVE TO PURCHASE A PAIR OF PINK/WHITE/BLACK FILA'S. I think the shoe is fairly comfortable, but a little too clunky and heavy around the sole area! Eccos are better!
These shoes are as soft and black as my heart is. Much more comfortable and sexy than hi tops IMHO. They'll make your feet smell, though.

I purchased from the photo. was in a hurry that day. Glad they where the low ones he wanted. novelty item. My son wanted them , he is 30 yrs old. A fun item he used to have many years ago. the size recomendations was correct. 1/2 size smaller was just right.... Not the Hi Tops they state in the add.
My son needed these for wrestling and is very happy with them. He says they are comfortable and also look good. I would recommend them to anyone.

This is a comfortable slide in a neutral color, but the leather is a bit stiff, not as pliable as some of the other Clarks sandals I have. Maybe it will soften in time. But they are still good everyday sandals and they were a good buy, hence the 4 stars.

I am on my feet 12 or more hours a day. Cement floors and high activity have destroyed multiple sets of shoes. I have bough some brands and totaled them in 3-4 months. The only thing showing wear is the finish. The toes are scuffed up from crawling and moving around working on equipment. If there is work to be done I am all over it. My shoes better be prepared to take it all. These Wolverines are comfortable and solidly built.When I do finally give them more then they can handle, I will be buying another set to replace them. I would love a more durable toe area for lasting beauty but I don't want to give up the comfort that these shoes offer to my hard working feet.
I brought this for my Mother. She loves the shoes. This is the only place I could get them. Her Christmas was made by receiving this product.

My feet have hurt most of my life. When I slipped these on, I was in heaven. I wore them to work and after 8 hours, my feet still feel wonderful. I'm going to order several more in different colors. What a relief!!

This is the only shoe that I could find with a sole that doesn't cake up with mud (to be released bit-by-bit around the house). They are not as comfortable as some that I've had, but they are very well made.

Came exactly as expected. Perfectly white and fit fine. It does get dirty easily but when wearing white shoes in NYC, that's expected. I'll probably buy again but in a different color. The only thing to note is that the racing stripe on the bottom is not blue, it was black.

These shoes are well worth the money (which were on sale when I purchased them). They fit well and are very comfortable for walking and standing. I have knee problems and if I wear a shoe that does not fit properly or if I have to limp or compensate for foot discomfort, I suffer with increased pain in my knees. I highly recommend this shoe both for looks and for comfort.

These shoes feel great, fit great too. The worst part about them is they squeak, and squeak loud. I cannot sneak out of the office or around employees because they are so loud and everyone knows I am coming.

These shoes were not as comfortable or durable as comparably priced Rockports. Like a few other reviewers, I also had a problem with heel wear as the edge of the heel quickly wore down exposing a particle-board type interior. There is about 1/16" of rubber on the bottom of the heel, but the sides of the heel are basically particle board that has been painted black.The other down side of the wooden heel is that the shoes are indeed loud, especially if you wear through the thin rubber sole on the edge where your heel first makes contact with the ground. My wife was always worried that I would wake up the kids in the morning with my foot steps in these shoes (and only these shoes), even when I made a point of walking lightly.On the positive side, they look decent (until the heel wears) and they're cheap. However I'm going back to Rockport for my next work shoe.

The sandals are super comfy - and I have badly battered feet - so comfort is of top most importance. Have only one complaint - that Naturalizers don't carry the SCOUT sandal in Canada, so had to go via daughter in the USA, and she had to ship on to me. Don't understand that sort of merchandising. This is shoe - not some Cuban Cigar nonsense.

It's great to have summer footwear for the Big Man. I wear a size 15 shoe and I have trouble finding a variety of shoes. Crocs are available in XXX-Large (14-15). My daughter bought me my first pair of Crocs from my college alma mater and I loved them so much I bought my next pair for myself from Amazon.

Worn these for almost a year and the shoes has yet to show signs of deterioration. They are extremely comfortable and reliable with great traction. I have the black pair and they look great. This pair may last for years to come even with the heavy usage I putted on them. I would no doubt buy these again.The only drawbacks are minor and arose from it's great traction. The bottom has small grooves and therefore get small pieces of sand stuck to it sometimes. The traction also create havoc for dancing because it's most difficult to twist and slide and spin in them.

I loved the unique look of these shoes. However, it's best not to consider them as everyday or daycare shoes. The pink paint at the toe began flaking off within a week of everyday wear. I love that they were easy to get on and off, and were a good fit for my daughter's slim foot. Had I paid the full original price I would have given the shoes an even lower review than I have, but since the price was pretty low, I gave them a break.
I received the men's clark wallabee shoes very quickly and was very happy since this was a Christmas gift.

I bought my first pair of these exact type of shoes back in 2006. I absolutely love my Premium Skechers, and I will continue to buy this pair until Skechers no longer makes them. i love the converse, but not the store, i have a big problem i made a mistake and they didn't help, now i have two pair of the same color, i and nobody size like me.

I bought these shoes to go with the tan pants in my nursing uniform. They are wonderful and many people like them. They are shiny shoes and tend to make a person look like they just stepped out of a band box. I have received many compliments on them. The shoes are easy to wear and comfortable.
I love, love, love these sandals, they are the most comfortable sandals I have ever worn. Wish I could find them in more colors!
These are the only Brand of Sandals I can buy and be guaranteed to be able to wear without taking time to "break them in." They are comfortable for walking and very nice looking to wear.
Very happy with the product and also the price and service. Product was an international purchase and arrived in tact.

My wife asked for some slippers for Christmas with the specifications that were for Isotoners. I checked the Isotoner website for styles and colors with those specifications and decided on these. I bought them through Amazon.com as I knew they would arrive on time and be exactly what I ordered.
Bought for my husband, nice colors and shipped quickly. And durable was hit by a car and came out with minor washable scratches

I have worn the K-Swiss Ultrascender for many years. With it's high arch, heel support and numerous design features, it is without a doubt the best court shoe I've found. Unfortunately, the current shoe has been dumbed down from its original version. The high arch support is still there, but many other features have been removed probably in an effort to reduce production costs without raising prices. I am disappointed in K-Swiss, and feel the company is misrepresenting this product to those of us that have purchased it in the past. Next time I'll know to look for a different shoe.

When the Crocs first came out and I saw people wearing them I thought they were just silly. After a few years I started to think maybe they were comfortable because so many people were wearing them and saying how comfortable they were. I ordered some from Amazon, who had some for my large feet, and I love them. They are so light and comfortable. The only time I have put on a different pair of shoes was when I went hiking on a camping trip.
If I wear jeans, then I'm wearing boots, and these are it. I love these boots. Comfortable from day one, they're long lasting, they look good, what more can you ask for? Highly recommended.
Bought this shoe for my son. He was amazed at the comfort. Good shoe

Angel II is a slightly improved (more graceful-looking) version of a versatile old favorite. It is almost a flat but looks enough like a classic heel to endear itself to those of us who can't endure anything higher. And it comes in a welcome range of widths and colors.
I found this shoe an excellent fit (true to size) and very comfortable. Would recommend them to all.

I've had a pair of isotoners for maybe 20 years now, they were coming apart and I needed a new pair. I like to wear them on trips, as they can fit in any crack in my suitcase. These were a perfect replacement, and even a bit more comfortable than my original pair.
I like them, however, the fit is a little big. The draw back is they only come in whole sizes and I find they run wide also.
Fits right and allows me to dance better. The shoes are the same size as my street shoes. The price is half what is charged at the local dance store.

These are one of the most comfortable dress shoes I have ever worn. I normally wear tennis shoes being a nurse and so I know what is comfortable. I bought these softspots after buying two pairs of shoes that were just so uncomfortable and produced blisters. Now I am not going to dread wearing dress shoes and now make them my go to shoes.SoftSpots Women's Stephanie Pumps

I got exactly what I expected. A casual dress shoe of good quality. Goes good with jeans or khakies. If you have arch problems you will need an insert for the shoe has no arch support. The shoe is flat inside. Yes I recommend this shoe and with normal use I expect it to last 18 - 24 months.

My husband wears 10.5 and those shoes do not have 1/2 sizes. I got 11 and 10 to see which pair would fit, but neither one did. Otherwise, nice color selection and as much as I can tell nice quality. Rating of 3 due to sizing.

I have had these kind of shoes before and I had to have another pair. They are comfortable if you will be walking around for hours like at the fair or an amusement park. I am an RN and I am on my feet for the entire day, and I have worn them to work and have not felt strain on my knees or back or feet at the end of the day like with some shoes.

These boots are awesome! super comfortable and sturdy. I've had other snow boots and these are the best yet. The boots do look kind of chunky and they look one size bigger than other boots, but they fit perfectly, very true to size. I just can't wait to wear them in a snow day!

I loved absolutely everything about my pair of Keds - excellent throwback to my elementary school years - however, they were a tish too narrow for my big flippers so they had to be returned unfortunately.The yellow laces definitely gave the graphite color a pop that made the Keds cute and fun. I might hafta order this in a wider size... :D

I recently bought the 4th pr of classics for walking. the fit is great. colors b/w or gry look good w/all.my 3rd pr (way ovr 400 mi) & the 5th pr will be classics. used also for fishing, yard work, shopping,driv-ing; everyday. Soon as we get our price #5 will be ours. Confidence.

I love my new keds, Ive never owned a pair, only heard about them/seen them. I have worn them off and on for the last 4 months and have to say them feel awesome and look great with just about everything!

I decided to try the Green Silence because I wanted to see what impact, if any, a lightweight shoe would have on my times. I picked the Green Silence for the "eco friendly" concept, and because of the crazy color scheme. Not really an informed purchase.I'm a 6'- 3", 190 lb. guy, so I'm not small. I've been running on Nike Zoom Vomeros for the past two years and didn't think that I'd find a shoe that would offer me as much comfort as the cushioning found in the Vomeros. I was very happy to find that despite their light weight and minimalist design, that the Green Silence offered the necessary amount of cushioning. I was also pleased with the large toe box. I've used them for 3 runs so far. My thoughts:Run #1, speed work, 6 x 400's:My feet felt more... nimble? Without the weight of my typical shoe weighing me down, I felt like the speed work was much easier. This was my first effort with these shoes. I ordered size 13 (I usually wear size 12 in Nike), and it was perfect. NO blisters after my first run. Total of 5 miles, including the 6 x 400.Run #2, tempo run, 5 miles:This is where I expected to start to complain about the more minimalistic design. Nope. My feet felt great, still no blisters. I also noticed that I'm not landing on my heel the way I was before.Run #3, long slow run, 10 miles:I still can't believe that these are a lightweight shoe. The cushioning provided a great ride for the entire run. At the end of 10 miles I felt like I could have kept going for another 10. Finally, a blister on the front of my big toe, never had that one before... I still think ordering the size bigger was the right decision though.I would definitely recommend these shoes.

Super stylish and comfortable. Great choice for traveling and going through TSA security checkpoints at the airport. Easy slip on and off. I own these in both black and brown. Love them, but unfortunately, I can only rate these shoes 4 out of 5 stars because I stand on my feet all day at work. I started a new job about a year ago which requires standing all day. These shoes were well broken in long before then. At the end of the first day in which I wore these to work, my feet were killing me. I will still wear them, but only for travel and during off time.
shoes fit very well and came very quicklythey look good toogood job on these shoes im very happy with these shoes
These shoes look great, fit great, are comfy, but the stitching at the tongue started coming apart after wearing 3 times!

The service from American Athletics is poor. The shoes were the wrong size but they refused to refund the postage and wanted to charge postage again to resend the correct size. Won't be shopping there again.
Being a Santa these shoes ar GREAT! They take me back to my childhood and what I do now. How fun. I get so many complaments.Thanks so much for making such a great product.

Since I wear a size 13 wide, my choices are limited. These are very confortable. The leather ties keep coming undone, even when double tied. Not quite as nice as real lambs wool, but good for the price.
Took on a trip, but needed some break-in time. Caused some discomfort on my bunion. But I am sure they will be fine because I have two other pairs that I love.
These shoes do not have the moving air pocket that the old classic DMX has. I would not reccomend them

This is my fifth pair of ballistic so far. I bought my first ones about 14 years ago and was immediately satisfied with their confort. This is a product of excellent quality that, on average, tends to last more than 3 years without breaking apart. Please, keep in mind that I do use them often and I am not a sedentary person. They are a bit tall compared to other sneakers, but that has never been a problem. Really confortable and highly recommended.

my son bought these with his own money and we were disappionted to find out the sizes run very large. Wasn't made very well, sides began falling apart. Wouldn't buy this one again. Did arrive quickly.

Well in one of the descriptive pictures the bottom of the shoe is all black! The shoes I received were a brown rubber color on the bottom of the shoe. Also in another picture, the shoe inside is white and the shoes I received were blue inside. They are not as comfortable as a pair of keds that I owned years before.

Bought these boots for extreme cold weather use. I am familiar with Danner boots from my military service and can't say enough good things about Danner products. Once again Danner delivered on Quality. These boots are expensive but worth every cent I paid. They keep my feet warm, they required no break in period, and they are extremely comfortable. You can buy cheaper but you won't buy a better product.
Not as comfortable as the world walking classic shoe . i would recommend the latter although the pro walker is less money
I had been looking for navy sandals in my hard to find size for about a year. Finally found them, but decided canvas close toe shoes looked better with skirts. Service was good.
I wanted red converse sneakers and could only find them at this merchant online--they were priced below $30 and arrived in less than three days looking just as described.
Made in China as I thought...when are we going to start making things in the USA than we wouldn't have to buy things over and over cause they would last!!
Very comfortable sandals that have lasted through the season and provide a welcome bottle opener. Will buy another pair when they wear out.

As a nursing student I'm required to wear white shoes for clinicals. Trying to find plain white shoes in a 4E width was nearly impossible. I looked for weeks locally in stores, only to be confronted with certain brands that cost over $125! The Propet shoes not only fit my foot, but fit my budget at half the cost of the shoe store. Very comfortable and they look good, too.
I liked these shoes a lot. I ordered them a little big, and they are holding up quite well.

I ordered these for a little boy as part of a Christmas package for a non-profit that helps parents get gifts for their chidlren due to crisis each holiday season. I have long, very narrow feet = size 12.5 + (but less than size 13). Sperry size 13 Medium is not a good fit for me because it is too lose.Sperry "12.5 B" size is a true 12.5 "Narrow" last. I've had a few different pairs of hiking boots over the years. These are great boots. I've had them for almost 2 years and everything is holding up. In fact, if I clean the outsides, they look brand new. I wear them almost every day.I've had them in 4" of water and my foot has never got wet. I've walked through the muddy clay that we have here in East TN with no problem (the same mud that tore my Vasque's to pieces).As far as comfort goes, they are as comfortable as house shoes. They were just a little stiff, but not like other boots you have probably owned in the past.I'd say for the money I paid for these, they were a great value.

Ok, I'm 47- and a professional female - probably heading back to my 2nd childhood - um - if I ever left childhood completely in the first place?Anyway, I hadn't had a pair of Converse Hi-Tops since I was around 12 years old. I had seen some of the more "artsy" ones, but could never find my size (average foot)when I was looking...and I knew I wouldn't be able to wear them to work if they were "artsy" Converse - because they are, after all, athletic shoes.I decided to buy the completely black Hi-tops...and they are great. They are comfortable, even on my 47 year old feet. I really like them a lot. I Love the look of these shoes, however they heel is extremely hard and the left shoe of my black pair has an annoying squeak in it.

Softspots Women's Trinidad Slip-OnLast year I ordered a size 9 in this shoe. It was a too big but I used a sole insert and a heel pad which solved the problem. The shoes wear well and are comfortable. This year I ordered the same shoe style in size 8 1/2 thinking it would fit perfectly. It was so tight I could not get it on.
