Like this shoe. It's my third pair. Recommend it for comfort and support. HFC Why are you requiring me to say 6 more words?

This is my 2nd pair of Betula Birk's. I had to replace my last pair due to an aggressive chewer (puppy). Summer is not bearable to me without these sandals. I love the 3 straps. I always want the 3 straps as it makes the shoe less likely to ever slip out from under you.

use ONLY these shoes to work in-- i own a child care business so i'm on my feet alot plus need the added support & other benefits of the stability walker-- like most propet products (i've got a number of different styles), they all enable orthotics to be used with or without at least one of the 2 insoles that come with their shoes.... get a size large enuff to accommodate your orthotic PLUS the shock absorber insole; just remove the liner insole that has no support, etc to it and you'll be alot happier! without the shock absorber insole.... well.... it's NOT fun! also, LOTS of toe room-- i went up from a 7 1/2 reg width to an 8 wide width (also use athletic socks) and it's perfect!
I purchased a pair size 7 1/2. The ones I received were labeled 7 1/2 but were at least 8 1/2 shoes. These shoes are very narrow.
Walking shoes arrived timely and in good shape. Compared to the cross trainer's of the exact same size, they are less comfortable and tighter on my foot (size 2E)
What about those of us that have smaller feet? This is the first I have seen that there are no size6?? I would love to buy these but a 7 is too big!

I ordered based on the size - 39 is US 8. Well, the shoe is at least 2-3 inches too large, and 1-2 inches too wide. I do have slightly wide feet but these are really wide. I'm not sure who said it ran small but I would need maybe a 37 - 38 in this shoe.
They were a last minute Christmas gift. They came so quickly, the size was normal, the color fun, he loved them.

I am anywhere from a size 8 to 9.5 in U.S. Men's shoes. I initially ordered a medium, but changed my mind to a small (and Amazon customer service was very obliging in helping me with this). I'm glad I did because small was the correct choice. The split toe fills the shoe nicely and allows for some length adjustment. I much prefer the Woodlore shoe tree over a couple Jos. A Banks shoe trees I have that don't have the split toe and instead work on a spring system, which is currently rather rigid and difficult to maneuver. I can get this shoe tree in and out with total ease.

I'm on my fifth day of wearing them.. They are just now starting to break in and they are becoming even more comfortable. They don't seem to be clarks best quality by any means.. but for the price, you can't beat it.
Excellent shoes, very confortable and they look good. Exactly what you would expect from clarks. Would recomend them to anyone looking for a light and confortable everyday shoe.
This shoe is cute, but not comfortable. You need to order a size larger than usual. It is chunkier than I thought, but I couldn't beat it for the price.

This is a gorgeous shoe and extremely comfortable. Anne Klein style is evident--it's a very luxe-looking shoe. Fantastic bargain and they run true to size.Update 2nd season (18 mos after purchase): the very filmy plastic-like material covering the heels of these shoes has started to peel away, starting at the sole of the heel. I have given them some fairly regular use, but I would not have anticipated this as the leather uppers still look beautiful--nearly new! Truly tragic :(I realize there may not even be any of these left on the market, but the info may be an indicator of the quality of other shoes by the same maker.

I can't find a single thing to complain about with these shoes. They're comfortable, flexible, lightweight, and stylish. The sole provides a lot of grip (I don't play soccer in them but the floors at my work are often wet and I don't slip and fall). You can get the classic kind or the originals kind (only difference I can tell is the length of the tongue, I have no preference). The laces that came with mine are the perfect length, the shoes fit like a glove. Many say they run small, but I do believe they have wide feet, because the Sambas have a sort of average or almost narrow design. Either way they fit me perfect when I ordered my normal size. These shoes last a long time, I have owned a few pairs now. I wear them until they die which is everyday for about a year. They have many different colors to choose from, but they all look good. They can be casual shoes or dressed up just a tad (they're athletic shoes, not dress shoes) but they look good with jeans or shorts. Overall great shoes, Amazon has a great price for them. I highly recommend them!
This is a xmas gift for my husband...They came quickly and are perfect. They were the best price(46$) and I am very happy with my purchase.

UPDATE!! Though I didn't get what I originally purchased, Extreme Footwear was wonderful in that they rushed the correct pair to me. I purchased the Naturalizer shoe, Scout, Since I already have bought 4 or 5 pr Naturalizer shoes through Amazon, I knew the quality of the shoe, and what service to expect and I have not bee disappointed. Easily, a 5-star experience!

I purchased these off Amazon for $54 a couple years ago. After a year and a half of shopfloor walking the insides had worn off and the steel plate started rubbing my toes and ruining socks. Still look good though.

I'm here to buy another pair. These were comfortable from the first time I put them on. I wear them all the time and these were my primary pair of shoes while traveling to several countries recently. Never once did my feet hurt (and that's rare indeed when walking on precarious surfaces for long periods of time). I wish they offered even more options like a black swede. With proper care, these boots are nearly indestructible. Comfortable, easy to break in, with soles that barely seem to wear down--even after years of walking all over the earth.

...I've been wearing Chuck Taylor's (both in low and hi tops) for well over 30 years now. I remember when they were far, far cheaper than they are today, and the mainstay colors were much easier to find (i.e., black, gray, canvas, blue and red), but I don't intend for this to be one of those "in my day, you could go out to dinner and movie for a nickel" type of reviews.The bottom line - these are great, comfortable shoes. I usually wear mine as they were originally intended - for use in the gym. Specifically, these are excellent, economical shoes to wear when doing certain weight-lifting/body-building routines such as deadlifts, squats and overhead presses (among the majority of my routines). Perhaps the next best thing to doing those routines bare-footed (outside of the much more expensive Vibram Five Fingers KSO - Men's). Particularly when used only in the gym, these shoes last forever. Even when they are worn daily, out and about, they still hold up amazingly well. An absolute favorite of mine.Highly recommended.

These boots are the best women's boot I have found! I have owned 3 pair over the last 6 years.I believe they may run a bit big (my feet could be shrinking). I usually were a 8 in most sneakers and shoes. I have worn both the 8 and 7.5 in these. The 8 provide a bit more room for heavy socks.I am a merchant mariner and spend endless hours on my feet and unforgiving steel decks. These boots are very comfortable with the dura shock souls. The anti slip souls are amazing and have saved me from slipping on deck many times.I usually treat the leather and then put waterproofing spray on them. It helps but they aren't waterproof if you step in a puddle of course. After sweating or getting wet the leather color will come off onto your sock.I highly recommend these boots!
This Teva sandal is great. It is so comfortable that you don't know you're even wearing it. It looks super with all sorts of clothes - casual to dressy.

I have been chasing grouse, pheasant and quail (when we used to have them) all over Missouri, Kansas, Iowa and South Dakota for 30 years. I have had numerous boots over the years, Red Wing, Cabela's Kangaroo, Rocky, Irish Setter,etc. I have had some good ones but nothing compares to this Danner boot. I wanted something that wouldn't take long to break in and I preferred something made in America. I got both with this boot. They felt like a 10 year old boot the first time I wore them .... that's a good thing. Pretty pricey but I don't jack around when it comes to my feet.

I have been a fan of Converse since the day I saw Will Smith unpack a brand new pair in the movie iRobot. I wanted one for myself, where else amazon is the best place to buy. The Product price is very affordable except the shipping and handling costs. They are a bit high to Sri Lanka. Would be great if they are low too.
Bought this through amazon. Love this shoe . bought a taupe and a black pair. They have good arch support and can wear with dress or slacks..

This is a fantastic touch up for your car interior. Be sure to combine it with the deglaser to make sure the application works most successfully. This made my near pristine classic look tremendous.

These thick wool insoles are the best thing to come by this winter.I put them in my loose slippers and my feet are 10 times warmer which makes me warmer. I also got a pair for my mud boots. Just call me toastie toes! Finally! These are nice and thick, not whimpy.
These boots are great. My husband swears it's like not wearing shoes at all. They are tough and withstand his job as a groundsman for a tree company. Outstanding. You can't go wrong with Tims.
These shoes are comfortable. I took a chance they would work, lucked out, great fit, look cute too. I wear them during the warmer months.

I got my Sanuk Vagabonds at a clearance store for $20. Having been told about them in near-legendary terms, I absolutely had to try them. They're extremely comfortable, possibly moreso than any other footwear I've had other than feyue shoes. Unfortunately, after 2 months of wearing them like I'd expect to wear any kind of sandals, the ball of my foot began to hurt. I took it off and noticed there was a big nasty bruise right on the ball of my foot. On the sandal, it had worn through more in just that spot than anywhere else. There's streaks of white showing in various spots on the shoes (sandals).I'm mitigating the issue by inserting a pair of Birkenstock insoles from a pair of clogs I used to wear. It's extended the life, but I have NO idea how anyone can get the 2-3 years they claim they get out of these unless they're wearing them for one day a week.
The handbag is very nice, very well made, looks good but it is a bit larger than the dimensions.
I bought these shoes about last year for $29+ and this month I purchased 3 pairs of my size at $9.99 each. WOW What a Steal!!!!!
Have tried many other boots but keep coming back to these. You cant beat the comfort for the price and they are always available when I need a new pair.

We bought these for our 5 year old but our 4 year old wanted the Merrell Chameleon in Wineberry. I have to say the Merrells look more comfortable as they're not as stiff, have a padded tongue, and fuller padding around the ankle. That all being said, the 5 year old loves these... because they're pink. The laces are difficult to tie as they are so slippery and tend to loosen up before you can get a good bow tied, especially for a young one just learning to tie. They are competent boots, which were hard to find for little girls. We used them on short hikes in a state park and they performed acceptably. Cannot comment on their waterproofness as we did not tromp through any water. If you have a little princess with her heart set on pink and a need for waffle-stompers, these will work.

These are my second pair of Hi Tec Altitude hiking boots, and they are even better than the first pair. Better quality, better fit, better style, etc. I found a USED pair in my size at Amazon for half the regular price, so I bought them. There is nothing to show they were used. They are like new. Great deal!
I bought these for my husband after a lot of searching for hikers. He found them comfortable for shorter periods of time. They're weren't an "all day" wear shoe.
I ordered these boots because they say they are 12" but they are really 10". They are also made from thin leather.
Bought these for my husband. He prefers hi-tops but this was better than he expected. He does prefer hi-tops for ankle support.
I bought this pair of shoes not for soccer but for everyday use. It's quite comfortable and stylish. Pretty good for its price.
heavy duty durable boots , love the way they handle on my bike and there not rely heavy in wight ,and seriously they look good

I absolutely love Danner boots! This is my third pair in eight years and I am not easy on them! I am a State Trooper and my boots are a very important part of my uniform. They must be tough, comfortable, long lasting, and able to shine up like a new penny! These boots fit the bill in every area. Best of all, Amazon was $70 cheaper than every other place on the Internet....plus the shipping is free! When you ship them to rural Alaska, that is a BIG deal! Thank you Amazon for offering high quality products at great prices!
The shoes are great, and the shipping time was reasonable, as was the price. A warning: not all types can be shipped to Canada, which is frustrating to find out just as you're finishing up an order.
Ordered a size 10, received a size 10. In actuality, they are at least a size 12 or 13. Way too large but not expensive enough to bother with sending back.

I absolutely love this shoe! They are soo comfortable and look great on. I have flat feet so I have a hard time finding running shoes that fit me, infact I havent bought a pair of running shoes in almost 3 years because I havent found any that fit right. I tried this brand on at a department store and loved them, but not the price. So when I found these on amazon I had to have them and am sooo glad that I did!!! Recommend them to anyone and everyone!!!
love the Birkenstock brand. This style I wear a 38 and this style runs 1/2 size too big, even with thick socks. A little disappointing.

I've read other reviews of this shoe and they haven't been good. So I bought a pair.The shoes fit fine. They're comfortable and hold your foot. They're true to size and are supported by a kind of double strap around the ankle. If you like thin straps, don't buy them. You won't like the look. However, I found them appealingly comfortable, snug and attractive. Didn't miss the conventional vertical strap on the side at the ankle. The double strap compensates for this. They'll take a little time to work in. I wore them all day and the only issue I had was the vertical strap in the back of the foot. It dug in a little after eight hours of wear.
I got this at my overseas address in 48 hours! wow. It is well priced. These are lightweight and very comfortable shoes. However, the front side changed its shape after a couple of months.

Not many shoe companies bother to make different widths. That's amazing considering that millions live in this country alone and they can't all have the same feet width. The extra width means I no longer get corns and blisters. Plus the show is very good. I'm stuck on New Balance.
These shoes are cute and match outfits very well, but I think that they forgot about comfort. If you plan on walking around for awhile, these are not the sneakers to do it in.
I bought two pairs of these shoes, black croc and brown croc. They are so comfortable and I wear them so much that the black ones are nearly worn out and I will order another pair soon.

Granted, at first glance one may not be too impressed with the looks of these shoes. I was one of these people. However, on a trip to Maine, I needed a pair of shoes that would serve well on land as well as in the water on trails and on the oceans. That being said, I discovered the true toughness and comfort of these shoes. I even hiked up a 3,000 foot mountain in these things and they still exhibit modest wear on the soles and around the entire shoe. This was extremely rocky and rugged terrain to boot and would not advise this as the primary terrain to tackle with Crocs.SIZINGI am a true 10.5 in mens. However, 10 was definitely too small and uncomfortable for me, so I bought size 11 since there are no half sizes. From this discovery, it is safe to say that Crocs are pretty true to size. 11s are a little big on me, but the strap still locks my foot in place and it does not feel like my foot is coming out of the shoe if I am not using the strap. The foam material Crocs are made from grips your feet pretty well, even when wet or sweaty.COMFORTThere are not many shoes, even shoes I've spent over $100, that can match Crocs in comfort. I could wear these shoes all day and my feet would not hurt or blister while on the trails. On a regular day out, same story. For summer, they are great because air is constantly able to flow through and cool your feet. When they get wet, I mean completely soaked, they usually will dry off within about 5 minutes.STYLEThese are really not as ugly as people think. Once you wear them and get them on, they really start to grow on you both on how they look and how they feel. People who say they hate these shoes are those who have never put a pair on and worn them (I was one of these people). As far as colors go, white and lighter colors seem like they will definitely get dirty easily. I have black and they are easy to clean of, just a rinse and rub down with a rag.The main thing is people just have to have an open mind when purchasing this style of footwear. They are a little unorthodox but they are high quality, functional, and as bad looking as people think. They are so easy just to slip on and they are featherweight and easy to walk in. I use them a lot for just getting the mail or going to the gym before I put my gym shoes on. I have been pleasently surprised with Crocs' resilience and highly recommend these bad boys.

It's a Chuck Taylor through and through. Not much support but I don't care. These were for my son and he wears a custom orthotic anyway. So we just dropped it in and he was good to go. He wore these with his tux for the prom. He was stylin' and comfortable. I do recommend going up 1/2 size if you have narrow feet and a full size if you have a medium width because they run a bit short.

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE COLOR THEY WOULD HAVE GONE RIGHT BACK.THEY ARE DRESSY ENOUGH FOR WORK ON IN CLEMENT DAYS BUT THAT HARD FOOT BASE ALMOST GOT THESE A 1 STAR RATING.

I ordered my daughter the orange Crocs for her birthday. They arrived in two days in time for her to open for her big day. They broke within an hour of wearing. I am so disappointed. I have to find out how and if I can return them. What a hassle!
I was hoping that the charcoal would be a little darker. But it was not. I will keep them but now I know that when it say charcoal it means a light gray not a dark gray.

I have had several pairs of these boots over the years and liked them. The most recent pair had a manufacturing defect that was biting thre inside of my left ankle. I had to lace them so loose that the support was inadequate. I guess with Chinese children making boots you can't expect perfection.
I bought these for a gift. The recipient loved them. Apparently it is hard to find the half sizes in stores with this shoe. No complaints with these.

These shoes are way hip and since they're hightops, my kid can't kick them off in the carseat! I haven't heard any complaints about comfort from him either. They have held up through two sons and are a little faded from frequent washing, but look all the cooler for it.
Very cute flat shoe. If your feet tend to swell however I would order a wide width. Other than that the shoe looks great with jeans or capri pants!

These shoes were for my wife, and I can only tell you what she tells me. She spends 14 hours a day in them as she works at the local hospital, and she's always on her feet, so she needs well made shoes.They are good shoes, and offer good support, BUT the sole liner ALWAYS come out, or shifts it's position in these shoes. These are the third pair she's owned of this brand and style, and this has happened to all of them. Obviously, a design flaw. And, this third pair does pinch in the toe area, even though they are wide.Good shoes, but not the best. She is looking for something better.
These flips are the best! Comfy and cute! Plus, if they get dirty I just throw them in the washer!

I ordered the timberland Boat Shoes from Amazon. I like to moccassins in the house, slipping them off for out door shoes. These were exactly as described and pictured, Fit just right and have the thick soles I like.Often the size is not exact [or at least doesn't conform to other shoe vendors sizes) but these shoes fit as do most other shoe orders I have placed. These required no "break-in" as some moccassins do.Just as important to me is the shape of the shoe and quality of the shoe materials. Just what I expected from the listing
got this shoes because of the reviews that i read regarding how comfy it is. well, its comfy!

I have always been reluctant to buy shoes on-line but I decided to give it a try. Thanks to all of you wonderful Amazon customers who took the time to describe your experience and give your honest feedback! I have a very high arch and instep and many shoes will not fit over my foot. Also, in some shoes I wear one size and in some another size. I took a chance and bought what is usually my "regular size". They fit perfectly. With the adjustable straps, my instep problems are solved. But most of all, when I put them on the first time, my instant response was "Ahhhhhhh" - they are so very comfortable right out of the box. No "breaking in" at all. They have become by favorite summer shoes and while some sandals are only for casual wear, these are nice enough to wear anywhere. Delivery was on time as advertised and they even included easy return instructions and pre-paid return label. Fortunately, I didn't have to use it.

The men's New Balance 574 has been around for many years. It's a 'retro' style in that it's based on an older style and comes in MANY different color combinations for the fashion-forward thinkers out there. They look vastly different than the current crop of 'minamalist' running shoes every shoe manufacturer is producing.Fashion aside, the New Balance 574 is actually a pretty decent running shoe. I've had them before many times over and they fit the shape of my foot perfectly. I do, in fact, use them for actual running. I put about 5-10 miles a week on them and they are durable, supportive, and well-cushioned. They are, however, based on 'old-shoe' technology and I've added Superfeet green insoles now that I've gotten older(see my review here on Superfeet for more information).In all fairness, most running shoes - even the high-dollar, current crop -have very poor insoles in them from the factory. The reason I've been told is because there's little 'shelf-appeal' with an insole! The only shoe I've found lately that doesn't need any help is the New Balance 990-series. Those shoes, however, are now in the $140-150 range and out of my budget.Try on a New Balance 574 the next time you're in a shoe store. Yeah... they may be marketed as a 'fashion' shoe now, but they are actual RUNNING shoes from a day when running shoes were meant to do one thing well - perform!Jae

Love the look of these shoes - a stylish stand out. As usual I bought a half-size bigger (a nine to my normal 8.5). It's a narrow shoe and fits snugly, and I got blisters on my instep during my first 10 miler. Having run 50+ road miles on them, they're broken in and are now quite comfy. I expected a softer landing with more bounce (maybe I'll try the Megabounce next time?), but overall I'm pleased with the Gigardide. They look cool enough to wear with jeans and should be great for trampling through airports and malls.
I like it very much. It is so comfortable. I'd like to wear it all the summer. The speed is very fast and the shoe just what I want
My granddaughter asked for these at Christmas. She thinks they are awesome and can't wait to wear them to school in the new year.

The quality is exactly the same as the ones that we purchase at the dance school for almost a quarter of the price. My daughter has been using the Capezio line of Ballet Shoes ever since she started dance and we have found them to be very sturdy and long lasting. All my daughter cares about really is that they are cute, of course :)

Some guys I work with on my Army dive team swear by these as dive booties because you can take your fins off and move out cross country without having to stop and put on boots. I bought a pair to try out and thought they were ok. I have kind of a wide foot and low arches so this shoe isn't really made for my foot.

I've worn my previous pair for hiking in California and the Swiss Alps, in rain and shine, and my only complaint is that I would have liked a more rigid sole for the rougher terrain. Other than that i can't fault the comfort or durability. I got the second pair because although the first has lots of life left, I would hate to have to look around for something this good at this good a price again!

The ballet shoes are very nice, but not true to size. My granddaughter (age 4) wears a size 7, I ordered a 7.5 to give her room to grow, and they were too small! Some advice about the sizing would have been helpful. Now we have to send them back.
I bought my first pair of Rockport Prowalkers in 1993 and wore them 1-2 days/week since then. I cannot believe how long they've lasted and how comfortable they are. The new pair are great.

I love UGG boots...this pair is my second. However, I am not happy with EastBay, the shipper. They shipped me the wrong product and then took three and a half weeks to send me the right product. I had to continuously email them about the status of the shipment...very annoying. I love the boots though...so soft and comfortable.

This company sells shoes made from the hides of animals; in fact, the majority of shoes they offer for sale through amazon are dead animal skins. If it looks and smells like an animals' hide, and, it comes from a company who sells shoes made from the skins of once living animals - I'm not buying it. A shoe marketed as "vegan" won't cause us to overlook the fact they sell products made from slaughtered animals.

I got these sneakers for my husband after months of searching in stores. New Balance must not make them too much anymore. Anyway, our entire family owned a pair at one point and we must say it is by far the most comfortable, lightweight sneakers we have ever worn. Considering the price and comfort it is an excellent deal.

I should have ordered this as a size 12 or 11 1/2 if available but I still likeed the shoe and still have them for around the house lounging around but not good for any strenuous sport because of snug because of size, not the shoe.

I have worn Keds for over 50 years and I love them. The last pair I had had something different about the instep that wasn't as comfortable as usual but his pair is wonderful! I like them because they're not bulky like a lot of the sneakers out there now!

I've owned various colors of this shoe over the years. They are classic and comfortable. They feel a little tight when you first try them on, but they always stretch to fit your feet like a glove. Great shoe!

No one wants to look like a soup sandwich and these work well at keeping my uniform shirt tucked tight. Occasionally they will come unfastened. Also, the adjustable buckle stabs me in the leg when I get in the car ....... and sometimes I like the pain.

I tried these boots on locally and ordered them here. I like the boots. My feet get cold so I like the 1000 grams of thinsulate. The soles are plenty hard and a little slick in my tree stand but that is not a big deal. These are definitely cold weather boots, not for hiking as much as they are for sitting on stand. They seem well build like all Danner's so I think they will hold up. I would buy them again!

These shoes felt good on my feet right out of the box - no break in time required. The actual shoe looks just like the picture on line. They are lighter in weight than I expected, which I consider a plus. Build quality appears to be really good. Highly recommended.
Yaktrax work great and are easy to put on. I don't feel so old now going hiking in the winter is easier.

Love these flip flops. They are so comfortable. This is my second pair. I wear them about everyday during the spring and summer. These and the Reef Lounger are awesome. You don't want to ever take them off.. They are a must for the summer!!!

I purchased from the photo. was in a hurry that day. Glad they where the low ones he wanted. novelty item. My son wanted them , he is 30 yrs old. A fun item he used to have many years ago. the size recomendations was correct. 1/2 size smaller was just right.... Not the Hi Tops they state in the add.

These boots are an excellent value. They are comfortable, provide great heel and ankle support, good grip, and keep your feed warm and dry in cold climates.Purchased a pair for a vacation in New Brunswick, Canada. These boots kept my feet dry and comfortable the whole time, even while snow shoeing and hiking across a snow covered beach front. Didn't slip once in them, though I encountered ice a few times.Very good purchase!

All i can say is these shoes get "action"! I bought my pair of Hi-tech hiking boots because this is the boots i trust , when i'm packing my big bucks, big boars,ect. The traction is great and my socks doesn't get wet! Mahalo Hi-Tech!

After seeing all the reviews about this shoe, I wanted to actually physically try on a pair before buying to make sure of the size. I love these shoes. They're comfortable and just great. I just wanted to post about the size difference I experienced. I have been wearing size (male) 10.5 for years now. I've bought many different shoes from different brands and this is always my style. After trying on many pairs of these shoes I finally found my size for these shoes. 8.5. A full two sizes lower! 8 was too tight and 9 was a bit too big.

I got very tired of having a big old "george costanza" wallet and i always kept my wallet in the front. So i decided to get a front wallet. its awesome and perfectly fits. Feels great. looks great. Great recommend.

I BOUGHT THESE FOR MYSELF. I LOVE THEM AND I WEAR THEM ALL THE TIME. I'M 51 YEARS OLD SO YOU'RE NEVER TOO OLD FOR THEM. THEY'RE COMFY AND I WOULDN'T GIVE THEM UP FOR ANYTHING. MATTER OF FACT, I HOPE TO GET SOME RED ONES REAL SOON!!

I have had these slippers a couple months and we have experienced a lot of cold weather. The slippers are warm, comfortable and provide stable support IMO for a slipper. The workmanship in the footwear is excellent and the materials high quality. I am more than satisfied although cheaper slippers are available if you buy these you will not be sorry in my opinion. I have a wide foot and wear a 10.5 EEE or EEEE in my shoes. I ordered a size 11 EEE and they fit excellent although as anticipated they were tight till broken in.

Love these shoes - could not find them in ther stores in my area. They hae every color but white. Have a pair but they are really old and wanted a pair that looked nicer. The shoes are comfortable and they look a little more dressy than the normal tennis shoe. Paid a little more than the price at our stores but, they are worth the extra cost.

I have in-turned ankles and I use these shoes with my ankle supports. Not many shoes will enable me to walk in comfort with additional arch/ankle supports inserted in the shoes, but these will. It is comfort for both feet!Update May 15,2012: I bought the original pair in 2008, they are still good, albeit somewhat worn. I just purchased my second pair, and I retired the original pair for garden work only. I am pleased with both pairs of these shoes.
I wore my old black ones out and the navy were a great deal (under $20). Super comfortable, exactly what I expected.

After breaking my ankle several years ago, my physical therapist recommended these shoes. They were immediately comfortable from the first moment I put them on - no breaking in period. I wore them for 3 years, even after they were long past their useful life, because I couldn't find another pair in stores. After looking them up online, I ordered a second new pair and couldn't be happier. Perfect for my sometimes unstable ankle and tendency to pronate, cushy and comfortable.

the color is adorable, exactly what i want. however they run REALLY big! usually i wear a size 7.5, I've seen a lot of reviews complaining that they run big so i ordered a size 6 (ONE AND A HALF SIZE DOWN). Guess what they still run big!

These shoes are awesome! My son has a high instep and regular soccer cleats were way too tight. He couldn't even get his foot in a whole size larger. These cleats are wide enough that he slips his foot right in but are not too wide that he loses the feel of the ball. I highly recommend these shoes for children with wide feet or high insteps.

These shoes are comfortable, and the price was right. They run a little smaller per size than the Aetrex Rhino Runner which I reviewed earlier, and are not quite as comfortable to me, but I would buy another pair when these are worn out. Nice to have a black shoe for comfort wear sometimes, instead of wearing the more flashy Rhino Runner. They seem to be holding up well.

They are very good quality construction. They provide good support. The shoe fits well.They are Superior in comfort to my "dress shoes" but not quite what I had expected from a "walking shoe". After upgrading the inserts, it became a very comfortable shoe but still did not offer the shock absorption expected. I would buy them again but my expectations are changed.

I love the previous pair of janet sandals that I purchased about 6 years ago, but the newer ones were not true to size overall for me. i was saddened to return what I thought was a welcomed replacement for my very worn favorite.
These shoes are as soft and black as my heart is. Much more comfortable and sexy than hi tops IMHO. They'll make your feet smell, though.
These shoes are great for the price. They are light and they let your feet breathe easily. Only con is there is no arch support so after wearing the for a while my feet hurt badly.

These shoes are so comfortable, The first time I put them on they felt great. The heel is a little narrow on the top so, if you have wide feet they hang over the heel a little, but, it didn't change my mind about keeping them. If you are considering these Go for it!! Great price too!!

I really like the style of these shoes. I like the fact that I can slip them on and off easily without having to untie the laces. However, they are slightly uncomfortable to walk in after a short while. My other Skechers Seige shoes are much more comfortable.

These shoes were a birthday present for my 4yo. Based on reviews, I decided to buy one shoe size up from her current shoe size to be safe. She went up a size right before her birthday and they fit perfect. They match street shoe size as recommended. Great shoes at a great price!

Only saving grace for these shoes is how sharp they look. They are horribly uncomfortable and blistering. I own similar sperry's and never once had a similar issue.I strongly reccomend you buy sperry's instead
The product arrived on time and in excellent condition. No complaints or concerns. The leather is a little tight at first but it stretches with time. The size is true.

For over 25 years I have relied on Softspots for casual wear. The shoes are durable and very comfortable. Great for travel and slip off going through airport security. The range of color choices (black, navy, brown, taupe) add a plus.
These shoes are so comfortable. They never need a "break in" period. I have several pairs and they wear beautifully! Even pairs that I purchased years ago look great!

Great product, my daughter loves them and she learned to put them on by herself, my only issue is that one of the buttons that holds the straps was continually breaking loose, had to use a strong glue to keep it together, other than that I'm happy with the product and the shipping was very fast too.

Although I like these Malibu sandals, they are bigger than the Life Stride "Milani" sandals I bought a few years ago at Macy's. I just bought this Bostonian Tahoe Oxford shoe and was very pleased how quickly it was delivered. I like buying online since I buy wide shoes and not every store carries a great selection. These shoes did come in a wide version and they fit great.....
Good traction, and you can feel where your foot is in relation to the ground. The laces are secure and don't flop around.Very good product.

This was the second time we ordered Pink Converse Shoes for my daughter, the first time I didn't get the size right. I returned them to "Shoes R Us" I think it was called and they took care of my mistake very quickly. Unfortunately they didn't have the size I needed so I ordered a replacement pair from Last Pairs. They came quickly, fit perfectly and were reasonably priced, the same as our local mall, without the hassle! Very good experience overall, would recommend.

I need a dress shoes without heels due to a bad back. These shoes were sold out at the local shoe, but Amazon saved the day! A perfect fit with soft leather uppers and patent leather toe and heel, goes perfectly with pants or skirts. The very first time I purchased shoes online and it was a success!

From the description and prior reviews, I was expecting a supportive, comfortable shoe of modest weight. My current preferred shoe of this type is the S.A.S shoe ("Bout Time model) that sells for twice or more the price. But it wears very well and is comfortable out of the box, which is to say it supports the foot well, and is moderately light weight. The uppers on the Hush Puppy shoes look nice, but the sole has a much larger outline than the shoe itself, which is to say, the edge noticeably sticks out. The shoe is quite heavy (compared to SAS and others). The inner support doesn't support my feet as well (less arch support). And, my foot move around in the shoe even though the size seems correct in terms of toe placement. I'll likely send them back.

These shoes didn't cost much, and there's reason: they're not worth much. I'm not saying they're bad, just Ok.These are the kind of leather shoes that always manage to look like vinyl (they're supposed to be leather); that don't quite ever break in properly; that grip, but not enough; that fit, but a bit clumsily; that aren't hot, just not comfortable. And The support is just all wrong. A six inch boot is problamatic to start with, so the collar (at the ankle) has to be made well: These are too wide, as is the last hieght inside the shoe, from the top of the toe to the top of the toe box, to the arch; just too roomy in all the wrong places, and my feet are dead average. I wear them, they look fine, but if I dont lace the last two lugs (from the arch to the ankle) outside, the collar will eat my ankles alive. In the end, I'm afraid they look and feel cheap.
there is not one single other item I would consider more vital to surviving an outbreak of the walking dead. these are a must have.

i am having trouble with my amazon orders i am still waiting for a bible tote i ordered in early june and have paid for. i ordered some crock shoes and got a double order and sent back a reply on this no responce .i like o order amazon things but have now stopped till it replys to my email on my wrong order also about my binble tote i ordered in early june . loretta bickle

I have to agree with L.Nesland. Shoe Goo is GREAT!!!!I bought Shoe Goo originally to repair some bicycling shoes(the heals were practically nonexistent) I found that using saliva on my finger tips keeps them clean while spreading it (you must remember I was not bonding, I was using it as an external surface). I use it to fix almost anything that needs physical enhancement. I haven't used the Goo to bond 2 surfaces together yet, but I'm SURE that it will work perfectly when I do. I agree that you should use petroleum jelly on the threads, my 1st cap broke(it glued itself to the tube threads)I haven't had that problem with my 2nd or 3rd tubes. I just finished repairing my 2nd pair of bicycle shoes. This time I'm building up the heal higher so I don't feel like I'm walking up hill. I'm glad the they came out with black, now you can use it on most dress shoes and they will still look like dress shoes. I found out (by accident) that if you want to change the color. Just after you finish spreading the goo, drip some candle wax the color you want over the goo. I had a Squirrel that was missing a leg, I made a cast of the existing leg with red wax. After the goo cured, and I took the wax off I noticed that the goo took the color of the red wax. NOW my Squirrel has a red prosthesis.
i got these shoes back in like early January and all ready the side is coming apart there is a open on the side. but there good shoes.
a few minutes at the computer with teenager, a couple of days latter=happiness! Thank you,

Wow, was I satisfied when I opened the box and slipped my foot into this shoe. Very sophisticated and extremely comfortable. I am looking forward to the warmer weather and know that this shoe will be a staple of my wardrobe whether dressing up or down.You can't miss with Donald Pliner. The quality and style are constants of his line.

I have to agree with all of the other reviews except the lone disgruntled one that this slipper has to be one of the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. I wear them everywhere, even shopping. I've had a number of compliments on how great they look. I can't wait to get another pair, hopefully in blue if they ever become available in my size. I purchased the boots for my 7 yr. old daughter. I really liked the quality and she is very pleased with them. Everytime we go somewhere, she wears them. So I know that she is pleased too! THese sandals met all my expectations. I purchased these for my mother-in-law who had worn out this exact style of shoe. She had not been able to find them in a store and was thrilled to have them replaced.
I got these for my son's 14th birthday. He was so excited he threw them on on the spot. He has worn them about a month now and they are still his favorites.

These shoes are really cute, I get compliments on them all the time . They are perfect for wearing to work because technically they are sneakers but they really are too "formal looking" for their secret to be revealed :)However, I have been wearing them for about a month and I have found two problems: 1) The back of the left shoe really cuts into my heel, making it somewhat raw and red if I walk around in these shoes all day (not heavy duty walking, just walking around in the office). 2) THEY SMELLLLLL!!!!!! I am really surprised no one has mentioned this yet. They do not breathe at ALL so they (and your feet) end up stinking so badly that it's embarrassing. I never have foot odor problems with any other shoes except for these. I can even smell how bad they are if I'm sitting at my desk with my foot (yes the shoes are on) crossed over my knee... Because of these two issues, I'm not sure I would have bought them in the first place... I still wear them occasionally simply because they are so cute, but honestly it is a sacrifice to do so!**Update - After reading some other reviews/comments on here, one reviewer suggested getting the Hue "hidden" liner cotton socks, so i went and bought some today to wear with these, and it makes the whole smell/sweat thing MUCH better... yay!

First of all I suggest 1/2 number less... if you compare it with adidas sneakers. The shoes are great, made with good materials, good design and very comfortable. I ordered these sneakers on black, but came gray on logo and the rear part, but there's no regret about it, looks so good. Definitely I recommend this item.

I have twin sons - both in soccer - one now wears black while the other wears silver. It helps the coaches tell them apart more quickly than looking at numbers :-). Both are wearing Adidas soccer shoes and seem to find them comfortable and I was pleased with the price. Go for it!
This is a great boot. Light with good arch support. I wear them in mud and rain and my feet are dry and warm. Well worth the money.

Having been an Easy Spirit fan for many years, I'm always looking for less-than-full price shoes. These "Motion" have been a consistently good buy, a great value shoe that holds up well, comfortable, polishes like new, and never separates at the seams. I wear the newest ones for outings, the older ones for around the house, the oldest ones for the garden. But I always watch for when they go for less than full price....because I know I will get great, consistent shoes.

I really wanted these shoes to work. But it's no use. The straps are too shallow for my instep...and somehow I don't feel I'm getting real support. In a way there is arch support but I like to actually feel the arch support and have less of a 'I'm wearing a cushion' feeling. As it is, for me it's like wearing a cushion while having my instep flattened by the strap.The search goes on! But if your feet are a different shape, I can see that these are soft and cute and might be great. I also happen to need real support for my feet, so this just doesn't work for me.
I have been looking for a black pair of Chucks for a long time and I love these shoes!
Exactly the same as what I was expecting. Size and color was perfect. It is nice to wear with skinny jeans.

I really like these shoes. They are pretty sturdy and not as lightweight and flexible as some trail shoes or sneakers. They also have about an inch of height where you won't get wet which is nice along the water's edge.
I've bought these Converse shoes (both navy and white) for my son. They came on scheduled time. He liked them, wear every day.

I live in these shoes. I wore out my first pair of black leather flats after a year of constant wear and immediately replaced them. Currently I have them in five colors: black western leather, silver leather, brown, green and red suede, and I'm getting two more pair in black suede and gold leather. Did I mention that I love these shoes? They are superlatively comfortable, look good with everything but the most formal outfits, and hold up well in wet weather. I've worn mine through a drenching thunderstorm, stuffed them with newspaper to help them hold their shape when they were drying and they came out looking like new. I buy them in my usual size and they fit great. They don't have anything in the way of arch support, but I've walked for miles in mine with no problem at all. This shoe is the gold standard of ballet flats. Wear them till you wear them out, then buy some more.Judy Lind
I like black sneakers best because you can pull them off going to casual social things like neighborhood parties, cookouts, etc. and they dont look dumpy.these are comforatable and break in nicely.

The style of this shoe is exactly what I was looking for. However, the size I ordered was too small and unfortunately it was not available in the size needed, so I had to return it and couldn't get another. Otherwise, I definitely would have kept it.
This shoes were the cristhmas gift to my best friend female, she liked them, so comfortable, cheap and originals in its style. Great product, recomended. My Best RegardsDavid

I am from New Zealand and buying this shoe all the way from USA was an extreme decision. I got this shoe in June 2011. I have been using it for the last few months and the following points are worth mentioning.1. Great balance and fit. though initially a bit tight and takes a bit of wearing for proper fit which is quite natural for leather.2. wear at the back heel at minimum which is a common problem for me and in some cases shoes may almost wear out in a month. (I walk to my work and return with is about daily 5kms)3. They are really waterproof! Not a even any moistness inside! Just wonderful4. Elegant and good looking!5. Worth the money spend including the $25 shipping! Will buy again the same brand and product!

kinda nice, but common coloured. Did,nt have the colour that I wanted in my size. Chocolate, sorta rare in this city. Many folks r with classic red that,s cool, though I like the chocolate chuck taylors best. Maybe i'll add another sumthin, shoe strings with prints.........

This shoe is aesthetically superior to anything on the market, particularly the latest version, a unrivaled gem which sports a navy blue faux-suede. If you don't actually want to PLAY basketball in these, definitely get a pair.However, if you're using the shoe for its intended purpose, I hope you have narrow feet and strong ankles. As a huge fan of the original T-Macs (didn't get the T-Mac 2's because they were too narrow), I was hoping that the 3's would restore my faith in the shoe. I'm a serious baller - I play just about every day and participate in 3 corporate/city leagues.That being said, after only owning these shoes for just three few weeks, I had to return them because I sprained BOTH ankles (never happened with the T-Mac 1's) AND severely bruised my medial and plantar nerves (never happened in my life - ever). Though ankle injuries are all too common in basketball, these injuries did not occur in the typical "landed on someone's foot" fashion, which is cause for serious concern. I consulted my podiatrist on the issue and she informed me that my shoes provided poor support and suggested I look into a pair of New Balances.Additionally, the outside of the shoe will dig into your ankle if you lace your shoes up tightly, as there is no cushioning around the top rim of the shoe.Proceed with caution - do not be wowed by looks, particularly if you need support or have wider feet.

The shoe looks great and is very comfortable. You can feel the support right away as you slip them on. Even while standing and stretching, I can feel the bounce in the "hole"ful sole. I've had these since October and I ran 10 to 20 miles a week since I've had them. They're still in good shape but in the past month or so (maybe at the 400 mile mark) my right heel has felt tender the day after a 3 to 4 mile run. My right knee also feels locked up as I finish up my run. I'm 6'0" and 195-200 lbs and I may be pounding my feet a little harder than the normal runner. I primarily run applying the interval training method (sprint-jog-sprint-jog...) so that may have something to do with it. I've also heard that getting the right pair of socks is also very crucial to a runner's comfort, not just the shoes. Surprise, huh?I bought this shoe when it was still priced at a full $125. FinishLine was having a promotion which I took advantage of and got it for $85 including shipping otherwise I'm not a fan of overpaying for products that perform the same as its lower-priced competitors. I'm a bit of a sneaker connoisseur so I know my kicks somewhat. My friend's orthopedist uncle has actually cut down the middle of running sneakers of a handful of the better known brands and has found that adidas are functionally better than Nikes but so is New Balance, Aasics, and Sauconys. Nike's are just damn expensive because they need to pay for Lebron's ad campaigns. I'm very intrigued to start running in Aasics and Sauconys but once I make the switch, I'll be excited to wear the Megabounces as casual shoes that I can wear around town.Like I said, they still look great!

I love the Breeze Walker sandal. I gave it 4 stars because they changed their sole. At least that is my opinion. I am going to call the manufacturer to check. What I am referring to is that it seems to be a man-made composition instead of the way it used to be leather. As a result I feel like it is slippery if there is perspiration. Other than that it is a very comfortable walking shoe.

I absolutely love love love these boots!!! I'm a New Yorker living in Atlanta and im so used to wearing these boots so i was super excited to find them on Amazon...On top of the fast shipping they arrived before Christmas...These are my work boots and they were packaged just right... I'm very thankful...and great job Amazon!!
They arrived as expected. I love the boots. Very well made and much better than other cheaper similarly looking boots.

wow. these shoes are awesome. they are extremely comfortable. not to mention the attention i have gotten from these (i currently own the blue ones) for instance people laugh and point out the good year insignia on the sides and back, and the distinct colors that these shoes are made in. these definitly attract attenion. and plus they just overall, look real neat. and they are unique. i am in high school, and i am the only person i know that has these shoes in a school of 2100 kids in omaha nebraska. trust me, these shoes are definatly "hip". haha.
I got these for my daughter for her work shoes, she loves them. They hold up nicely, she works for Donatos and they have held up nice.

These were a great buy, I had tried several different shoes and these were the best fit. I have slightly wider feet and the curved top of shoe is better for my toes than any other. They may be expensive but are more likely to fit the best!
Fast delivery - but my wife says the shoes are very poor quality.Worn once and tossed into the trash.Not the seller's fault however - so 5 stars to them and 1 to the mfg. thus 3 stars.
These were a bit larger than the size 9 that I ordered. It's a good, cheap sneaker.
shipped fast ordered around christmas at the last minute and were brand new as listed size was right have held up great
I bought them 1/2 a size larger than normal and they fit fine. They will be good pair of boots to get dirty without feeling bad, how can you go wrong for $19.79.
Great warm boot. Perfect for indoor/outdoor comfort. Have worn shorter ugg and knockoff ugg boots before. Love these tall ones!

The men's New Balance 574 has been around for many years. It's a 'retro' style in that it's based on an older style and comes in MANY different color combinations for the fashion-forward thinkers out there. They look vastly different than the current crop of 'minamalist' running shoes every shoe manufacturer is producing.Fashion aside, the New Balance 574 is actually a pretty decent running shoe. I've had them before many times over and they fit the shape of my foot perfectly. I do, in fact, use them for actual running. I put about 5-10 miles a week on them and they are durable, supportive, and well-cushioned. They are, however, based on 'old-shoe' technology and I've added Superfeet green insoles now that I've gotten older(see my review here on Superfeet for more information).In all fairness, most running shoes - even the high-dollar, current crop -have very poor insoles in them from the factory. The reason I've been told is because there's little 'shelf-appeal' with an insole! The only shoe I've found lately that doesn't need any help is the New Balance 990-series. Those shoes, however, are now in the $140-150 range and out of my budget.Try on a New Balance 574 the next time you're in a shoe store. Yeah... they may be marketed as a 'fashion' shoe now, but they are actual RUNNING shoes from a day when running shoes were meant to do one thing well - perform!Jae

This very attractive little sandal would probably be very satisfactory, but it runs both short and narrow. It is not true to size by any means, so rather than return them, I gave them to a cousin with smaller feet. They were on sale. Now I know why.

I bought a pair of Keens for my trip to Glacier Nat'l Park. They are perfect for rafting because they have the toe-bumper in the front, so it's painless to wedge your feet in the raft. I also hiked for a few hours per day in the shoes, which was also enjoyable, but after a while my arches hurt. They don't have high arch support at all, so I couldn't wear them for too long. My feet got sweaty in the shoes, but they never felt too hot, and with a quick dip in some water, they're clean again (they also dry in a matter of hours)! They seem to run a bit small, so be sure to try on a few different sizes. The width is great, and the colors are fun. Sometimes sand or pebbles might get into the shoe and it can take a minute to remove (you will probably have to take the shoe off), but it's really not a big deal. Overall, I'd recommend Keens for their durability and versatility.

This is the third pair of See Kai Run shoes I've had for my toddler. The others were good, and wore reasonably well. These wore terribly. I have never had problems with smelly feet/shoes, but with these, I do. I can even smell how bad they are when the shoes are ON, if I have my foot crossed over my knee or something. It's really bad. It's been a little over a year since I purchased a pair of these shoes in the brown color option in my usual size. I don't wear them on a regular basis--I am generally in skirts and dressier shoes if I am out of the house--but when I travel they are excellent to wear, and they are also fine for trips to the supermarket in colder weather. I wore these shoes almost non-stop when I visited my parents recently and stayed for a few days; they were great for walking around town and window shopping as well as traipsing across fields in the mountains. My left shoe gives me some pain across the top of my foot, I am unsure as to why this is the case, but I laced my shoes up in a 'hackey-sack' configuration so there is less pressure there, and the left shoe is almost comfortable now. During longer treks I still feel some discomfort but I do not blame that on either the shoe or my foot, they just probably are not the best match for each other. But my right foot feels perfectly fine in its Eastland shoe, nice and snug and solid. My grandmother, when she saw me during my trip, asked me if I've grown (I'm in my thirties so that is highly unlikely!), and I said it was the shoes! From looking at them casually on someone's feet you would probably would not notice the height in the sole and heel, as it is not obtrusive, but it is there.
After having to return them because they didn't fit, I got the perfect pair of shoes. They even paid for the return shipping. They look great!

If you have high or moderately high arches with a tendancy to wear down the shoes on the outside of the foot, you are like me. This shoe is pretty good for that type of foot and still provides decent to good heel support. The outside of my legs around the calves tend to cramp a little while running (less when I warm up), and while this shoe doesn't completely fix that, it helps it better than even Saucony's did. Other than Asics, Saucony, and now Mizuno, I wouldn't wear anything else.The other problem I've had for several years is heel and achilles soreness for a short time after running. This shoe comes close to eliminating that problem, but the Mizunos I've recently tried seem to have a bit more cushioning.Asics is a great product, and this shoe is a moderately priced option for underpronators like me. If that word means nothing to you, you need to research running shoes and have your own feet checked out at a running shoe store.

This shoes look sleek no doubt about that. Ive been trying to get my hands on them for a while now but i can't seem to find them anywhere. Can anyone tell me where to buy a beautfiul shoe like this?

When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.

Now I saw that people where complaining about how to shoe gapes around your foot. Well you know the string that is in the front? Untie those and pull them has hard as you can and BAM it gets tighter! I've worn Rainbows exclusively for about 7-8 years and figured I'd give the hempies a try. At first I really enjoyed the sandal, the feeling of hemp after all of the years of cold leather was, for lack of a better word, comforting. This only issue I had with these was that the hemp material wore down in no time; I reckon it was less than 2 months before my big toes on both feet were breaking down to the next layer. The hemp material also started to gunk-up a bit within a couple uses which left them a bit more unsightly than the leathers (I'm not THAT dirty). If I purchased another pair I would probably just make sure its not my daily sandal.
I bought these because they looked light weight yet sturdy. I am pleased with them. They keep my feet dry and I have not had a problem yet with them.

Several years ago, I moved into hotter inland climates which have prolonged intensely hot summers. My work requires formal business attire. Needless to say when I get home from work, or am off for the weekend, I wear my reefs with absolute pleasure. They are extremely comfortable and will contour to your foot, to provide nice stability, keeping your foot on, or rather in the surface on the flip-flop. The tread and traction is excellent as well. They are comfortable stylish and keep your feet cool during hot weather. Everytime I put them on, I know I will be relaxin, ahhhhh, how nice. Best flip flop on the market. Have tried others, but the simplicity of the Reefs reign supreme. As far as fit goes, if you are a half size such as 9.5, get a 10, they will fit perfectly.On a side note, 6-7 years ago, Reef made a flip flop I liked even better, it had a twist to the design which I loved. Basically, instead of the nylon fabric which goes in between your toes, they had one with an extremely soft comfortable rubber which went in between your toes. It was slightly more comfortable than the nylon part, they employ in all their flip flops now, except for their all rubber ones. Another benefit of this rubber part was it kept the nylon strap elevated, so when you put your foot in, it went right in, you did not have to squiggle your toes to raise the nylon strap in order to slide your toes in and get the toes seated up against the nylon, or rather in this case the soft rubber. With this rubber part, you just put your foot in, and voila, you're off and relaxin, totally hassle free. This was not an all rubber piece that went from the toe strap and all the way to back of the flip flop forking and branching off to the rear of the flip flop where they attach to the deck rear deck of the flip flop on both sides in the rear; it was not a totally nylon-fabric free flip flop, in other words it was not all rubber like other flip flops by Reef and other manufacturers. It was a hybrid, with a rubber part that elevated the nylon straps, so you could just glide right in. It combined the best of both worlds with the convenience of the rubber part where you put your toes in, but after that nylon straps were attached to that rubber toe-piece and went back and attached to the rear deck of the flip flop. The nylon straps are more breathable than rubber and keep your feet nice and cool, while the rubber part that goes in between your toes, made them the ideal, best flip flop ever made. I hope someone from Reef comes across this review. Bring back the hybrid Reef, myself and others will buy them again and again. Also these flip flops are extremely durable. I wear the heck out of them; I mean I put serious mileage on them. I usually buy them every two years,

The straps on the right foot seemed a bit tighter than the ones on the left, so, I got some blisters when first wearing it. However, over time, the fabric stretched a little making them much more comfortable. They're great! So cute and yet so comfortable!

Wasn't sure how to rate these. They're a really nice, high quality shoe but had to return them because they were too short. Definitely would've kept them if they had fit. Ended up buying something locally rather than returning for a bigger size.

My mom has really wide arthritic feet. She has arthritis in her ankles, feet, knees, 1 hip, and lower spine. I ordered these shoes for her, after trying a large variety (about 10 other pairs) of shoes. None of the other styles we tried fit. She either couldn't get her foot in, or, in the case of ankle boot styles, they wouldn't close around her ankles. These were a last resort because she doesn't like the tennis shoe look (she's 72). Nevertheless, these fit! Hooray! They are comfortable and stable. The velcro can be adjusted to different widths. Totally worth the money and true to size!

i've been looking for mary jane's for a while and decided that i'd give these a try since they were so reasonably priced. they also come in wide sizes, and that's a plus. i just received them and i have yet to wear them. i did try them on. while they are super cute, they are also really big. my feet get wider the closer you get to my toes, so my feet are sort of like...ducks feet?! lol. anyway, i imagine these would be comfortable enough for people that have the longer second toe. my second toe is much shorter than my big toe, that combined with the duck-like shape of my feet, causes these shoes to be a bit uncomfortable. the way the toe area is designed it leaves a huge gap between my smaller toes and the end of the shoe, and presses my big toe into my other toes.i realize that the shape of my feet are not the norm, but i know a few other people with similar problems and i thought i'd point these things out. to be make it clear...the toe area has it's longest point in front of where the second toe would be. anyone with a wide width across their toes might find these uncomfortable.they are also a lot bigger than i expected. i usually wear a regular 9 1/2 and these wide width 9's feel a lot more like a 10 or a 10 1/2 to me.they are cute though.

These flipflops are both well-made and comfortable. The strap material is soft and didn't cause any irritation or discomfort from day 1. The arch support is made for someone with moderate arches so it should be comfortable for most people. They are designed to give reasonable traction when wet or dry so they're great for a day at the lake. The dram only holds about an ounce of fluid but hey, it's more for fun than anything else. If you're planning to use these to sneak your alcohol into a sporting event then I'd come up with another strategy. But they do make a good conversation starter. The only reason I give them four stars instead of 5 is that the dram is made of hard plastic and so reduces the cushioning in the heel area somewhat. But other than that I'd recommend them.

Shoe looks great but the size I ordered ran small. I bought about 6 pair of sandles this year and all fit well but they were bought at the store and I tried them on. These were the same size but were just a little small.

You don't have to worry about it snapping off if you have to do a lot of moving around (which happened to a pair of costume shoes I bought from a different seller!) they hold up fine. Love these boat shoes. A+++++for comfort in the front toes and back heel. Hope they sell other colors. Nice construction.

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE COLOR THEY WOULD HAVE GONE RIGHT BACK.THEY ARE DRESSY ENOUGH FOR WORK ON IN CLEMENT DAYS BUT THAT HARD FOOT BASE ALMOST GOT THESE A 1 STAR RATING.

I bought 2 pairs of these, one for me and the other for my girlfriend, to walk to class during the winter. They do exactly what they are designed to do in terms of traction on ice, but there are some drawbacks. First of all, they can be tricky to put on. I figured out how to do it with one hand without sitting down, but my girlfriend needed me to put them on for her the first couple weeks and still needs to sit down and use two hands now. This shouldn't be a problem for many people who are doing outdoor activities and won't be putting them on and taking them off repeatedly throughout the day. Secondly, they are treacherous on hard floors. This is clearly indicated on the box, but it is pretty surprising how easily the wires slide across smooth tile. They seem to fare fine against pavement for those non-icy patches, but you really do have to take them off when you go inside. I think this is true of all winter traction aides, but it can be a hassle for a college student who walks to and from class a few times a day. A nice bonus is that they do fold up pretty nicely and fit into my pocket. Also a positive is that they stay on exceptionally well right over your shoes and I have yet to have a slip while wearing them.I would recommend these to anyone who does walking on snow pack or ice regularly.

Second pair that i have purchased for working a 12 hour shift. Boots are steel toed, rated for 600 volts, and light and flexible. Feel like regular boots. I even wear them on my days off sometimes as they are a good looking shoe. Company purchases 1 pair of safety shoes per year, and after 16 years i have gone through many different brands of safety shoes. These are the best. No leg fatigue or foot pain. They come in wide size, but normal size fits fine. I enjoy the added safety of the 600 volts rating as i work around high voltage constantly.
Sole/footbed is weak/ thin especially in arches,inner liner stitching is seperating as new pretty wimpy overall,short time snow shoveling at best

Converse Chuck Taylor All Stars are not just a fashion statement. Back in the day, they were my choice of athletic footwear -- following in my father's footsteps -- while starting center on the high school basketball team. For a 6'2" white guy with a moderate vertical leaping ability, I didn't have to worry about losing any spring in my step, and I always led stats in rebounds and blocked shots against players wearing the then-ubiquitous Adidas, Puma and Converse "Dr. J" hi-tops. In all fairness, and as a disclaimer, 80% of the opposing team members were white guys, too.Still, though I have absolutely no vertical leap left (hey. I graduated 24 years ago), I still wear these shoes, just because. Like one reviewer pointed out, they're a great conversation starter. Plus, they're as comfy as a second pair of feet.At the turn of the 20th to the 21st century, it appeared that there'd be NO Chucks left at all: The Massachusetts factory was closing down, and Chucks appeared to be going the way of acid-wash jeans. Fortunately (or, unfortunately, if you're a member of the garment workers' union), Converse went through some reorganization and now makes these overseas, presumably in China.Well, I'm boycotting the People's Republic of China, an anti-labor country that has helped more American CEOs bust unions than just about anyone else. Its own people are slave labor. Fortunately, I thought ahead, so when Converse was on the ropes, I went out to every shoe store around and bought up all the size 12 hi tops I could find. To be exact, 143 pairs -- a closet full. I've got 'em in white, optical white, green, red, basic black, navy blue, yellow, orange, you name it. Set me back $2700, but was worth every penny, knowing that American workers made them.I AM THE IMELDA MARCOS OF CONVERSE CHUCK TAYLOR ALL-STAR SHOES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!But, if you're a newcomer to them, or missed the boat, I won't hate ya for buying these for yourselves. They are so cool, I'll look the other way.I have to look the other way myself: I buy the toddler sizes for my two wittle one. Aw!!!! :) At least I help keep American shoe store employees employed, if not factory workers.
Excelent quality. Really comfortable and an awesome shipping time.A great G.N.AGoodNiceAffordableNow I ordered another pair for my son.

These shoes have been great for work, but they only lasted about 6 months. Granted, I do work in a laboratory dealing with coal, limestone, and various other matrices, but I would think the soles of a good shoe would last longer than these have. With that being said, the shoes are comfortable and are definitely stain-resistant. I've spilled or dripped many different acids and caustics on them over the past 6 months and they've held up well (except for the soles, of course). These are good work shoes if you don't mind replacing them every 6 months.

The product was is in great quality as expected from the Timberland brand.
