These shoes are cute and match outfits very well, but I think that they forgot about comfort. If you plan on walking around for awhile, these are not the sneakers to do it in.

This is the second Converse Low Top I bought this week because of sizing error(my fault). I ordered a size 10 in Mens the first time because I'm a legit size 10.5 Mens in every other shoe I wear. The shoes were received quickly by mail and the quality is great. When I tried them on, I had a good amount of space inside the shoes to move my toes which was too much for me. These size 9.5 shoes are a perfect fit. The sellers advice is spot on about sizing. Order 1 size down from your usual shoe size if you want a good fit. Other than that, these shoes are great for casual walking and weight training. I use them for dead lifting and squatting. Definitely recommend these shoes to anyone!

Several of my friends swear by Teva sandals. The memory foam footbed is cozy & comfortable yet supportive. The straps are snug, making the sandals surprisingly comfy, even the night I literally had to run to catch the train. I liked mine so much I bought a pair for Mom & sis, too!

Upon seeing these shoes on the website, we felt as though they were the shoes we'd been looking for. Ive owned Merrell in the past and enjoy them very much. My wife decided she wanted to purchase a new pair, for me, for Christmas. We had combed several sites when we came across these on Amazon. Looking at the picture, we felt that the walnut color was what I needed to replace another brown set that I previously had. We were wrong. The picture on the site dipicts the color as being much more brown than they actually are. They actually appear to be more of a gray color. The venting on the sides are also a misnomer. Most Merrell's displaying the side venting with the mesh material keep your feet much much cooler than these do. In fact, my feet sweat like a banchie. All in all, though, still the best in the market in their class. For my application of looking nice in any outfit and still able to walk out the backdoor straight up a mountain, you cant beat them. The worst Merrell's will still always be better than the best that any other company will offer. Not to mention the price. I promise you that for the cost of these shoes, in this class, you will not find a better shoe.

These shoes are awesome! They fit a little tight, but not to the point of being uncomfortable. They're also pretty fashionable. I would definitely recommend these for anyone, men and women. It was a great purchase. Free shipping is also included so if you are intrested I would tell you to go for it!

I absolutely love love love these boots!!! I'm a New Yorker living in Atlanta and im so used to wearing these boots so i was super excited to find them on Amazon...On top of the fast shipping they arrived before Christmas...These are my work boots and they were packaged just right... I'm very thankful...and great job Amazon!!

The heel looks like wood, that makes them look finer.They are comfortable and fit true size. I am 7.5 in sandals, that's what I got. it's a little tight but my feet are a bit wide. It does not hurt my feet, though. after two times of usage they are not tight anymore.They have light cushioning, this improves the comfortability.They are not very stable because the heel is thin, but after wearing them a couple of times you can get used to it, meaning that they will feel more stable. (I'm not used to high heels or thin heels)One of the things I don't like is the satin footbed, it picks up all the dirt from the ground (I got the white ones). The metal heart looks a little cheap too. The big heart is a piece of "leather" colored in silver on the border. I didn't notice that on the picture before.Last thing, some of the stitches that were holding the big heart on the left sandal came of, but the heart still looks ok.They look very cute on though. and they are good for the price.It is a casual look.

These boots are ok. They are not very comfortable at first, but once broken in are pretty comfortable. They are waterproof, and have good traction. After only about 9 months of moderate use, the rubber on the front has began to separate from the leather. Also inside, the cloth at the heel has worn through. Not as durable as I had hoped, but not bad.

I bought a new pair as my old ones were well... old 15+ yrs. I still use the old ones these new ones fit the same and are comfy but they squeak like crazy. Both of them and i don't know how to make them stop. I've had them over a year now and they still do it. Which is why 1 star is missing.
This purse was just what I wanted!! Big enough for everything, but not too bulky!

I bought these for my eleven year old. She loves these, so, I don't really know how conforable they are because she really cares more about how they look. The price was the same as other vendors. It was just easy to order on-line.

I love Converse and this is my ninth pair. Not of the shoe of the same color though. love these boots. the tread design is well placed, and very functional. the heel doesnt rub my ankle wrong. i like the material as it allows for a good touch.

I purchased these shoes as a gift for my aunt in PA. She said it is the most comfortable shoe she has ever worn. I will purchase another pair for her closer to spring but told her the red ones are year-round too. Next, I will purchase a pair for me. Many thanks. NJ
Lasts about 6 months with daily 4-mile walks on pavement. Lasts about a year in the gym with exercise equipment. I get good angle support and good arch support. Washes well.

We live in a wet climate so the yard is often squishy. These are great play shoes for here. It is also customary to take your shoes off upon entering houses so they are very convenient for that as well. The color is adorable and my daughter just loves them. The price was decent as well considering that the knockoffs cause horrible blisters on the insides of feet-these did not. All in all it was worth the purchase.

My husband is an almost exclusive low top Converse wearer. He has been wanting a pair of TRUE red not TOMATO colored chucks. These are a true tradition red and he loves them!!! Great price, better than any I have found in stores and they fit like a dream. Highly recommend these!!!

I have been wearing Chucks since I came out of the womb. I've been through many pairs, and after I decided to retire my old black ones due to a blown out heel I wanted to go with something new. The white is really an eye catching color, and more subdued in person than some of the pictures out there. BE WARNED, Chucks are about a size bigger than your actual shoe size. For example I wear a size 7 in women's, which would be a size 5 in Chucks, but these are really too big so I went with the size 4. I find the white adds some contrast, especially if you wear dark colors like I do.
Moccasin was very plush, and seemed well made, but I wear a 7 1/2. I ordered an 8 as the instructions said to order up. But it was so big I couldn't walk in it.

Wow, these are the most friggin' excelent boots I've had in years. They are so unique in color and texture. The Vintage aging makes them feel broken in as soon as you put them on. Size for me ran true to my shoe size of 10.5 US. Super comfortable. Absolutely awesome with jeans. My wife loves how they look.As for Frye, I still have the same two pairs of Frye boots I bought 28 years ago. Just re-sole and re-heel once in a while and they should last decades. Great quality then and now.I also bought a pair of the Harness 12R in the Gaucho color, but I prefer these over the Gaucho and am returning the other pair.HIGHLY recommended!

I just received my boots from UPS and I must say I can't help but be giddy about them. I wear a men's size 13, and they are very roomy for my wide feet. They seem very well built and I hope they will last for years to come. I'm very happy!
Never owned a pair of Tim's before. Took them out for an all day hike and WOW! Really resistant to water, comfortable, and are durable. look forward to owning these for a few years.

Since discovering Hi Tec some 15 years ago and found it to be the perfect fit for my size 11 feet (womens) I have stuck to the brand for hiking boots. They are stylish, waterproof, well crafted and a brilliant fit for a broad foot. This is a boot you can walk in all day and not have sore feet; I have never had one blister and they require no breaking in. In recent times I have been unable to source this brand in Western Australia, and when I finally found a store that carried them they were twice the price offered by Amazon. And thanks to Amazons sizing chart the mens size 9 translated perfectly. I have yet to be disappointed by Hi Tec which is why I have found it unnecessary to try other brands. The Altitude rates as the best to date. I cannot recommend this boot highly enough.
Chucks rock! Got these to match with my 2 and 4 year old boys. They love when we all put our chucks on together. These never go out of style.

Did exactly what I thought they would. Which is, be shoes. I am still wearing them and probably will continue to wear them for some time.

My old Hi-tec Windhoek's finally wore out. I use these boots as my everyday and light hiking boots. I got this pair of Easy Spirit shoes to replace my previous pair of Easy Spirit lace-ups, which had been my favorite pair of casual shoes for the past 15-20 years (I know, hard to believe they lasted that long - Easy Spirit is a great brand!). My new brown leather lace-ups are well-made, stylish, and very comfortable. If you're looking for sharp-looking shoes that are easy on the feet for long periods of wear, I'd say go for these!

For whatever reason I have always had trouble finding shoes that really made my feet comfortable. A few years back, after doing some research, I discovered the New Balance M1122MC (The single M is for "Men", the MC is for "Motion Control"). I have been wearing this shoe, and its previous incarnations, for several years now and without a doubt this is the best shoe I have ever worn. It's is built around what New Balance calls an SL-2 last (or "mold") and and the extra room that this gives my foot in the toe box makes all the difference in the world. With out a doubt this is my Number 1 choice in shoes!
bought this as a gift for my cousin for a christmas present! absolutely great! the price was right and quality and of the shoes is superb!

Okay I came here to buy a new pair. The ones I bought last year are still working fine even though I couldn't wear almost anything else. I got a pair of Ginger Reef sandals on a trip to California Adventure once upon a time. This is the second pair of this particular shoe I have bought. Roomy and comfortable, and easy on a painful back. Over the last couple of years, the shoes I have picked to buy have been Propet. I didn't try to buy Propet, but they have turned out that way.

These slippers are perfect for my 95-yr-old mother who is living in a nursing home. Excellent footwear, very comfortable, is used for all occasion besides to have an economic price. Amazon is very responsible, the order arrived fast.

Please first see my review for the Chippewa 29416 boot to get a feel for how great I think these boots are. For most people, the 29416 is all the boot they'll ever need. But I deliver heating oil during the winter and when it snows and the roads are salted pools of icy slush water build up along the road curbs, which is where I must stand to work with my truck. In these instances the 29416s are not completely waterproof, and the little bit of water that leaks in negates all the insulation and my feet freeze. Bad.So after all of these years I said: Not this winter. I first tried to order the LL Bean "Duck" boots that they've been making for about a 100 years. But I did so with trepidation because I worried the rubber sole would not have the support I need and receive in a regular work boot. I worried that while probably perfectly adequate for hiking or trudging around, maybe not so much for actual 40 hour weeks of work. But I never got the chance. Turns out those boots have become all the rage this year with college kids and they were back-ordered until spring.So a little further research brought me to the Artic 50s (model 25492).When you first open the box you'll behold these boots with amazement. The craftsmanship, the leather, the stitching, the heft, the design. The real lamb shearling lining. Removable woolen sole inserts. The composite sole, complete with duck bill toe for attachment to ski bindings. You'll know immediately that these boots were not made in China, or Burma or any other such place. And then your next thought will be what a shame it would be to wear them! There isn't a finer work boot made anywhere and when you hold perfection, the temptation is to put them on display, rather than on your feet.But on my feet they went. Last night my wife warmed them up and liberally applied Sno-Seal and today, Saturday, off we went for a half a days work. As usual the first hour was pretty brutal on my feet, despite the fact that the laces were totally loose. But hours 2-4 got a little better, but by noon time it was definitely time to get my feet out of those boots! Next Saturday will go far smoother, and after the 3rd Saturday everything will be comfort and joy, I am sure. I always order Chippewa a half-size larger than normal. I've never worn wide shoes, so I go with the single E, but I did wonder today if maybe I shouldn't try the EEE width? Would the breaking-in be easier, or once broken in, would they be too lose? Hard to know in advance because the boot your break-in doesn't fit anything like the boot when new, and at these prices one would hate to make a mistake...These boots are cold weather only I'd think, unlike the 29416. And if you were to buy a pair for winter outdoor leisure activities (as opposed to work), I'd bet a pair could last a lifetime. I'd also bet these would be some fine footwear for anyone living in Alaska.I know, I know. Are they really waterproof in the ice water slush? Don't know yet, but I'll be back if and when we get any real winter weather in New England this year and let you know.

These shoes look adorable, but they're inexpensive and it shows. I bought mine in white patent and I'm satisfied considering the price. I think I'll be wearing them on Halloween or other special occasions that call for fun dress up. They're not hard to walk in, the heel is high but it's stable and the platform is high enough so that it's pretty easy if you're used to walking in heels at all. I wear a size 9 reliably but I've bought Pleaser shoes before and they run small so I ordered a 10. My feet were swimming in them. I returned them (thanks for making it so easy Amazon!) and ordered my 9 and they're a little tight in the toes, but not bad. Overall great dress up fun, but the quality is not great.

These slippers were ok, but definitely run wide. In street shoes I wear a 10 or 10.5 and I often size up to an 11 in loafers or ballet flats to accomodate my slightly wide feet. I ordered a 10W since these slippers are not offered in an 11, and they were loose even with the drawstring completely tightened. I ended up exchanging for a pair of Blochs, which come in longer lengths.
I wore this style shoe for many years and loved them. Now the D width is too tight, especially on my left foot. The shoes will be returned.

I was expecting these to be the same upper design as my last pair, and they are not. Birkenstock (or whatever company makes these now) has much less leather on the uppers, therefore the straps are thinner. I kept them because I think I'll get used to how much of my foot they actually cover, but I don't like them as well. I wear them a lot of the year (yes, even with socks in the snow), so I miss the extra coverage. That said, I'm giving them a try instead of returning to my search for the perfect sandal.

I love my new Birkenstock sandals. I have a very old pair and forgot how great a new pair feels. Received my order very promptly, and without any concerns. Would highly recommend a new pair and a beginning pair for anyone!

I just bought these boots to replace my 1980's Sorel Manitou's which to Sorel's credit are still not worn out even after all these years but got tired of them and wanted new ones :).My first look at this boot made me want to return it asap, so much that away I went to back to Amazon to order a return label. because this is a BIG boot and yes its heavy too and made me wonder if this is really a mans boot.BUT then I reminded myself I wanted warm and dry like my previous Sorels and that I bought these for snow blowing, working outside, walking dog etc.. and not the day to day work, erands and stuff so I decided I owe them and myself to at least try them on before sending them back. And what a nice surprise, I found that they fit me perfectly, like they were made just for my feet! Wow..I can honestly say I was not expecting that.So now that I'm liking how they fit I'm really taking a good look at these, and I'm thinking I really really love how they look, the Shale/Stone color is totally awesome, and they are such a nice change from the samo samo hohum black or brown. And I really like the way the leather shaft is soft and bendable, its not so much that its wimpy but moves with you while still giving support and not at all like some hard to break in leather boots.As other reviewers have said they run big, but I would say not so much at least in my opinion. My usual size is 7-7.5 in shoes, and usually order a 8 in boots to wear a thicker sock. So with that in mind I ordered these in a 8 and I think the fit is perfect. My advise is to order your normal boot size and they would most likely be fine.I like how wearing a thicker sock still gives a little wiggle room and really thats how I'd rather have it fit, your toes can move around so they don't freeze or cramp up from being too tight. I like the wide toe box for my wider feet. I like how the sole of the boot is big and wide so that it gives you a feeling of being firmly planted on the ground.Could be a negative for some but to me they are big enough that I probably wouldn't drive my car with them on, but thats not really a deal breaker for me as they will work fine for my needs. These are very well made, have nice heavy weight soles to keep the cold out and warm liners that hug your feet and legs.So by now you've probably already guessed that yes I have decided I'm keeping these boots, I think they are really cool looking despite having big soles and I have over looked all that because they fit so well and its really hard to find a good fitting boot, and I have a good feeling I'll grow tired of waiting for these boots to wear out just like my old Manitou's.All in all I think these are an excellent value and product that will hold up a long time, besides that I like 'em alot and think you will too.In summary if you are on looking for a boot for working outdoors and want to keep your feet warm don't hesitate on buying these, who knows you too may just be be pleasantly surprised.I also want to take the time to give a BIG Thank you to Amazon for not only their great service but also for not holding ransom on the color combos of this boot and selling this color cheaper than other sites I looked at. you're the best!
they were great while they lasted (: after so many wears i donated the shoes. such a shame :( i miss them

Site after site has these rated as 5 stars. After a dogged hunt for made in USA boots that looked good, weren't western style and could stand up to the rigors of motorcycling I arrived at these suckers. And how glad I am for that. This review primarily focuses on these boots' performance as a motorcycle boot. I am confident they stand up well under other conditions too, but you can find many of those reviews elsewhere.These are quality inside and out. The stitching is perfect, no frayed anything anywhere. It's gonna hold together. The leather has enough thickness for some warmth and road protection, and the breathability is great for all conditions except rather wet. I applied some waterproofing agent to mine, and so far so good. Without waterproofing agent expect about 30 minutes of semi-wet riding (read: light drizzle) before your feet start to get damp.What I particularly love about these boots are that the leather is just the right thickness. Not too thin as to be flimsy or weak protection, but not too thick to be stiff and unwieldy. I also really dig the grippy soles, I have never had a motorcycle boot that makes me feel as sure-footed at a stoplight as these. Between those soles and the great ankle fit, you're staying put when you need to. Most excellent.Last but not least, they look damn good. I prefer a more modern flatter toe, but you can't beat the classic paratrooper boot look for just raw badass looks. I get compliments 'em all the time. Goes well under or over pants, depending on the look you're going for. If I wasn't riding with 'em all the time, I'd leave the laces a bit undone over the pants, looks good that way too (think early 90's...). I have a blog focusing on made in USA goods, if that interests you: [...]Thanks for reading!

I wear a size 10 shoe and this is a bit short for me, not uncomfortable but I would like a bit more length. It hits my heal half way so that it feels like my the slipper may slide off my heal. If I had tried these slippers on in a store I would not have purchased them. The sole is comfortable.

I ordered these for my daughter who wears a size 9 1/2. After reading all the reviews I ordered her a size 10 and they were too large. I should have gone with her regular shoe size. Great shoes though.

I have worn Danner boots in the military for over 15 years. I have always worn a size 11EE. This boot in that size did NOT fit me. It was very narrow with a narrow toe box. I gave them 3 stars because they look like a well made boot and I seriously wish they would have fit. However, I do love my military issued Danners and give them 10 stars!!

I've been wearing this exact Executive Imperial Wingtip shoe for more than twenty years. They are extremely durable and still take a great shine for the entire life of the shoe. They break in quickly and run true to size.

A ballet shoe is a ballet shoe is a ballet shoe. Plain and simple. But they need to be worn a while to conform to your feet. If you have never tried them before, don't try to figure out which is the left and which is the right, they look just alike. I have a wide foot. Reviewers said these ran large, so I ordered my regular size... figuring they would stretch to make the right width, and at the same time get a little shorter. But, they hurt right away since they were too long and narrow. I didn't want to suffer while breaking them in. Fortunately my husband remembered we had a shoe stretcher, so I put that on them, one at a time for a few hours. Now they are a comfortable width and length, and I'm sure they will soon conform completely to my foot.
Wore twice got wet now sole coming loose. Glue did not hold up like it should have very disappointed in it
Have been pleased with these boots 2nd pair I have bought. Great water proof and very comfortable soles. I like that the laces don't break easy because of they have eyelets all the way to the top.
Este producto cumple con mis espectativas,lo recomiendo a los futuros compradores, es por esto que mi calificacion a sido la maxima. Comprar por medio de Amazon es seguro y puntual...

I have been looking for a replacement pair of these shoes for ages. As a nurse I need something light and comfortable and these do the trick. The only negative I can say, for some reason, they hold onto smell. I have never had shoes that do that before!

When these shoes arrived, I was pleased to see they were as cute as they looked online. They also lived up to my expectations in terms of comfort. They hurt like heck! They look like they would hurt, and I knew that going in. But I wanted them anyway. And I am keeping them. Even if I can only wear them for a couple hours at a time. I wore them to a wedding and to the reception that followed. Probably 3 hours into the wearing, I had to hobble back to my hotel room while leaning on my husband's arm to change to some comfy slides.They made my legs look great and I received several compliments on them. They are also very well made and appear to be high quality. I am eager to see how they hold up. I am thinking they will last me quite a while since I am so limited to how long I can stand to wear them. I will post an update if I find that they break in nice and become more comfortable.
Very lightweight, confortable and keep my feet cool. I highly recommend these sneakers. They may seem priced high, but they are worth the money.
i love my sneakers. i have to say that one of the things i like is i can wash them and i have never had the problem of the front of the insole coming apart

These are very nice shoes, but the site showed them available in a triplewide but what was shipped was a double wide. So, they were too small for my mother-in-law to wear. This was real frustrating because she has such a hard time finding shoes that fit and my husband spent quite a bit of time shopping on the internet. They were sure they had found an answer when they ordered these sandals. We got our refund (minus shipping) and that's all good, but we wish the shoes had been what they were represented to be in the beginning!
Comfortable shoe and cute. Had to stretch as was a bit too tight but perfect now.

I like these but I bought the 8 1/2 wide and they are a little too short - but I still wear them. I will buy more grasshoppers in future but will get them in a 9 wide. I haven't worn them enough to be able to tell if they will wash easy but I expect them to.

Eastland Newports are good strong leather shoes. I am a teacher and I walk around my classroom a lot during any given day. My Eastland Newports are very comfortable and roomy; therefore, my feet don't hurt at the end of the day! The wide width, coupled with the fact they go with almost any pant outfit from khakis to jeans, make the Eastland Newports my choice of casual shoe!
I first bought this shoe because it was on sale, wow loved it so much so that, ever since all my shoes are Clarks. Best in comfort.

I bought these as a Christmas gift for a friend of mine. We both wear the same size shoes so when they came in i immediately tried them on and they were very tight. I ordered a 7 and had to return them for an 8 and i'm still witing for them to be returned. As far as the product i do not know for sure because i sent them right back but they seemed to be of good quality. So i rate it at 4 stars for the sizing issue.
Don't know how many pairs ive owned over the years but I keep buying more. Comfy, stylish and cool to boot. I'd give a 5 but i wish they werent as expensive...
Comfy.........I like the idea that it is made from recycled yoga mats. I wear a size 8.5. I was not sure whether to order up or down. I choose to order up.....the size 9 fits just right.

I've owned 3 pair of these shoes. Comfort is great, good support, roomy toe box and easy to get on and off. But the soles and heel crack and split long before the leather uppers show wear. The inside lining material wears and becomes shabby quickly. I would pay twice the price for better quality for a longer wear. The design is great but the material inside and the sole/heel is inferior. I'd buy again IF the price reflects the material quality.

These are my new favorite shoes. They are extremely comfortable and light. I tried a more expensive pair on in the store and found I needed to go up a size. So I ordered these one size bigger too. Glad I did, they fit perfectly. I would definately recommend these for anyone who is on their feet a lot.

IN SHORT: Worked well but didn't last long.IN DETAIL: These are fantastic for freezing rain, light icing and the like. Other people will slide all over the place while you walk normally. I did have issues when hiking on thick densely packed ice where even the Yaktrax slid so much I had to turn back. Lastly and most IMPORTANTLY, they only lasted about 30mi total use after which when the rubber on the bottom broken midway through a hike. Unfortunately the warranty is only good for 3 months so I would strongly recommend a different style that has only metal in contact with the ground.
I love these sandals. They are very comfortable, the color is nice, I wear them all the time. And they were reasonably priced.

I am on my seventh pair of Copa Mundials and I continue to be impressed. When you have a winning combination of looks, feel, and performance, you have no reason to change what you're doing. Just be sure to buy a size and a half smaller than your normal sneaker size, as the kangaroo leather stretches to conform to your feet. Also, do no expect to get more than one season out of the shoes, unless you have a lot of duct tape handy!
My husband was not thrilled with these slippers, because his foot slid sideways when he walked in them. However, he wore them out, so I guess they were okay.
This was an excellent product for the price. Very comfortable and very classy looking! The color is very rich and you can wear them with any color. True fit to size!

I've worn Enzo's Liberty Loafers for many years and I LOVE them. When these shoes arrived I slipped them on and felt comfortable right away. There was no need to break them in or use a shoe stretcher to get them to fit just right.

Searched over several sites for all kinds of "oxford" type boots and these fit the ticket. Pretty much as pictured and described. Reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because the material is thin especially around the toe cap but, all in all a very nice boot.

This company was excellent to deal with. When we received the shoes, they didn't fit properly. Exchanging them was a breeze and another size was promptly sent to us at no extra charge to us. Very efficient.

Bought these for my son who wears a size 10 street shoe and was concerned ordering two sizes smaller, as directed in the product description, they wouldn't fit. They did, and the Capezio brand I grew up with has held up nicely compared to a Brazilian brand I bought for my daughter on ebay that started cracking the second week she wore them. Ordering direct from Amazon, not a smaller operation, was the way to go. I learned my lesson for the future.Buy with confidence.

We've strung together a number of rather harsh winters of late. Plenty of snow and that occassional Arctic blast from Canada makes for difficult to negotiate sidewalks and driveways. The Yaktrax makes that problem go away.The device is straight forward and easy to install on your favorite winter footwear. Just stretch it across the sole, and secure the velcro strap on top and your ready to go. And they work! I've used mine a minimum of twenty times. The traction that they provide is superb, no matter the substrate or condition. Ice on asphalt, no problem. Snow on concrete, child's play.In addition to being effective, they are comfortable. Infact, you scarcely notice that they are installed. I've read that the traction providing wire will eventually fail, so I'm witholding the five star rating. All in all, I'm very impressed.
I was very impressed with these polo shoes. My son loves them and now his best friend wants a pair. The price was great. I could not have asked for anything more.

They're actually my only flip-flops. They are simple, low profile, not clunky looking, and have enough support to be comfy. Very comfy, cute with dresses ans skirts, and in black, of course they go with everything. I've worn them to the beach, on short hikes, gotten them dusty, dirty, and wet, in both salt and freshwater. They hold up nicely -they're really well made.

I ordered thise for my son for Christmas. He usually wears a 13 but would have needed a 12 in these. He didn't really like them for hiking; they are more of a work boot. You can't just ship these back to amazon; you have to pay to do it.
This is the third pair of Clarks Desert Trek Boot I purchased. Love this boot. Comfortable and rugged. I say buy and pair and be as pleased as I have been.
I own a children size 5 of this boots so I figured Women size 6 will be a perfect, however the boots barely fit which makes me wonder how could the smaller kid size fits better than the adult size?
One of the best walking shoes I have owned. Good support and cushioning. Plenty of toe room and easy to put on and off.

This SoftSpots Annie Lo shoe is one that I have worn before. They are wonderful shoes, comfortable for my picky toes and very easy to wear. They cost about what I expected to pay for good shoes but I would love to know when they are on sale so that I could buy a beige and brown pair also and save some money. I really prefer purchasing shoes at a store with a shoe expert but I am really happy with these shoes for dressy everyday wear.

These shoes have been cool kid shoes since the nineties. Sure, the company strategically targeted the youth market back then, but that's why Vans became cool too, and Converse, and all the other brands that people think makes them counter-culture. It's a gimmick, but if the product is good, why not increase market share?Bottom line: they are affordable, comfortable, and the color schemes rock!

For the price these were good converse that lasted a little over a year and a half (I wore them a lot). The one thing I noticed is that when they arrived they smelled like spray paint and over time as the black faded it started to look like a dark green. Not that bad, but something to take into consideration.
I looked all over for these shoes found them at a great price and love them so much and will buy another pair very soon as these ones are almost destroyed

I have searched for a handbag like this for months (literally). My everyday handbag by another top name lasted 10 years and I bought that one for $150.00. I can't believe I found the same qualities...buttery soft, easy to organize and find things quickly. The adjustable straps can go cross body or shorter, and not bulky. This is well worth the price. Go for it ladies.
Theyre called classic for a reason. Probably my favorite shoe ever made.Need more be said?

From the past to the present Converses have always been in style. These classic shoes are all over America today. Why are they so popular? Probably because they've stayed the same over the years. Any type of person can wear these trendy shoes, and a good thing is, they last incredibly long. I recommend these shoes to babies all the way up to adults!

I love these boots and bought them to be my comfy every day boots. But while the foot of these boots fit great the legs didn't fit the calf shaping started 1" lower than my own and cut in so badly at the top it hurt( even with the elastic built in). I spend $40 to get them stretched twice before I could even get them zipped comfortably!! So sad designers need to realize the bigger the foot the longer the leg... so on

Let me start by saying that this is a real user review!! I bought this same pair of shoes at a local store $10 cheaper thanks to a store $10 coupon! I don't go by first impressions as most users do, but rather by making an educated judgement of anything I buy these days til I try it out first! having said that looks doesn't matter to me as much as comfort, quality of material, and how well something will last.If I were to review this shoes during the break in period, I would have given it one star! the trial break in period for this pair of hiking boots during the first six weeks was very disappointing and very painful to say the least; as the heel broke through my skin, leaving me with two bleeding blisters. I had to stop wearing them for a week until the wounds healed. But since I loved the simple not over the top look of this shoes, so I decided to give it another try at wearing them. I particularly love the hooks to tight up the shoe laces!! I also felt the shoes looked well built and seem like it would last.Well it has been three months since, and must admit that I love them! they feel very comfortable, very supportive for those of us with medium to high arch, and the quality of this pair of hiking boots seem to hold up exceptionally well for someone who does an average of 40 miles of hiking per week. The bottom outsole of these shoes has not worn out one bit; as it still looks as good as new as when I first bought them. Since my feet grows about half a size every couple of years I intend to buy another pair soon! WORTH EVERY PENNY!! My new favorite kind of footwear. I even wear them to work in suit and tie!!
Actually, in error, I ordered a size too small and could not wear them. Did try exchanging them for my size but they did not have the shoes available in that. So actually I never got to enjoy them.
You would expect a name like timberland to have reached a certain level of expertise to be able to build a $ 100.+ shoe that can compromise between comfort and toughness... ,but it doesn't .

The price was right but the boots are a little large and very high. Makes me feel like I am tipping over. I am a fan of Nine West and own other pairs so I ordered my usual size 7 so I am surprised that they are too big. The neck of the boot(ie) is large, It looks smaller in the picture and even though they should go under pants, it will look funny on thin calves. Also, the heel inside the shoe is very wide and does not fit snugly around your foot-- so your heel swims around. In addition, the leather is thin. I have other Nine West boots and the leather is more substantial. These are just for dressy wear and would last only one season and would not be great in rain or snow. This is my lst shoe purchase over the web. My 5 star rating is for the beauty of Nine West shoes. Even tho I am disappointed in the Ealene boot, Nine West shoes are great shoes.
Bought for my wife for trip to FL. Got the single stack, narrow strap and she loves them. Cheers!

I have five pair of these slip ons. They are great, comfortable and easy to put on. Highly recommened for a comfortable summmer shoe OR all year.
i think that this sneaker was a bit tight but otherwise a good buy. waiting to procure a similar item.

I am very pleased by how quickly the shoes came--it only took 2 days! I ordered the Sahara colored (leather) sperry's for my sister. And I'm very glad that I ordered 1/2 a size lower than her normal shoe size (as suggested by other sperry customers) because they have stretched out a bit. She said that when she first put them on, they were not as comfortable as she thought they would be. She did not get any blisters, but the heels of the shoe were definately uncomfortable for her. HOWEVER, since she has been wearing them everyday for almost two weeks,the heel stretched out and she says they feel great!
I really appreciate my yaktrax - the sidewalks around here have seldom been clear of snow and ice this winter, and the yaktrax have meant that I have been able to continue my daily walks.

These rubber boots fit perfectly-I wear a men's 10 1/2 so I ordered an 11 (whole sizes only) which was perfect. The boots seem a little heavy and clunkish, but that's the nature of rubber boots. I had my first pair of Converse All-stars in high school in the early 1960's. That was before they were known as "Chucks." They were, and still are, the best basketball sneakers around. They're good for everyday workouts and just hanging around the house. Comfortable, inexpensive and they last just about forever.

I have had my new Easy Spirit shoes for about 2 weeks. I love the fit and comfort of the shoes. I walk daily at least 2- 3 times and day, and I was looking for shoes that would give me the support I need, and were at the same time comfortable. I was leery about ordering shoes online because I usually like to try them on. But I took a chance, ordered my regular size, and the fit is perfect. If you are looking for a stylish and comfortable shoe that is good for walking, I think these shoes would be a good buy.
I got these for my daughter for her work shoes, she loves them. They hold up nicely, she works for Donatos and they have held up nice.
A well built shoe for walking around or working out. I like that it does not have lots of goofy colors or textures like sports shoes have now a days. I've bought them before and will buy them again.
Fuer alle die auch ein bischen deutsch koennen.Der Service von dieser Firma ist schnell und perfect.Our next pair of Chucks we will get from this companie again

These shoes are terrible and i totally hate them. I had originally ordered a pair of Easy Spirit Gofast which i loved but had to return because of sizing. As the Jumper was the only shoe available in a half size at the time i went with them even though i wasn't thrilled with the style.The style though bad, is not why i dislike these so much. These are marketed as a walking shoe. I tested the walkability at the flower show and halfway through the show my feet were hurting. I don't know why they call these walking shoes. I felt like Frankenstein's monster in these shoes.They are so big and clunky and heavy and stiff. No ventilation, no flexibility they aren't good for walking let alone working out. And your feet will be so hot.I've had these for a while a now but shortly into wearing them the man made material started peeling off. I feel like an old woman in these shoes!
not bad, looks a little plain though.

Love the Asics brand, but should of purchased the gel opposed to the Gt-2110....I switch this pair w/my other running shoe; Nike....prefer the Asics brand, but my mistake not purchasing a more substantial running shoe.......but, still a great shoe!

I've had a great experience with this brand and these super cute boots don't disappoint. I was looking for this style to add to my wardrobe but purchased these for the look. Although this style can be a little too masculine for me, the beautiful soft gray and pink color combination makes them a fashinable comination of sporty andladylike.
I really like Adidas and I have probably bought 20 pairs or more for me and my family on Amazon. Amazon has great prices on these and when they are on sale, well that's unbeatable!

I got these for my granddaughter along with a native American dress. She just loves wearing them both. The quality of these boots is excellent and I reccommend them for imaginative play or for practical use.
Well worth the money. Now I can throw batting practice to my team without falling down when I tryto throw hard. Quality shoe, great price, fast shipping.

I don't care what Capezio's sizing chart says...these are not true to size. I took my daughter to the shoe store to get her exact size before ordering. She is a 13.5. I ordered a 1.5 and her toes were at the end. So we ended up with a 2,which is just right. They are very cute and seem to be well-made. This is my daughter's first pair of ballet shoes and she loves them. The price on Amazon is reasonable.
I've had Birkenstocks before so I know what the shoe is. I was pleasantly surprised when they arrived four days after being ordered. I will use this company again.
High quality shoe--more than expected. Fit perfectly and very comfortable. Purchased as an Easter shoe, and beautiful! Will wear for a long while.
i bought this sandals and was very happy when i recieved it in the mail. it was one of the best buys i made this summer.the sandals looks good and is super comfortable.
fast delivery and brand new! in box and should order in 1/2 size bigger im a 7 so 7 1/2 fit just great

I have a pair of UGGS that are over 16 years old. They were made in New Zealand and of higher quality. Now UGGS are made in China and it shows/feels. After verifying authenticity and trying on my boots...they feel so flimsy, but what can one do?My old pair finally started to wear out on the inside behind the heel. They are still ok with a double pair of socks, but I wanted a taller pair of boots. The toes on my old boots are reinforced with another strip of suede. It feels really strange putting on my new ones as they don't have that reinforcement and feels like it will wear out over time in the toes.Hopefully I will be proved wrong.

I bought these shoes for my daughter a few months ago because we could not find them at the store. It was well worth the risk of buying them the wrong size because they are exactly what she was looking for. They don't look cheap, they're not noticeably dirty even when they are, and for a girl mostly importantly, is that they match just about any outfit. We can't find anything negative to say about these shoes.

OMG.....love these boots, So comfortable, perfect fit,and the color..WOWeverybody(thats into boots) comments on these, I should buy another pairand just look at them in the box,Im not into boots as a fashion statement.But I really loves these bootsTHANK YOU.Timberland Women's Premium Nellie Ankle Boot

I ordered these for my granddaughter's birthday. They were shippped promptly, and I was able to track them very efficiently. They were exactly what we wanted!!! They are very attractive and wear well.

So glad that K-Swiss continues to make this shoe ... and very glad that it was being offered at a reasonable price.For me, this is the Pirelli tire of tennis shoes and they have saved my footing more than once!Great materials ... solid footbed .... comfortable on and off the court ... and the traction!!I've worn through a half a dozen pair over the years and that takes some real effort!allen

I am always a size 6 in footwear, but get a 6.5 for sneakers (Converse, Vans). I bought the navy Keds in size 6(M), medium width, and it's a little too narrow. However, going up to 6.5 would result in the shoes being too long. I won't be able to wear these without socks in the summer, so I'm going to invest in a pair of insoles when summer comes. I agree with previous reviewers that these shoes run narrow and long. After having them on my feet for some time with thin socks, they have stretched slightly in width. The quality is pretty good, comparable to canvas Converse and Vans. I bought Keds to wear around on campus since I wanted something less bulky than Converse All-stars and a bit more feminine than Vans Lo Pros. Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase and might buy another pair in the future.

As always, these are great shoes. I keep them in my shopping cart all the time. When my son starts getting close to needing another pair I start watching the price. When the price comes down I order a pair or two. The service has always been great. No complaints.
Receiver??? You are denied!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Adidas plus talented corner back equals devistating defense and victory against any offense!! Adidas is Victory!!
Anyone that wear Keds knows that they are great shoes. Got these for my wife and she likes them. Great looking shoes that offer solid support for you feet.

this is the second pair of softspots, but this pair the leather is not as soft it is stiff, and hopefully will be more comfortable when I break them in. The other pair exactly the same that I had purchased years earlier was and is so soft.
Love these converse shoes.They are a great shade of red, have already got a lot of comments on them.Thanks Chuck!

The black version of the Itasca SeaRay Slides arrived on time and in a box. They fit and are moderately comfortable. For the $30 or so shipped, they are about what i would expect. But, these are not some deeply discounted irregulars or end of line, though they may actually be. The are worth the $24.99. The smell of rubber was dominant when i opened up the box. there is no more than a flat piece of thin material separating the rubber from the removable insert. They are light and do fit comfortably but do not , by any means compare to the other higher line mocs that happen to go on some drastic sale and if i am lucky enough to find my size at the same time they go on sale-once every 3years. maybe. So, these seemed to be ok out of the box. i am wearing them and went for a walk without them breaking down and without getting any blisters. They do have a nice back for the achilles tendon and some foam in it with a center portion cut down for easier entry and removal, not much support but a nicer addition. there are elastic gores on each side with very little stretch to them but fine. my size was on target.the only real issue was that these were no way first quality or regular. there are glue spots all over the toe and fronts of both shoes. not little ones but sizable and 4 on one shoe and a couple on the other. they do not come off. At first , i thought it was only dust from shipping or a shelf storage. only it didnt come off with a light brushing nor with some water on a cloth. For me, it isnt a big deal because i always spill something i am cooking on my new shoes the first time i wear them anyway. I cant help it, always have, I used to cook for a living and now for amusement so am used to having a couple of oil spots on everything. Some people might be put off by the glue drips. I dont really mind but would normally want to be the one who gets the first spots or stains on my shoes (or shirts) thinking that this time I will keep them in perfect shape for more than a day.For the price i paid ,no problem, had i paid the 'full price' listed on the screen of $60, i would have returned them today-the day i got them.
If I buy this pair from Amazon, it will be my 9th identical pair of this shoe. I was working in a prosthetic and orthotic lab and found these to be the most comfortable shoes out there for the money.
I bought these for my father for Christmas in his normal size, but they were too small. If you purchase these, make sure you order a size larger.
product was best priced, received in no time, it was a gift and the person receiving the product has no problems with it
The boots arrived before expected, which was good. The boots fit very good and I wear them almost every day.Couldn't have a better pair.

Have only had these boots for about a week but have been wearing them everyday. I do about 4 or 5 miles per day walking in the woods and know I should wear hiking boots, but I decided to wear these for 1 day to break them in and then go back to my sneakers or hiking shoes. I was willing to suffer 1 day to break these in. That was last week and I've been wearing them everyday since then. No break-in period for me..they've been very comfortable. I did put thin foot insoles in but I do that with all of my footwear before I put them on...so I'm not sure how they would be without them. I'm guessing they would be OK. It has rained a few days here and so far they are definitely waterproof. These boots also look good for riding my motorcycle. I got the charcoal color and they are sharp looking. I'm going to buy another pair over the Winter in another color since I'm so happy with these. I highly recommend these boots.
Feel like I 40 yrs. younger. For a causal shoe for Santa these are Great. I really enjoy them feels great to be able to wear a really well made shoe. Thanks ConverseSANTA GARY

I was pleased with the price and the quick delivery of my shoes. Timberland stores are becoming harder to find, but I love the quality of these shoes. They are totally water proof, so I can walk the dogs in the morning in the wet grass and still have dry socks for the rest fo the day.

I am a bit of a shoe freak so I have lots and lots of different brands and styles. Let me tell you these are the most comfortable shoes I have ever put on my feet. I was telling my friends that they feel custom made and light as a feather. I got them because they were on sale, they looked decent but not my favorite, once I got them and tried them on they went straight to the top of my list. I'm going to order another pair to put up and another pair in brown. LOVE THEM!!!

Those slippers are super cute. I bought the pink hippos for my 18 months daughter. They are a little bit difficult to put on (sometimes you have to pull on the tag at the back to really get them on those little feet), but then that means that kids can't take them off that easily.My daughter is a size 4W and the medium fits her well. I wish they had bigger sizes as she's about to outgrow them.They seem to be very comfortable, the rubber soles are great on wooden floors.

Just bought several NEW Keds in White, Black, Navy, Bright Blue and Red to replace the OLD Keds that I bought 20 years ago! And my "old" Keds are still for perfect for yard shoes, knock around shoes etc! My new Keds in White and Black are of leather and how comfortable and easy care they are! The Bright Blue, Red and Navy Blue are canvas and washable. All are just wonderful and looking forward to another 20 years service. Since I was a kid, I have lived in Keds sneakers for the comfort, looks and the fact that they last and last and last. They are all worth every penny that I paid for them. Thanks Keds, hope you never change!
I purchased these to supplement some others I had my students wearing. I have had to repair the buckles every time hey have been worn.

These are just gorgeous, and very comfortable too! Highly recommended. This is a beautiful pair of shoes that look great and are very comfortable as well! Great price too!

These are very nice shoes, but the site showed them available in a triplewide but what was shipped was a double wide. So, they were too small for my mother-in-law to wear. This was real frustrating because she has such a hard time finding shoes that fit and my husband spent quite a bit of time shopping on the internet. They were sure they had found an answer when they ordered these sandals. We got our refund (minus shipping) and that's all good, but we wish the shoes had been what they were represented to be in the beginning!

Update 6/2012I've had these almost 2 years now and wear the heck out of them! They're still going strong! I had a very small problem which was my fault for not using the pull up straps where a thread pulled loose. Before this very small problem turned into a large one, I took it to the shoemaker where he re-sewed the 3/4 inch long problem by hand for a nominal charge of $10. He commented on what an excellent pair of boots these were and also commented on their suppleness and asked what conditioner I used on them saying 'Keep doing what you're doing and these boots last forever'. I told him I was using Frye Leather Conditioning Cream which is a bit of a chore on large boots andFRYE Weatherproof Spraywhich is quick and easy. Being that they have the 'Vintage' finish, you can't use any polish. Those 'Neutral' can change the texture of the finish and detract from the boots good looks. From the start I wanted these boots which are quite expensive (but Made in USA) to last. I called Frye and asked what to use on them. They mentioned several products but promised that theirs would definitely work as intended on the Vintage finish. I highly Fye products on these boots. The soles and heels are wearing like iron and it will be a LONG tome until I need new soles but I was concerned as to who can I take these to when I need soles without worrying that they'll mess something up. You can return them to Frye for any repairs for the same price as local shoemakers.Update 11/2011I've had these over a year now! These are by far the BEST and MOST COMFORTABLE boots I've ever owned.. Now read on to see my original Sept. 2010 review...I bought this pair (Tan/Vintage) after reading reviews all over the Internet. They were ALL 5 STAR! I'm not about to change that either. These boots look fantastic! I liked them in the pictures, but when you see them in person there's a real WOW factor!I took them out of the box, put them on and off a few times to loosen them up and went out and about. They were so comfortable that I couldn't believe they were new! They felt broken in already.The quality of the leather, finish, construction, stitching, components and workmanship are EXCELLENT. An even better thing is that FRYE makes them right here in the USA. These are quality boots. I'll review them again... maybe in 10 years or so, as these are built for a lifetime of everyday use.Since you're reading this, I know you're thinking about buying a pair. Don't settle for second best and wish you had bought these (When your cheaply made overseas ones fall apart). Pay a bit more and and get the best! FRYE Men's Harness 12 R Vintage Boot!

This is the only sandal I can wear without hurting my feet. I can wear these sandals right out of the box on an all day shopping spree and my feet are fine! I wear a D width and these are truly the best fit for wide width feet. I have them in every color!

I like the color in this shoe, though I have another pair that's a more natural color. The fit is fine, even though I have a slight problem with one of my feet. These shoes work well with my summer clothing, which is mostly casual.

I am a beginner runner and sneaker head. My shoes of choice were Nike and New Balance until I started running for the first time in my life. After a couple of weeks my arch area behind the ball of my foot began to hurt. After a couple of days of brisk walk sessions the pain also rolled up onto the top of my foot. At that point I decided to seek out the advice of a professional running shop. I found one locally ( www.bklynrunforyourlife.com ) which helped me with advice and recommended the ASICS GT 2120. Once I laced up the GT 2120 shoes I immediately felt the difference. This is an excellent stability running shoe which is light and just plain feels good. A great shoe for those with fallen arches as I do or require a stability/supportive shoe to run or walk in. I was able to run in these shoes after a few days of resting my injured foot and I felt great. These shoes helped me from giving up my first attempts at running to making me want to run more. Shoes make the difference and for me these certain did. "Waddle on!"
It is pretty good in general but the colour in definitely not pink. It is like skin colour so it didn't match the Leotard and the skirt which I ordered for my little child from Capezio also.
Fit is perfect and I was able to take them out of the box and walk around NYC without a blister or any discomfort whatsoever.

They were narrow, like European Shoes. Buy a wider width and a half-size larger. If you have a high instep, do not buy these. They are well made but not for me. I had no trouble returning them. The vendor was fine.
These are the best boots I have ever purchased, they are water proof and very comfortable... don't be afraid to buy these !

I've owned many different Harness Boots from Fryes to Durangos and the guide gear boots match up to competition. I love my other boots but when it comes to a nice boot that I can use daily and feel comfortable in these guide gears are perfect for that job. Great Fit, Great Comfort and well-crafted!!! Would I buy again?... Certainly would!!! They're great for all occasions, work or play! Great harness boots at a great price!

These truly are great boots. If you don't want zippers, these are about as easy as it gets to put on and take off with the metal ring eyelets. Very comfortable with exceptional build quality. The shoe runs narrow. The inside label says both "B" and "D", B is printed on top of a line and D is printed underneath. I don't know what that means, I ordered D width, but they seem to be a B width by appearance. HOWEVER, they are very comfortable anyway on my wide feet! They are well-made and quite attractive, I can wear them with nice dresses/skirts. I am going to order more.
I was worried they wouldn't go with anything, but they are surprisingly easy to match with. They're so warm and super comfortable. I'm very happy with these.

Let's start with, I really have problems with my feet, thus finding shoes that don't hurt, is difficult. I read a lot of reviews before I bought these. It's a nice shoe, runs wide enough. My main problem is in the instep. I have a high instep, not incredibly high, but on the high side and these are tight. The laces are fake; you can't open the laces up to put the shoe on. The tongue comes way up; so there isn't a lot of room to get your foot in; so if you have a high instep, think about these, maybe try to find other reviews and see if anyone else has had any problems. They have a little give, but not much. Everyone loves them, maybe it's just me, but not my favorites. I think if I could actually open them like a regular tennis shoe, I would like them more. Great arch support, width is good for me, which means if you have narrow feet, steer clear. Come in fabulous colors, which I didn't get. If you are looking and only find drab colors, keep searching as the new colors are great and there are a lot!!!

I love love love these shoes!! Not only are they extremely comfortable, but they're super cute. I would DEFINITELY recommend these shoes to whomever likes to feel comfortable while looking good :) I already have two pairs and looking to buy more :)

When I first saw Croc's I thought they were the ugliest shoe ever made. My fiance got a pair of Redskin Crocs and made me try them on to see how light they were. I put them on and they felt great! I'm a huge fan of mary jane shoes and these weren't as hidious as the regular ones. I ordered a pair from amazon in a basic black and now I can't go anywhere without them. They are perfect for shopping, going to the beach (much easier than walking in flip-flops), washing the car, etc. I have plantar fascitis and I can wear these shoes all day without my feet killing me. They are great for airplane trips because they are easy to slip off and on and are comfy for that rush to the gate. I'm no longer a skeptic and I plan on getting them in a few more colors.

These are hands-down the most comfortable shoes on the market today! I can't normally do much walking because of the bunions I have and the neuroma in my right foot. However, I can walk for ages in these shoes! Plus, I can wash them and also take out the inner linings and wash them. I have sprayed Febreze on them, too. The black rubber sole just seems cheap, and they feel off-balance (compared to other boots that I own) when I'm walking in them.Overall, I'm disappointed with the manufacturing and quality, but will probably still keep them since I sit at a desk most of the time.If you're going to work or walk in these boots, I don't recommend them.

If you're into the retro stuff, this really is a great pair of sneakers. People forget how comfy they wear and despite what your friends may think, they do actually still look pretty good with almost any jeans/combats. Whether it's the hi-tops or this nifty pair, you just can't go wrong for $30.

My husband loves the look, fit, comfort, and durability of these boots. He has been wearing the Hi-Tec Altitude IV in Dark Brown for at least 14 years. He enjoys working outside and gives these boots a run for their money. The waterproofing works great. A pair of these last him at least a year. I order these boots at least three pairs at a time, because I'm scared they will stop making them. I want this boot that he loves to remain popular and not be discontinued.

These are definitely the best Uggs to be created yet. I love my Uggs and currently have & pair, including my Bombers. I didn't buy them from here....but the review is still neccesary. Uggs never disappoint, and these are no exception. I love the leather on them the most, that's what drew me to them. Every winter I wear a pair of Uggs instead of snowboots and get mad every time. But I am not the only one! Over here in Boston, MA every girl you see is in a pair of Uggs, in ankle deep snow.....I know their toes are cold like mine because the fabric of the boots got wet and now is soaking through the sheepskin. LOL But we keep doing it. Well now I won't have that problem. I wore my Bombers out in the snow 3 times already and I am sooooo happy with them. I got home and my feet were till warm and toasty. Not to mention I don't have to wait for them to dry out to wear them again. Yay!!Oh, and for all the people who have never worn Uggs before.....They run big.
