I needed a warm pair of winter boots that I could wear with dress pants. Mine fit well, but I'm glad they've loosened up a bit over time. I've gotten many compliments on these shoes.
Fast delivery - but my wife says the shoes are very poor quality.Worn once and tossed into the trash.Not the seller's fault however - so 5 stars to them and 1 to the mfg. thus 3 stars.

My knees were killing me and my toes were ate up with blisters and black toenails (gross I know, but you long distance runners know what I mean). My shoe guy put me in this shoe and voila, no more blisters and no more sore knees (well, it wasn't quite voila as my knees took a little while to adjust to the change in mechanics and heal up and the toes are still healing, but it was plenty quick for all that). Anyway, I'm in heaven. I didn't realize I was an overpronater, well I thought I was, but didn't realize how much a shoe could help. Also, these shoes are a little small (as are all running shoes) so size up a little to avoid the toes thing. I've run 3 half marathons and 2 marathons in these in less than two months. Hurray for no more sore knees. The 15 miler and half marathon right before that in the old shoes were terrible. I've saved those old ones for short trail runs in the mud. Btw, my shoe guy recommended inserts for these as he says the ones that come with the shoe wear out really quick.

Product came on date as expected. I am a novice ballroom dancer of about half a year. This is the first pair of dance shoes that I purchased. I chose it as it is affordable and seemed to be good quality. As it is a practice shoe, I was not expecting it to be great looking. It isn't great and it isn't bad. I am used to higher heels and ended up ordering a 1.75" that wasn't as high as I expected but that is fine, i think the highest available was 2" anyway. As suggested by other reviewers, I ordered a size larger than my street shoe size and it fits fine, it isn't snug. Next time I might just order a half size larger instead of a fullsize as people say dance shoes should be snug. I went a whole inch more primarily to ensure the width fit fine as mine is a bit wider though i don't normally buy wide.My first impression is that it is nice and light and I like the fact that the sole has a little bit of arch support. I also like that it seems to be quality made for it's price tag. Not like many China-made versions for a similar price point. I don't think I will have any concerns that the sole will lift as it is sewn into the shoe versus others that is apparent that they just glue it down.
My husband liked the shoe but we had to return. His usually wears a 9.5 M but these were way too narrow and he does not want to re-order.

The color of the shoe was better than I thought. The shoe is made of a more traditional, stiff leather. It is a little loose and the right foot when I step creases across the toes causing discomfort. I kept them because I liked the style and color. I have hopes the leather will eventually soften with use. It is my first pair of cole hans. The price was right on amazon!
Comfortable and very tall. I can walk around in it for hours but it can get chafey/sweaty in extremely hot 100F+ weather.
I ordered these shoes for a trip that I was taking. they worked out very well in the smokies.

I ordered these shoes for a wedding, but I had to return them. I tried them on for about 3 seconds and my feet were hurting. Since the heel is pretty high, you foot slides forward and there is not much shoe to hold your foot in place. This one strap right across my toes was bascially squeezing my foot into the shoe and it hurt!
i loved this shoes, i have problems with my heels and this shoes are really confortable and help me on my dance posture!

Love Love Love these, in fact am online trying to find them in another color. Everything hurts my feet, so I usually only buy expensive shoes. I love flip flops and usually wear only Reef & Roxy, but lately they have been too flat or too high, etc. I ran across these and the shape of the sole makes them feel like a real shoe. The real leather strap is super soft too. I have an average size 7 foot and the 7's couldn't fit better.
These boots fit my son really well. They are cute and he seems to think they are comfortable because he never wants to take them off. For the price you really can't beat them.
No review necessary. They are wheat timbs. The quality n look of these boots from Timberland speak for themselves. :)

Just got this shoe and it's very comfortable, but it's narrower than I expected. I got a medium, as usual, but it's too tight (even without strapping them closed) so a wide would have been better. I'm hoping it will stretch.

I have tried Nike, Reebok, New Balance and every other shoe with my wide foot, but nothing comes close to the 2070. Having just ordered two, that should last me a year or two and I run every day at least two miles. This shoe is the one that they should keep for a long time. Don't buy the later versions when you can stockpile these.FYI, if these are out, I reccomend the New Balance 764 which are also good, although not as good.

I just bought my third pair of these boots in five years. I found them to be almost indestructible for light machine shop and daily use on the street. They are VERY COMFORTABLE, ideal if one is on your feet all day.They also polish up well and are presentable WORN as a dress boot/shoe.They felt like a favorite, comfortable old pair of shoes from the first time I put them on...SORT OF INDUSTRIAL STRENGTH BUNNY SLIPPERS!The boots are very well made from real leather.They are not heavy duty enough for heavy construction,logging or concrete work. Good for light farm work and driving.THEY ARE THE BEST WEARING WORK BOOT, I HAVE FOUND FOR DAY TO DAY WEAR.The soles have some tread, giving you fair traction in the grass, snow and ice plus have excellent wear resistance.Also...the boot's sole patterns does not leave large clumps of the outside on the kitchen floor, while stepping into the house.The boot sizing is pretty much exact. Only buy your exact sizeExcept a WIDER SHOE if you plan to wear multiple pairs of thick socks in the winter.They have an excellent size / width selection. I usually need a 14 EEEEE in a boot.The boots are almost waterproof, you will need to apply a reasonable coat of waterproofing silicone spray or mystery oil leather treatment. KIWI SHOE POLISH makes them shine up very well.The leather uppers are well cut out pattern and sewn together with care.I never had problems with the leather, material, sewn seams splitting or tearing, and no loosening or unusual wear with the heels or soles.The leather is thick enough to protect but still thin enough to be flexible.I have bought both he 6 inch and 8 inch versions of this farm boot.Both boot heights are just as easy to get on and off, however the eight inch high boot does gives you a bit more ankle support.So, I prefer the eight inch height.The only thing I can recommend extra for these boots...Order a bit thicker,round nylon boot laces, instead of the flat, cotton shoe laces that come FACTORY standard with these boots.If you need soles with more traction get something with a VIBRAM sole.However, trust me, your wife will remind you,often, to remove your boots before coming into the house with VIBRAM soles on.The only tougher and better boots I have seen and bought,have been just as happy with, are the White's Smoke Jumper Logging Boots and they COST ALMOST $500.00The FARM BOOTS are a great deal! I wish more American companies made things with this amount of care /pride in the product,a good design philosophy, used quality materials and all put together with wonderful workmanship!The people at WORK AMERICA remind me and hearken back to an earlier time in this country, when something that was stamped AMERICAN MADE or MADE IN USA meant often this product was the best made in the world!http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008D94HNQ/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_title

I had a pair of Rockports years ago and loved them. I'm glad to see the quality and comfort is still there. When I first got the shoe, I didn't think I was going to like it because it was a little lighter in color than I thought, and the toe is a little more square than I am used to. Once I put them on and wore them with a pair of jeans, I was sold. Absolutely love them.

My father in law loves this shoe.I bought him a pair several years ago.He said it was very comfortable and light.So I ordered another pair for him this year.The price is $5 more than few years ago.The quality is still very good.My father in law has got swollen ankel so I ordered him EEE.He likes the slip on shoes because he does not need to tie the shoe laces,which is difficult for a 75 years old.

Sooooo comfy. I brought a pair of these for work as I am a vet nurse and am on my feet all day, but I find I wear them every chance I can (I've since purchased a second pair and have put them away). I also use them to go for my morning walk and get a lot of compliments on them. I recommend these to anyone.
i have not to much to say, this product is nice and i like it to much

My son loves Chuck Taylor Converse All Stars, and these are so durable! He wanted the high tops this time, so I got these for him. He loves them, and they came so quickly even though it was during Christmas season rush.

This is the third pair of Five Ten Spire shoes that I have owned. They are great for long days on multi-pitch climbs. The leather upper forms to my feet and gives just enough to make a great all day shoe. The four star rating is because they seem to wear a little faster than my other shoes. If you are looking for comfort and performance for an entry level price, this is one shoe to try.
These are possibly the world's best shoes. They're cute, comfortable, and last forever. They have great arch support and the seller shipped them quickly.Thumbs up!

I purchased these shoes before knee replacement surgery. They give you such good balance that I was able to leave the walker and cane and walk on my own much sooner than most patients. The shoes are so comfortable I forget I have them on. I am buying for the future. I do not want to ever be without these shoes.

Uncertain about the size, the free return shipping convinced me to order.So glad I did!Dislike shoelaces so the style was great, so was the look and color . I could wear these every day.Now I just need some great looking socks to wear all year round.

A little confusing because the site clearly says Mens / Women's but the emails from the store refers to kid sizes...so I was nervous about not getting the correct size but all worked out GREAT!!!!! I would definitely recommend!!"
I love Capezio products! This shoe is well made and holding up great under constant wear. The shoe size was right on the money.
Excelente y muy responsable vendedor, no tuve ningun contratiempo con la entrega de mi encomienda, lo recomiendo 100%
I love ASICS...I've been using these twice a week for over 3 years now. They're still functional (i.e. no holes, loose sole, etc.).
My son loves these for his theater productions. Soft, bendable and comfortable while taking a beating on stage. I recommend.
These shoes look awesome. They are a little snug at first but after a "breaking in" they feel really light and comfortable. Did I mention they look awesome???
Good. Cheap. Classical Chuck Taylor allready. Buy them.Enought comment. Remember to pray for the Converse. Kiss you dude.Bye. k?

I agree with everyone else who has written that these flip-flops are very comfortable and very nice looking. However, I cannot believe how squeaky they are! I'm embarrassed to wear them around my office as you can hear me coming a mile away. Not sure if I just need to wear them in or if they'll be like this forever. Also agree with most everyone else that they run a little small so order a size up to be safe.
Excellent fit. made well. would definitely purchase again.I wear a 5 1/2 but since these shoes tend to stretch a little over time i purchased a 5.
My granddaughter asked for these at Christmas. She thinks they are awesome and can't wait to wear them to school in the new year.

First let me say that i love naughty monkey shoes! nect these shoes are extremely comfortable and even with the high heel. The color is said to be green but is more or less brown with some army green accents. Thank you for another great pair of shoes.
These sandals were just what I was looking for. They were a little tight when they arrived, but have now stretched out just enough. These will be a favorite this summer.
I got these shoes for my granddaughter for school and she can't wait to start now. great product great price overall very happy.

I used to wear this Newport style a lot several years ago. But had forgotten about them until I was searching for some comfortable shoes with support to wear during my third trimester of pregnancy. This pair ended up being too large (slipped in the heel), but I would have returned them even if they had fit because they are too clunky for my style now.

This merchant has excellent prices on Pleaser brand shoes and boots. I will always look here first for future Pleaser purchases. The boots came quickly and are exactly how they were described. The boots themselves are gorgeous. Thank you so much!
5.11 is good quality. And I was really impressed with the price. I think we have paid more than this for the very same boot.

Years ago, I was walking in a mall somewhere in the US when I first laid eyes on a pair of Havana Joes --- it was these classic oxford design. I thought they were pricey initially but I bought a pair then. They quickly became my favorite midrange shoes --- classy enough to go dining in most resturants wearing chinos and tough enough to go hiking in the woods. Over the years, I've bought Havana Joe Chukkas in both brown and black and Oxfords in brown. The only thing these shoes could not withstand was multiple attacks by my girlfriend's cat on a catnip overdose....argh! (I don't have that girlfriend anymore and I've set out to replace my Havana joes. I recently bought a pair of black oxfords from Amazon prompting this review.Pros:a) Wear like Iron (I have a 5 yr old pair that is still going)b) Look very nicec) Very versatile (from jeans to chinos)d) They come broken in (I think)e) They fit nice (they're a bit wider than most shoes though)Cons:a) They're heavyb) They're so durable that they'll out-endure your feet...so if you walk on hard surfaces all day without a good pair of socks, you will get blisters on your feet...on the other hand, I've played 18 holes of golf with these and no blisters.c) They're getting harder to find...Amazon is one of the few places left in the States that carries Havana Joes.Overall, I can't say enough good things about these shoes. They've been with me across Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Thailand, South America ... wherever I go, I take my Havana Joes as my Primary shoes, a pair of sneakers for heavy duty walking, and a pair of flip flops. In my Havana Joes, I feel that my feet are protected trekking across deserts and classy enough to sit down for a 5 course meal including dessert at most restaurants throughout the world. There are very few shoes out there that are this versatile and durable. Another reviewer labeled them "The Sherman Tank of Dress Shoes," and I couldn't agree more. Fantastic product.I'm a big Indiana Jones fan and I just know that Dr. Jones wears Havana Joes both to lecture and on his world adventures and if the civilization ended tomorrow and somebody said, you can only take one pair of shoes, I'd pick my Havana Joes --- because I know they'd last for as long as I lived and would still look good.Get a Pair, Enjoy, and after you own a pair, hope that Amazon continues to carry these fantastic shoes. I bought from Amazon, shipped fast.

The style of this shoe is exactly what I was looking for. However, the size I ordered was too small and unfortunately it was not available in the size needed, so I had to return it and couldn't get another. Otherwise, I definitely would have kept it.
I love these! This is my second pair. I hope they never stop making them.I live in Florida so I wear them everyday.

I have always like Grasshopper shoes and was pleased to see Amazon had a pair that would suit my needs. They arrived promptly, but sad to say, they were the wrong size. I had omitted to notice they were a W width and I have a narrow foot. The cost and trouble of returning them is not worth it, and nobody here that I know of wears a size 11W, so I'm stuck with them.
I am in the process of buying myself a pair of puma "Anjan".

I HATE to spend big bucks on shoes. I know for some, this price point might not be a big deal, but I am "cheap" and love the deals. That being said, I had a similar pair of sandals ( Naot) and they wore and wore and wore. I was unable to find the same style, and the Mephisto Helen was almost the exact sandal. As someone else wrote, "my foot was home." I have very, very high arches and my feet tend to roll in- this has given me issues with Achilles Tendonitis and more. These sandals hug my feet, support the arch and you do not need to have your toes "hug" the shoe to keep them in place. I have only had this sandal for two weeks and am looking for a second pair...and darn if they are not out of my size! lol Shoes are an investment in your health and comfort. Well worth the price you pay for these!
I love these shoes. They look sexy and they are so comfortable. They go with many different outfits. Love em.
This shoes are legendary, not really too much to say about them. You know it, I know it,.. They're back, more than ever.. get yours now. Confy as the most expensive snickers out there.
Five reviews and no one mentioned that these shoes are vinyl. They are made by Croc, btw. If you want non-leather, these are quite comfortable and look good.

I'm starting my fourth pair of this shoe. I've been running for just over three years and have run over 3900 miles in that time, including four marathons. (Plenty of higher-mileage runners out there, please value my opinion accordingly.)I previously wore the Asics gel 1120 and prefer it over this shoe. The 1120 was better looking and more comfortable. There's nothing wrong with this shoe, however.I have two pairs of the GT 2110 that have about 400 miles on them, and a new pair with only 8 miles of wear. There is a big difference in the level of support/cushion. This shoe doesn't seem to age as well as the gel 1120. Still, I've ran roughly 1300 miles in GT 2110s and can attest to their quality.If you have "normal" feet (do a foot test online), don't waste your money on hundred-dollar shoes, buy these.

I thought the 3 straps were all velcro. What is the use to a disabled person of a shoe that is almost impossible to put on unaided? They are very comfortable for walking but I have reservations about their lasting quality..

Just what you expect - the classic. I got black leather for $15, so it's hard to complain. I subtracted one star because I find them smaller than expected - I wear a 10, ordered a 10, and they are a touch too small (length) for a clog. Not bad enough that I bothered to exchange them, but if I got another pair, I'd get a half-size bigger.
Great conservative work shoe! Comfortable, as a reliable lounger with a pop of style. The color goes with browns and burgundy's, perfectly!
Shipped very quickly, received in two days. Run slightly big. Heavy-duty high quality. Great boots for boys. Might be able to wear next year, too.

In recent months, I've developed severe neuropathy in my feet and legs. The pain, discomfort and other issues caused by this problem made it painful even wearing socks! Since I couldn't wear shoes -- not even my well-worn-in Birkies which were enough to put me into tears -- and, as a consquense, I pretty much becam a shut in. I took up a friend's offer to use her Crocs. I forgot I had the shoes on and considered crying <g> when asked to return them!
These are my first pair of runners as i graduated from walking for my workout.They have been a good support and my feet never hurt.

The shoes themselves are nice looking, but you definately feel the cheapness of the material. The synthetic leather material isn't as soft or pliable as real leather, making the shoes less comfortable than a more expensive shoe of the same look. The sole of the shoe also feels a bit dead, and flat. More cushioning is pretty much needed if you do more than sit on a chair. For the price, its a decent deal. But it would really be worth the cost to go for something a bit more comfortable. Probably last you longer too.
I received my Scout Sandal very quickly. It was in perfect shape and fit just like was supposed to.I am very pleased with the service and the product.

I have owned many Rockport shoes over the years, but these are the first from the Prowalker line I have purchased. I bought them from Amazon's sister company, Zappos. Normally, I wear size 14 but the Prowalkers in 14 were definitely too small, so I ended up with size 15 and those fit fine.I did quite a bit of walking (and driving) in the Prowalkers and they never gave me a problem - comfortable and no irritation from rubbing. The appearance is a bit dressier than most walking shoes, which is exactly what I wanted as I wore them to customer meetings and will wear them on a European vacation later this year.Clearly it is too soon to know about reliability, but I will be sure to update this review should my opinions change.

I purchased these knowing they would fit because I had a pair in another color, but I was wrong they were at least 1/2of a size too large. I returned them but had to pay the postage. I feel like that is unfair because they were sized wrong.

I have a very picky daughter when it comes to clothing... We went all over the place looking for some new shoes for school... She couldn't find anything that she liked so when I got home I gave her Amazon.com and had her look here.... She quickly picked these shoes and I ordered them.... They arrived three days later and she loves them.....Not one complaint!
Great boots. Quick response. Will be ordering more. I have been wearing this product for many years and love them.

You cant go wrong with Chucks. I have been wearing them for the passed year out here in Afghanistan. They hold up nicely in the rough terrain and keep my feet cool during the summer months when the temperature reaches 130 F degrees. When I am back in the states, I wear pencil skirts and pumps to the office but I will never outgrow Chucks. I wear them on the weekends during coffee runs or for grocery shopping.

I am providing an update to a negative experience I expressed in a previous review about this vendor. The vendor called me today to discuss my concerns. After our discussions, I felt extremely satisfied, that he is truly focused on his customers and provides a quality service. My situation was rectified and I am extremely satisfied and would not hesitate to order again from this vendor. It is wonderful to still have people who care about their product, reputation and their customer base

These are approach shoes not hiking shoes -meaning they're at their best running around rocks and boulders, not on just dirt trails (note tread - designed for gripping on a relatively smooth rock surface, not knobby like a trail runner). Toe box is on the narrow side like a climbing shoe. I like these a great deal for scrambling around places like Joshua Tree. I can climb up to mid 5s with them. Better smearing than edging. Had them 2 years and still holding up but now looking for a new pair. Highly recommended.

I have 2 pairs of this model shoe and love them. After being a Nike fan for years I decided to give something else a try. This shoe is lightweight and very comfortable. I also love the classic style. And you can't complain about the nice price.

This is a funny shoe. The bottom is flat,with no arch on the outside ( the inside arch is well developed) and the toes curls up. Works well running but feels odd walking. Works well for me, a heavy runner, and has held up well. Big toe box and true to or slightly large for size.

These boots are gorgeous however I definitely have the sausage effect because of my calves. I don't think I'm stocky. Nonetheless, I can't bear to return them because they are so beautiful. I'm hoping that my legs will get thinner one day and i'll be able to wear them.

My feet and arches were hurting a lot. After a few days in your shoes the pain went away. Whenver, my feet start to ache, I wear the shoes and they feel much better. Excellent support and comfort, I also bought 1/2 size larger and wear thicker sox. I will probably buy them again. Great quality for the money.
they do a really good job; fast shipping and the item was in very good condition i give them 6 stars!!!!!!!!!!!!!

these shoes were very comfy for me. i had them for 2 season (high school then aau) no matter what size you are, if u have wide feet...these are the shoes for you. there comfy dont worry about the looks. they're light and you will never sprain or twist your ankles.hope this helps a little
These shoes have tons of support and breathing room. I use them for running and I really like them!

The product was is in great quality as expected from the Timberland brand. The only issue I had was that the shoe came looking new from the outside whole the inside showed sines of wear (dirt scuffs, sand, etc.) which disappointed me since the shoe was a gift for a loved one. The shoes are comfortable and well supported as reported to me. Be careful when you go with white. Stains only come off if you clean them right away. Scuffs are easily noticeable and near impossible to get off. The colors in the pictures on Amazon are very accurate.I would definitely buy them again and would reccommend it to others.

These are very nice shoes, but the site showed them available in a triplewide but what was shipped was a double wide. So, they were too small for my mother-in-law to wear. This was real frustrating because she has such a hard time finding shoes that fit and my husband spent quite a bit of time shopping on the internet. They were sure they had found an answer when they ordered these sandals. We got our refund (minus shipping) and that's all good, but we wish the shoes had been what they were represented to be in the beginning!

When i saw these spikes i knew they were for me as they look and now feel comfortable but keep the precision which a runner needs upon the track. The responsive feel and the good looks make this pair of spikes the 'cream of the crop' and since ive had them all my training partners keep staring at my feet.

I have used these in my cross country ski boots for the past year. We live in Alaska and it was cold last winter. They really helped, and they did not slip in my boots at all. I am 63 and my feet get cold fairly easily any more, and these helped me stay out and ski in 0 and below temperatures.

I previously owned a pair of these sandals (over 5 years ago) which I really liked, but for some reason they no longer fit confortably. I decided to order them in a wide width thinking that might be the problem now that I no longer wear high heels, but more casual, loose fitting shoes. My new sandals fit beautifully. I can wear them all day long in complete comfort. I'm really glad I gave them a second try because I really like the style and have always thought them to be an attractive shoe too.

The GT-2100 from Asics is a phenomenal shoe. It provides the best support of any stability shoe around, and has been voted the best running shoe in the World by Runner's World. Though not made for heavy over-pronaters, this is a fantastic shoe for those who do not or just slightly over-pronate. It also provides fantastic supposrt for those with weaker ankles or knees. An all-around fantastic piece of equipment.

I purchased a white pair of Keds tennis shoes recently. When they arrived, they looked wonderful and fit like a glove...I just loved them! After a week or so, they needed washed, so I put them in the washing machine with a load of whites and used cold water and a name brand laundry detergent. Imagine my surprise when I removed them from the washer to air dry, and discovered they were now a light blue color! Evidently the dark, royal blue foot liner 'bleeds'. It looks like I have a blue pair of Keds tennis shoes now...

I had been looking at these shoes for a while but the price was a little much... So waiting paid off!!! These shoes fit perfect they have a great arch and if they are working out my legs and bottom I can't tell!! Thats how comfortable they are!! I own another pair of sandals from earth and am looking to get a pair of boots.. Thanks Amazon
i think that this sneaker was a bit tight but otherwise a good buy. waiting to procure a similar item.

I have been wearing Chucks since I came out of the womb. I've been through many pairs, and after I decided to retire my old black ones due to a blown out heel I wanted to go with something new. The white is really an eye catching color, and more subdued in person than some of the pictures out there. BE WARNED, Chucks are about a size bigger than your actual shoe size. For example I wear a size 7 in women's, which would be a size 5 in Chucks, but these are really too big so I went with the size 4. I find the white adds some contrast, especially if you wear dark colors like I do.
I am normally a 7 so i ordered an 8 and yes these shoes are pretty slippery but you can buy stickers that you can put at the bottom of the shoe! i love them and think they were a very good price
This is a great sneaker in any color. Narrow is pretty narrow however. You can not go wrong with this shoe.

The Angioline Liberty Flats are available in numerous colors for a reason. The comfort, fit, quality, and appearance can't be beaten. No matter what you wear, there's a color of shoes to match, and they always look nice. I have many people ask me where I buy my shoes, and I'm more than happy to tell them. I recommend The Shoe Mall, and Angioline shoes to anyone who'll listen.

I have been wearing Softwalk brand for many years. This is a very comfortable slip-on with padding in all the right places. I also have the Jupiter style. This particular pair felt a little tight at first but that is because my old pair are so worn and stretched out. You should try them on with the thickest socks that you intend to wear with them. These are definitely worth the money for the quality, and Amazon's price is better than anywhere else.

I received my 9.5 N ballet shoes today. Before ordering, I measured my foot from tip of big toe to end of heel.Using that number, I decided to go a half size larger "just in case" some of the people who warned "too small" were talking about my kind of foot. Well, the shoes are even too small at half a size larger!! I always buy athletic shoes one whole size longer. If I buy these again, I will do that---so if you wear a 9, get a 10! The ballet shoes have the curved toe, and that design makes the big toe land on one of the short curved sides...well, mine anyway. Also, I have a very narrow heel, and they are too big in the heel...so too short and too wide a heel if you need a narrow size. However, I will keep them and maybe order a size 10N. Do measure your foot standing on a tape measurer, and to whatever size it says to get in the measurement instructions add one full size. I want to kick myself! : kkp

This has been a very unpleasant e-commerce buying experience. It has changed my mind about purchasing some items on line. I ordered some Roper boots from Bargain Outfitters. They came in a timely manner, when I tried them on they did not fit me. I decided to send them back immediately and because there was no address other than the one on the box and it was the same on the paper insert that was given to me, that is where I sent it back. I sent it UPS ground and it was delivered the next day. That was 3 weeks ago. I am still waiting for my refund because they are busy and can't get around to finding this box and refunding my money. I am wondering if I will ever receive a refund and what my recourse is going to be.

Just what you would expect if you owned a pair of these 10, 20, 30 years ago, except with a custom peace sign logo on the outside only.They do sure highlight however just how far shoe technology has come by comparison to a pair of ASICS running shoes - in terms of support, comfort etc. They are 30 year old or more shoe technology.I hoped that logo would be on both sides but the inseam side of the shoe bears the traditional converse chuck taylor logo.Still, 5 stars from my view. They are what they are supposed to be.
I love my chuck Taylors. They go well with Jeans or almost anything that I want to wear. Looking to buy the Chocolate next.

I'm on my feet all day as a Central office tech. My work has me crawling on the floor to climbing ladders.I've bought 3 pairs of these shoes in multiple colors because they give my feet support and protections. There is also enough room in the shoe to add orthotics which has helped my lower back.

Nice stable shoe. I did have to take them to have heel tips put on as they don't come with any, cost was $10 at my shoe repair. I wanted a pair of basic black shoes with leather soles without paying a fortune for them. I can't believe what we have to go through to find women's shoes with leather soles anymore. Ridiculous. But these worked out nice. I can wear them on the street and if an opportunity to dance comes up, I can dance in them as well. I did order them in a wide (I normally wear medium) since many reviewers stated they run tight. I'm glad I did, they fit perfectly and are very comfortable for walking or dancing.
Love them, I get lots of compliments when I wear them. Loved them so much I had to buy a pair for my daughter.
I like black sneakers best because you can pull them off going to casual social things like neighborhood parties, cookouts, etc. and they dont look dumpy.these are comforatable and break in nicely.
Got a picky little critter who thinks she's dancing for the Moscow Ballet...She loves these. Comfortable, good quality and look good.

I must say that a large part of the glowing review I'm about to give is due to the color of my shoes, which, incidentally, is not shown among the dozen or so variants available here. My pair of 574's are mostly black, with light grey "N" logos stitched on, a white strip above the sole, white portions by the top lace eyelets, and a PALE YELLOW rear "kick guard" or whatever you'd like the call the plastic strip on the back. This particular combo looks killer, and I don't see it here.But I digress... Typically, when one goes to buy a casual sneaker, they have two things in mind: Looks and comfort. Sometimes, comfort even comes AFTER looks if you are really bent on your appearance. Versatility and longevity are OFTEN not primary factors. It's a street sneaker; you aren't looking for high-end sprinting performance to rival Usain Bolt, or the ability to wade through crocodile-infested swamps while silently pursuing a band of ruthless mercenaries.The New Balance 574 delivers soundly in both leading categories of looks and comfort. For the first 20 minutes of wearing them and strolling around, I was alarmed by the awkward feeling they provided, as with every pair of new shoes (particularly New Balance) that I have bought. This quickly subsided as my feet readily accustomed to the shoes, and now they feel like part of my body. So...comfort, check.And the LOOKS... When I first stumbled across the 574, I had frankly gotten sick of the typical shoe design--lots of cheap "synthetic uppers" made of whatever synthetic material it is they use, and "bling" in the form of gaudy, glued-on plastic trash that usually peeled off after a few weeks and contributed a frenetic, busy appearance reminiscent of a Jackson Pollock painting. The 574 does away with this nonsense. First off, forget what cliches may exist for suede shoes (especially blue ones), the suede used for the uppers on these is MUCH nicer than the typical "synthetic" [material]. In addition, the shoe is simple (at least mine are, with only neutral tones) and lacks glued-on tidbits, meaning that you won't be leaving a trail of spare parts behind you once the shoes age a bit. The big "N" logos scream "retro" and I think they look pretty cool. I see a lot of folks wearing New Balance shoes, and although all of them are pretty good quality, mine seem unique and a step above the typical "generic" style.But wait, there's more! So they are comfortable, and look the part. What about those "bonus" features? Well, I haven't gone on a mercenary pursuit lately, but I can say that I jog, cycle, exercise, walk around the kitchen, go to class, go to work, drive, and push cars with these things...no problem. What's more, and this is entirely true, I rode a camel up Mt. Sinai (yes, THE Mt. Sinai in Egypt, and yes, a CAMEL) and then walked all the way back down...in these shoes. And they LITERALLY look "none the worse for the wear." Seriously, they aren't high-traction hiking shoes, so I slipped a bit on the gravel (though proud to say I never FELL) and these shoes didn't have a mark on them afterward.Moral of the story? If you like suede, retro-ish, comfortable, durable, and generally great shoes that don't require a trip to the loan officer at your local bank, then don't hesitate to buy the New Balance M574 sneakers. They really are that good.

I really love my Havaianas fitflops!! I wore it when we went to south Carolina for summer vacation.. and its really comfortable to my feet. And I like the color, you can match it in any color of your short. It flatters my feet :) I really recommend this product

Propet Women's Breeze Walker SandalI have n't bought many shoes on line, but I actually had tried on this model while shopping a few weeks earlier. However I couldn't imagine how luxuriously comfortable it would be. I am wearing it everywhere - church, work, shopping - it's that comfortable. They are also very lightweight and easily wiped off. And they were ten dollars cheaper than at the "outlet" store where I was shopping. What a bargain.
The person I purchased them for feel they are very comfortable. I was worried at first with buying boots from on line, but it turned out ok.
I now own five pairs!!! All in different colors! Hope they never stop selling them!

My new Topsiders have a better initial fit than all my previous pairs. I guess being produced in China has slightly changed the dimensions, in my case to the better.This pair is the two-toned version (brown & black) which are best for traveling as they will go with any color clothing. They used to have another travel advantage as after 9/11 they were the only pair of shoes you didn't have to remove at airport security. The TSA folks knew they had no arch support and wouldn't set off the metal detectors. Unfortunately, during the last year the TSA now insist all shoes go through the x-ray machine.I have owned many pair in the past several decades including the Gold Cup (which are the most comfortable with the best support - although a bit pricey) and this is the first pair that make my feet black when not wearing socks. Evidently, the dye they are now using is not colorfast. They have not been wet or worn on the water yet, they have only been worn in an urban environment. Hopefully, with age they will stop bleeding.Otherwise, if they can correct the dye problem, they appear to be well constructed even though they are now made in China.

I need a dress shoes without heels due to a bad back. These shoes were sold out at the local shoe, but Amazon saved the day! A perfect fit with soft leather uppers and patent leather toe and heel, goes perfectly with pants or skirts. The very first time I purchased shoes online and it was a success!

I ordered this shoe in white, I was very skeptical because of the price, but I was not disappointed, they were comfortable I loved them they set my black bubble dress off, I got tons of compliments. LOVE these shoes I will be ordering 2 more pair of them the red and the black

I bought my puma's on amazon like 4 years ago, before everyone else started wearing them. I can't stand big giant basketball shoes with velcro, and springs that look like space boots. If you want nice casual kicks you need to get some pumas. They have tons of cool colors and you can't go wrong with black. Who doesn't love these.

They're cheap, what can I say?Cheaply made.No padding for your feet. NONE.Need to break them in or they'll scrape the bejesus out of your heels.The strap seriously hurts your foot too.Payless.com is now making platforms by.. Brash, I think. They're much better quality and cheaper as well.

I followed the recommendation of ordering down 1 full size on this boot. I did that just like the slippers but that is not the case on these. I recommend ordering your true size. Other than the size issue I returned and went to the store and bought them there as I was going away and could not wait for them to be replaced. Ugg is truly a great product and again boots order your true size....Just my opinion. : ) Happy Feet
Happy to locate these shoes at such a great price & in my size. A replacement for a well-worn pair. Thanks.

i'm somewhat like the other reviewer...these shoes are beautiful but your feet slide in them..i would recommend getting those sole inserts to prevent this from happen...my cousin has a pair and agree to this and the shoes are absolutely wearable with beauty

My wife has owned numerous pairs of these sneakers over the past ten years. When she received her latest pair, it was obvious that manufacturing standards had changed. These 61/2 d's were much smaller than prior 6 1/2 ds. The shoe was not as wide nor was it as long. Quality control very poor.

My husband has an injury to his heel that requires him to wear shoes with excellent support. These shoes fit the bill....and Amazon had the best price! These shoes usually run from $99 to $119, and they have to be replaced (in this case) every three to four months. So I have to find the best price I can. They will last alot longer for the average person...fit is great, style, materials too.

Bought a pair of men's 10 1/2 in mid 2009. Don't hike as much as I used to so had only used them 4 times by Aug 2012 when the sole came off the heel of one. Way out of Asolo's 1 yr warranty. Still, because the boots showed almost no wear, I contacted Asolo and explained the situation. They immmediately arranged for a complete sole replacement. Had to pay shipping one way to their cobbler, but the repair and return shipping was at no cost to me. Kudos to Asolo for standing behind their product. This was clearly a material or workmanship defect, not a wear issue. In fact, all Asolo wanted to know was where and when I had bought them, then they approved the repair. Makes me suspect perhaps they knew of a bad lot that was prone to failure. Doesn't matter, they fixed the problem.Otherwise, I have found these boots to be very comfortable with almost no break in required. I've done a fair bit of hiking in rough country over the years, a lot of it in the Whites of NH. The cushioning provided by the Asolo sole systems really makes a difference. These boots give good support for backpacking in rough country and are light for the support they provide. A top notch product. I would have rated them 5 stars if they had not suffered the sole separation. However, Asolo gets 5 stars for repairing them.
I owned several of these back in the day, and they still stand as one of most comfortable shoes of that era.

This type of sneaker is not a durable quality sneaker at all. I have purchased at tag sales old Ked's sneakers for $3-$5 dollars which were much more durable. I save this pair purchased for going out on business trips or the like since this type of Ked's sneakers wouldn't last a week with my daily work chores, sad to say.

I have worn Keds for over 50 years and I love them. The last pair I had had something different about the instep that wasn't as comfortable as usual but his pair is wonderful! I like them because they're not bulky like a lot of the sneakers out there now!

I didn't notice the buckle when I ordered, but the shoe fits so well that the little extra time involved doesn't bother me at all. I ordered it in red (not a bright true red, but toned-down - think medium rust with touch of pink and chocolate). It will go with most things in my closet. Propet is a wonderful shoe - I have a similar sandal in tan with two velcro straps and a closed back (a "tennis shoe" sandal), and a boot with 2" heel. All are very comfortable - at this age, the most important detail in footwear!

After one or two weeks of break in period,these rockport prowalkers are the most comfortable shoes I've ever had,bar none. This includes any top of the line running shoes I've had such as New Balance. Ecellent value and comfort! Can't beat it!

The shoes run large so order a half-size lower than normal. They just didn't fit right on my Mom, she was really disappointed. Usually Easy Spirit is more true to size.
Sperry Top-Sider Men's Nautical Billfish 3-Eye Boat Shoe, The third pair in about 12 yrs. I wear the heck out of them and they wear great and are confortable. Highly recommend them

I like these shoes very much, i have bought over 12 pairs of shoes from amazon, and these rank in my top 3 pairs. Very white, very easy to keep clean. I have wide feet, and these are not tight at all.
These shoes are really comfortable and look really nice too. I'd definitely recommend them. They are the first new balance shoes I've gotten and I think my next pair will be New Balance too :)

These are authorized for military to wear at my deployed location and they are comfortable and convienent to and from the DFAC and bathroom. I wear my crocs as much as possible to help air out my feet. I wear them to the pool as well as when I take a shower. Mad props to these crocs.

The brown ones, although marked the same size, were a whole size too big. I sent them back and ordered the brown shoes in a 6 EEE and they now fit just as well as the black ones that are 6 1/2 EEE. It seems there is a size difference between the colors, with the brown ones running a whole size bigger than marked.

I recently retired my ASICS 1110s after racking up 300 miles. These shoes are by far the best value for runners!I used to wear Nike, but read in Runner's World Magazine that the ASICS 1100 was the Editor's Choice for best overall running shoe, so I thought, why not? In the past I've dealt with shin splints, knee pain and plantar facitis (a.k.a. sore feet), but my ASICS 1100s kept me healthy and comfortable, and relatively stylish.I now own ASICS Kayano running shoes, which cost $135 - considerably more than the 1100s - and truthfully, I find no difference between the two pair of running shoes except for the price.I ran about 15 - 20 miles per week in these shoes, enjoying superior comfort. If you run short or medium distances (<25 miles per week), this is the shoe for you.
These are the ONLY shoes I've wanted this tear, and i found them here for the best price, after browsing the malls

Works great outside and at the climbing gym. Very comfortable. This shoe stretches more than the La Sportiva Cliff model. Normally wear a Cliff 43 that's tight and went with a Mythos 42.5. I fit the shoe with my toes slightly curled/slightly uncomfortable. (I have the kind of feet with the longer second toe.) The shoe stretched to a tight fit after a total of about 15 hrs of climbing at the gym. I'm confident they'll fit perfect in a short amount of time. I'd buy them again.

I bought these shoes as a beater pair to only use while playing basketball outdoors. I have been pleasantly surprised at the good cushioning, comfortable fit, and great traction these shoes provide. I now use these shoes as my primary basketball shoes for indoor or out. I've had the shoes for a few months now and they have proven to be very durable as well. My only complaint is that if you get one of the glossy colors, it scuffs easily - but it's only cosmetic.

I have a 6+ year old pair of the guide tennies and have really enjoyed them but they are too worn for serious trips so I thought to buy a new pair. After reading the mixed reviews here I was questioning myself but went ahead and bought them anyhow. They do fit a bit more snug than my old pair but once I loosened the strings around the toe area they fit just great. I did 4 seperate, 3 mile warmup hikes with them and they remained comfortable out of the box. This past weekend I used them to approach and climb a 9,400' peak. It was close to 12 miles car to car, 13,000 feet of elevation gain and loss. Snow and wet rock on the mountain, rain on the descent. These shoes had no problems on the wet granite and remained comfortable even soaked from the rain. There has been no delamination of the soles that others have mentioned. Possibly people were climbing in extreme heat when they experienced that. I wholly recommend them.

I purchased these boots in size 8.5 in Russet Rebel. I'm usually a perfect 8.5, but they were really large on the bridge of my feet and huge on my calves (I've heard that cowboy boots are supposed to be looser on your calves than other boots, but this was extreme), so I returned them for an 8, which has worked well. They were a little stiff at first (which was not surprising, as they're leather), but they've loosened up nicely after a day or two of wear. They're cute, and I've worn them so far with jeans and with a skirt and tights. Fun, cute boots, and I really like the stitching.

First time I tried on Clarks. Very nice looking shoe. Extremely comfortable right out of the box. Soft leather, padding below the ankles very soft. Only problem was the sizing is generous. Have to return the shoes but ordered one half size smaller. Liked them to much not to try again.

This pair of converse was just what I expected; they were one my son's Christmas presents. The colors available were more varied than those I'd seen in local stores and the price was better. This item arrived sooner than promised, too. Needless to say, my son was pleased.

My DH has worn Clark oxfords for some time and says they are the best fitting and most comfortable shoes he has ever owned. This new pair of Clarks, the Citadel Oxford, is his new favorite because it is light weight, casual, and so comfortable.

These flip flops are not the same as the Reef GINGER flip flops I bought a couple years ago and still use. There is not as much arch support as my old pair and they feel kind of like cheap styrofoam soles. I'm still going to wear them, but if you are buying these to replace an older pair... they are not the same. On the positive, they are true to size. I wear a size 8 and they fit.

They are snug and luxurious. The height is terrific for completely warming the ankle for someone like me with poor circulation. Compared to lessor cost ones, there is no comparison as these are excellent and well made.

Great service from Amazon as always. The shoes are sweet, comfortable, and the inner lining is so pretty. The only issue I found was that they are bigger than expected. I had to exchange for a smaller size and the sides of the shoes still hang off my feet rather than sitting snug, but for the price, not a bad shoe.

Several years ago I had problems running to include back pain and shin splints and was limited to running 2 or 3 miles at a time. I absolutely hated running, and I attribute this to ill-fitting shoes. After lots of searching for a new pair of shoes, I was recommended a pair of New Balance shoes...can't remember the exact model, but it was a predecessor to the 856. Within a year, I was able to run 2 half-marathons and a full marathon. These shoes eliminated all complications...great for my overpronation and low arches. I have ordered 2 or 3 pairs at a time, paying up to $100 for them. Amazon's deal of $39.99 is a steal...I was told by another shoe dealer that this model was discontinued back in the spring. Good to see they're still available.
The shoes were in excellent quality and the size and the color were correct. Very good product. I am very happy with my purchase.

The shoes were not true to size. I would recommend ordering a smaller size than the actual shoe size. I followed what everyone else said by ordering the bigger size and in all actuality i should have ordered her correct size or even a size smaller. Other than that they seem to have been great shoes.

Of all the croc models I've tried, the Mary Janes rate as my absolute favorites! I find them amazingly comfortable, and now have them in 2 different colors which I wear all the time. The pulse red, however was a major disappointment since despite its name, it is not red at all, but an orangey melon color. Wasn't worth returning, so I gave them away as I would never wear that color. Too bad the color wasn't clearer.

I loved the look of these shoes, but comfort wise they leave much to be desired. they are very hard and thin soled (which is why they look cute), but i cant imagine walking much distance on cement in them, much less running.they are good everyday type shoes but not for anything athletic.(the ones I tried are true to size, but diff colors do apparently run differently)
THESE BOOTS ARE GREAT! I GOT THE DARK BROWN COLOR AND THEY GO WITH EVERYTHING. VERY COMFORTABLE AND KEEP MY FEET WARM ALL DAY. ORDERING WAS EASY AND I RECEIVED MY BOOTS IN A WEEK.
WOW! I've worn these for many years. I can't believe that they are now made of plastic. I'll be looking for anything else.

Bought white Keds for my daughter. She loves them, but after just 4 weeks they are showing structural wear and tear. They were only $20, so not over the top expensive, but I remember when Keds lasted for multiple seasons so I guess I am nostalgic...

It's a great shoe with a great design. Feels comfortable over all, however the front of the shoe rubs on the top of my big toe and has caused a blister of sorts. I believe this is due to the design of the shoe being somewhat restricted in the front with little room for my toes to feel comfortable which ends up with the top of the shoe rubbing on it constantly after a long days work. This causes mild comfort issues and if I could return it I would (problem came about after 4-5 day usage).

They fitted fine, but when I was removing them the zippers got jammed and on one I had to destroy the zipper to get it off and the other I was able to remove with the zipper still jammed. I whish they made a boots that are not all the way to below the knee. I do superhero costumes and I like the range of colors they have. I would to liked to know more information on getting boots for a larger calf's I am not the only person that has this problem and now I may have to order a second pair of boots to replace the ones that got damaged.
GREAT BOOT FOR A GREAT PRICE,THE LOWEST PRICE AND BEST QUALITY ON THE NET.WOULD DEFINETLY BUY AGAIN.THANKS AGAIN FOR A GREAT SITE.

I have tried expensive tennis shoes and other so called nursing shoes... these are by far the most comfortable shoes!!! If you spend hours on your feet doing patient care, you need to try these. I think you will agree.

What I like most about them is they have a built in arch which is great for people like me who have a low arch or are flatfooted. Also the price at Amazon.com is a great buy compared to what I have payed for them in the past at other places.

Anyways, these are really comfortable shoes and the styling is just awesome. I wear them to work pretty much every day. I think it goes well with casual and semi-casual dressup.

These shoes definitely run one whole size smaller than you normally wear. I didn't listen to the previous reviews and only got a 1/2 size bigger. Big mistake!! I normally wear an 8. So I had to return it for a 9 and that worked just fine. Really happy with them.

can't ever go wrong with a pair of chucks! they always say go a half a size down, but in my boyfriends case he had to go a full size down, and me i'm safe with going half a size down..so it definitly varys
I've always loved the Hi-Tec Altitude boots. This will be my third pair of them. They were only replaced due to the wear and tear on them through the years I've had them.

it looks really cool and really comforible. everything on it is great except sometimes there will be some dirt that sticks to the dark black part in the front even if im not walking by dirt.

These tennis shoes are the best! No more "tennis toes." Comfortable, with roomy toe box...and vented to let the air in. (Buy one-half size larger than you usually take.) I hope K-Swiss will continue to make them.

These are the most comfortable flip-flops I've ever had. They are so soft, yet sturdy. I have many pairs in lots of colors and wear them every chance I get. I think they're different because they're made of rubber instead of foam. More expensive than the cheap ones at Target that cost $2, but worth the $15 or so for these. They are so comfortable! You will love them.

Read a review on Surfline about this product and decided it was what I needed to dry my booties fast and get rid of that horrible smell. First of all I got this product really quickly, a few days earlier than expected. When you get it, just take it out of the box and it is ready to use, nothing complicated about using it. Has a timed venting system that uses room temp air or heated air. The heated air is not so hot that it would damage your booties, but I have only used the heat for the first hour and a half of drying then switch to no heat and the booties dry within a few hours. My booties are dry for my next morning session and the best part is that with every use that terrible smell is going away. This device is small and does not take up a lot of room. I love it and it is worth every penny to keep my booties dry and smell free.

My son loves this shoe. I've bought him several pairs. When he outgrew one pair of these, he wanted them again for his next pair of shoes. I printed out the size guide from the Stride-Rite website. I love this shoe. It's dressy, but casual enough for every day summer wear, and it's comfortable for walking around every day. I bought one years ago at a retail store, then when they started breaking down I tried to find another shoe that fit the casual-dressy-comfortable category and couldn't find anything else that came close. I found these here, and ordered the same ones I had before, and am very happy about it. Just wish they had the other colors in stock for size 6!
These shoes are great! I had a pair already and wanted a spare...could not find them locally but found them on Amazon.Amazon has almost everything I want and provides great service as well!

I had to buy several Converse All-Star shoes for my newly formed basketball league. The wife recommended buying them at the German retail giant Kohl's. She wanted to use the 30% off coupon. But for some reason them Germans don't want to carry the in-between shoe sizes for those rare instances of humans that fit somewhere in the middle of 10 and 11.Thanks to the a seller on the Amazon Marketplace, I was able to get a pair at a comparable price that was shipped merely a day later after ordering! Yay to my new league getting to finally play their first game!
Middle-aged, Fat Guy Running With Stress Fractures, Calcium Deposits, Shin Splints & Bone Spurs (Not a pretty sight): these shoes.

I have a pair of these shoes in brown that I bought some time ago. I love them, although they are getting older now and starting to show smudges and wear. They are still comfortable, but don't look as good as they did. I feel I got my money out of them and am not disappointed at all on their life. They looked great with jeans or dress pants, and are comfortable and well built, although sometimes my friends would tease and call them my "manly shoes". The only reason I haven't replaced this particular shoe yet is because I have gotten spoiled with the other Eastland shoes that are slip-ons, where these require lacing. Not to sound lazy, but it is much easier when your hands are full to slip the shoes on or off at the door, rather than lacing in or out. If an oxford is what you are looking for, I would recommend this one without reservation. They are comfortable, solid, and I didn't slip and slide in them in bad weather either.

The black version of the Itasca SeaRay Slides arrived on time and in a box. They fit and are moderately comfortable. For the $30 or so shipped, they are about what i would expect. But, these are not some deeply discounted irregulars or end of line, though they may actually be. The are worth the $24.99. The smell of rubber was dominant when i opened up the box. there is no more than a flat piece of thin material separating the rubber from the removable insert. They are light and do fit comfortably but do not , by any means compare to the other higher line mocs that happen to go on some drastic sale and if i am lucky enough to find my size at the same time they go on sale-once every 3years. maybe. So, these seemed to be ok out of the box. i am wearing them and went for a walk without them breaking down and without getting any blisters. They do have a nice back for the achilles tendon and some foam in it with a center portion cut down for easier entry and removal, not much support but a nicer addition. there are elastic gores on each side with very little stretch to them but fine. my size was on target.the only real issue was that these were no way first quality or regular. there are glue spots all over the toe and fronts of both shoes. not little ones but sizable and 4 on one shoe and a couple on the other. they do not come off. At first , i thought it was only dust from shipping or a shelf storage. only it didnt come off with a light brushing nor with some water on a cloth. For me, it isnt a big deal because i always spill something i am cooking on my new shoes the first time i wear them anyway. I cant help it, always have, I used to cook for a living and now for amusement so am used to having a couple of oil spots on everything. Some people might be put off by the glue drips. I dont really mind but would normally want to be the one who gets the first spots or stains on my shoes (or shirts) thinking that this time I will keep them in perfect shape for more than a day.For the price i paid ,no problem, had i paid the 'full price' listed on the screen of $60, i would have returned them today-the day i got them.
almost like my last pair that lasted 7 years just a little taller. Rugged holds up well to everyday wear almost the only thing I wear year round.

problems with high arch? This shoe is designed for support and stability. Almost high enough for my very high arch. Great heal support counters tendancy to pronate in or out. Several tighter heal lacing mechanism. Flex plastic waffle support sandwiched between multiple density foam for good cushion and great stability. Just enough front flex to run well without too much flex to painful high arch. Amamzingly long lasting soft, high carbon rubber on 50% sole and rest covered in very grippy yet lasting foam. I thought I'd burn right thru the 3mm+tread carbon but 1000mi later it 2mm tread is blown thru on highest wear portionsOn thrid pair. Each time suprised how long it been when it's time to buy a new pair because the body has started to break down.
These boots last 5-6 years.I used them mostly for winter atving. I also studded the tred with hex head screws for traction on ice.

These shoes are not only fashionable, but the 2 inch sole provides cushioning for the joints. I've had my first pair for about 5 years and they're still going strong. I was on a tennis shoe kick amd wore tennis shoes for about three months and noticed that my knee joints started bothering me. One day I threw my creepers on and I noticed the difference in my joints almost immediately. I ordered 3 pairs and I love them. The key with this product is sizing. Because the style is unisex, you really need to verify whether the product was manufactured in womens or mens sizes. I wear a womens US 9.5, so I ordered a womens 10 in creeper shoes manufactured in womens sizes and a mens 8 in creeper shoes manufactured in mens sizes. I ordered a size 10 in this specific product and they fit perfectly.p.s. I ordered from Exotic High Heels and I found they have the best selection and they were a pleasure to deal with.

I bought these socks for my husband for Christmas and they were a perfect fit! Comfortable and warm! However, he noticed a small tear near the heel of the sock when he put them on. these are great and fit true to size...not too high for dancing...color is close to skin and blends nicely with my leg

I have had shoes that force your foot to conform to its shape, but Crocs conform to your foot! I love my Crocs, they are so comfortable and light, it feels like you are walking on a marshmallow. You can wear them in the shower, driving, in line at the post office or wherever. They come in tons of colors if you look around. My 9 year old son starting wearing these last April, it is November and colder but he still will not wear anything else. He swears that nothing else feels so good. I am buying him another pair due to his growth but the others look like new, they have held up well. They never smell like his tennis, as they are anti-microbial. They mold to your foot as you wear them, and it's your own body heat that does it. The interior actually molds itself to your foot as your body temperature warms and softens the material. They have a nice wide toe box, and a orthotic footbed with good arch support, and it cups your heel nicely. It has little tiny raised bumps on the sole that massage your feet and keep air circulating so you don't get sweaty.They float if you drop them overboard, unlike the rubber clogs from other companies. They are very light, so light they feel like air and you may mistake them for being flimsy but they are tough. When they are dirty you can hose them off, wipe them with a rag and they look new again. They do not tear or scrape, and they leave no marks on the floor, and they give you traction on a wet floor. They have a strap that you can tilt forward like a clog, or slip behind your heel for a more secure fit. There are knock off brands that copy the look but not the feel as the others are heavy rubber, and not comfortable at all. With crocs you can stand on them all day, and they breathe unlike rubber. The nurses really were the first folks to flock to these, since they are on their feet all day they really watch out for comfort first. But these are great at the pool, the beach, wherever, and they are so cheap and come in so many colors you can afford to have a few. Also try Keens Newport H2 sandals.

I had a pair of these years ago when I was climbing more regularly, and used them for years. They have great edging power, and the fit is very tight in all the right places without being such a squeeze that I can't keep them on for longer multi-pitch work. Some people have had problems with quick delaminating--I haven't experienced anything of the sort, but will keep an eye out for it on this pair.

I have to tell anyone, who has lower back or foot pain, to try a pair of Merrells. I ordered a pair of these boots last week, When they came I was disappointed in the quality of one boot's leather, which was very thin, more like glove leather than boot leather. I am reticent to return items and for fifty years I never did. However, something priced over $200 seems a good candidate for a return if it doesn't meet expectations.I shipped the floppy-leather pair back to Amazon myself. I might say please take advantage of their UPS pickup option as the price to ship them yourself is way above the reimbursement you will receive. The return was received yesterday and the new boots arrived today.One thing I immediately noted about the new pair versus the old is that the new came wrapped in tissue paper, with several inspectors tags in the box and with a product tag zip-tied to the boot. The other pair had none of these, which confirmed my suspicion that I'd received someone else's return the first time.The quality of these new boots is much better than those of the previous pair, more like the Danners that I've worn since the I was discharged from the army in 1980. They still don't seem quite as heavy as the old-timey Danners but this is to be expected because the company is making boots advertised to have no break-in period. Right out of the box, they are soft and comfortable and my 10-year-old Danners are quite jealous of their bright new look.
the only problem i had with this shoe was the sizing, i usually wears 8 or 8.5 but the size i bought was 5.5 so it was a little bit unusual!!!

I am going on my 4th pair of Samba Milleniums and I can't wait to get my new ones which should be arriving any time now. I have 3 pair of the original black/white samba milleniums. All three pairs are still in good condition and have a lot of wear left in them. I used to get a new pair of tennis shoes about every 6 months because I wear them every day. However, since obtaining my first pair of samba milleniums, that ratio has become 1 pair of tennis shoes a year and for the past 3 years, it has been the same shoe. I am waiting on a rare limited edition pair of samba milleniums that are red with white stripes and have the liverpool crest on them. I would recommend these shoes to anyone and everyone.

Not many shoe companies bother to make different widths. That's amazing considering that millions live in this country alone and they can't all have the same feet width. The extra width means I no longer get corns and blisters. Plus the show is very good. I'm stuck on New Balance.

I've been doing ballet-style workout DVDs at home lately, and wanted a pair of ballet shoes to use for those workouts so that I'd have better grip and support. I can't speak to how well these work for ballet classes, but I thought that my review might help others like me who are buying these for the same reason.Based on some reviews, I ended up ordering these at first one size larger than what I usually wear in my street shoes. The 8.5 that I bought (instead of my usual 7.5) were huge, but (thanks, Amazon, for your great return policy), I returned these and ordered a 7.5, which fit perfectly.The ribbon at the front of the shoe can be pulled tight to adjust the width of them, and they are very comfortable. They don't have a split sole on the bottom; instead, the sole is one long piece that stretches down the length of the shoe.If you're looking for some at-home ballet-style workouts, I also recommend Mary Helen Bowers'Ballet Beautiful: Total Body WorkoutandBallet Beautiful: Body Blastand Leah Sarago's four workouts, especially her newest oneBallet Body Signature Series: Total Body. All of these are a lot of fun to do, and make me feel like a ballerina!
Excellent ballet shoes. Just remember to buy a size bigger, 'cause they run a bit small. I'm usually a 7 o 7.5, and I had to get an 8.

These shoes look great. They are very trendy and a lot of people are wearing them nowadays. The biggest problem I have with these shoes is that they hurt my feet. The soles are too flat. I walk 30 minutes each day and, whenever possible, buy Ryka brand walking shoes each time I buy new ones. They fit the best of all the brands I have tried since they are made specifically for a woman's foot. I do not get the slippage in the heel like I do with other brands. These are comfortable right out of the box and have a great cushioned feel. This is my second pair of this style. I bought the first last year in a mall store in a size 10, my usual size. They fit fine but, to me, feel a bit shorter than usual. I bought this pair from Amazon in a 10 1/2 (the mall store does not carry 10 1/2 but jump right to an 11). This gives me that tad more room in the length that I wanted. I feel it is probably best to go up 1/2 size in this style. Thanks to Amazon for carrying this half size.
Ordered for a Christmas Gift for a friend. But product looks fine. But Timberland does not make a wide enough width for my feet.
a great shoe, buy a size below what you usually wear. comfy, durable and a great casual look with jeans.

Great support, look and price....will only buy HAVAIANAS from now on, amazing. Going to order them in every color..even great around the house.

That's a product with a long tradition in market and I just was replacing my old sneakers. Coverse really rules.

Was looking for a an all around slim black lace up shoe to take when traveling for walking, exercise, etc. I have wide feet and ordered this one in the D, unfortunately it felt more like an A or B - not even close to being wide enough. Liked the look but it's not for me.

I have large (13 EE) feet and SIDI Dominator Megas are the only quality shoe I can wear comfortably.The lorica material wears like a dream. It breaks in like leather, cleans up with a stiff brush or occasionally, saddle soap, and never curls or changes its shape with moisture. The insoles on the older model (Dominator 4) were chintzy, but have gotten better, although nothing beats Specialized's cycling insoles (also pricey). I've worn Dominators on rides with 10 miles of hike-a-bike and they felt great. The compression strap closures can't be beat and can be replaced separately. Several of my friends also rock SIDIs. Not one complaint. A great Italian shoe.

This is simply the best dress shoe I have ever worn. I have been buying these shoes since 1998. This is my ninth pair in 14 years. the color and texture is more than I expected, too bad the weather was cold enough for me to rock them the way they were intended to be

I bought two pairs of Adidas cleats. This was one of the pairs.I purchased them thinking of the comfort they seemed to provide based on the photo. And yes, they're very comfortable, it's like wearing a regular sneaker, but alas, after 20 minutes of sprinting on the field my legs really began to burn, the weight these cleats have is at least twice that of a regular mid cleat.I'd rather wear some worn down pairs I have at home that these, the unnecessary added strain on my legs is just too much.
have been wearing this style of sandle for years, don't know what i would do without them. and i am a shoe person!

I was looking for a decent pair of running shoes as I had taken up running nearly every morning for close to an hour. I knew I couldn't skimp on price for a decent shoe that would relieve pressure from my knees and provide comfort. I also do NOT go to a gym to run on a treadmill and purchased these for outdoor running purposes.The obvious large support you see at the bottom of the shoe is what sold me on these. However, they are not as supportive as they look. To me, they were a bit uncomfortable to wear and felt a little "heavy" on my feet while running. Again, I run outdoors so the downside of the support visibly seen underneath the shoe means a lot of cleaning as anything & everything will get inside this area if you're an outdoor runner. After runs, I've tracked mud, dirt, sand, grass - whatever my feet happened to cross that day, right back to my house. Everything pretty much becomes embedded into the bottom of the shoe and it's very hard to remove & clean, even when you attempt to do it immediately.These shoes are okay, and probably better for an indoor runner. At the same time, I've bought running shoes that were WAY more comfortable and supportive and DID help with relieving knee pressure that were MUCH cheaper than these. I certainly don't think they are worth the price and would not buy another pair based on that alone. For the amount they cost, I'd expect COMPLETE comfort, durability & support (or at least close to it).I was disappointed with this shoe as it simply just didn't provide enough of what I had expected for the price. I received MUCH more from running shoes that didn't cost nearly as much as these, so that's another reason I find this shoe to be just terribly overpriced and not worth the money.

After reading all these reviews... major are talking very good about product. But... First of all: size- very huge, mine is 7,5(B) for open toes shoes and 8 for all the other... so, this shoes I've ordered 7,5 and they are really huge, I can enter my finger between my heel and shoe heel counter area.... which is very bad considering Nine West size chart.Second: The color is not the same as on a picture, I choosed taupe and if You choose this option You will see beautiful taupe-beige tone... So, in a real is not, it's more faded greyish taupe tone, like it was used before (My opinion only)...The quality looks good, comfortability - i'm not sure because the heel counter area is very hard and due to wrong size I can't say how is.All over, I can't send them back, because I'm in Dominican Republic, so the price to send'em back is very high, it will cost me a fortune of money, so I'll keep them as a Money spent monument...Be warned anyone who buy any item and can't change later...

I use this shoe for training and for racing, for long runs and for interval workouts. My weekly mileage is in the 30-38 mile range, and the Green Silence is a nice, light ride. I believe the weight is advertised as 8.3 ounces, and without getting out my wife's food scale, I'd say that's a pretty accurate estimate. My sense is that there's a limit to the number of miles I'd take this shoe. The cushioning is limited, but the overall feel is pleasantly surprising. Short distances feel really smooth; longer distances slightly less so, compared to traditional trainers. The payoff, though, is the lightweight feel and speed--the exact qualities I want in a shoe when I'm looking to do faster training.

I have had several pairs of this shoe. Looks good and feels great plus I wear a 101/2 which is hard to find. Ido not know why manufacturers of shoes think that after 10 they only make whole sizes. Will probably buy other colors of this shoe.
