Being a marketing major in college....I personally support Kenneth Cole for his genius idea of creating his company as a "Film Production"....I love the style of the shoes, they fit well, and I can wear them at work and then out to the club at night.....however the seam where the leather meets the sole....has begun to come apart... but I wouldn't be necessarily quick to judge that it's the shoes fault...because I have had numerous shoes do this....due to my habit of standing on the sides of my feet....

Just started wearing them, but if they last as long as my last Danner boots, I will be very happy. I had the last pair 5 years, and in my line of work the environment is horrible on boots. Masonry products dry out and destroy every boot I ever owned in several months to a year max. I did nothing to take care of the last pair and they were the made in the USA ones also. These ones fit perfect, 4 full days of just wearing them around town and they are breaking in. My advice is when you spend $140-200 on a pair of supposedly good, Asian made boots and get several months to a year out of them you are wasting money. If you wear your boots for work and motorcycle riding or other activities everyday and get 4 years out of them, that is around $85 per year, if you use good boot dressing and clean the mortar and concrete off and get 5 or 6 years out of them you are way ahead of the game. Bottom line awesome boot and you only get what you pay for. If you only used this boot for recreation purposes and not for everyday destructive work, you may get 10 or even 15 years out of them if taken care of.

I have worn several issue boots that ranged from really good (Matterhorn ICB's) to terrible (Vietnam Era Jungle Boots were still issued in 1999 when I enlisted). USMC issues Danners now, and I have always heard great things about Danner boots. I'm in a rare spot in the military that still wears black boots and these fit the required specs nicely. The comfort is unmatched by anything I have owned to date.For comfort, they required zero break-in period. My only complaint is that the leather is squeaky. Flexing & extending my toe makes a lot of noise (it's not the sole) but this will probably (hopefully) break in. I have never had all-leather boots before, so maybe that is leather's M.O.Unfortunately I am resigned to a desk for the time being so I can't speak to how they do in the elements. They are damm sexy though.The price is good compared to Danner's website and a big thanks to all stores (including this one) on amazon that ship to FPO/APO. It's just like shipping to New York, so spread the word to all the vendors.

This is my second pair. When i first bought my first pair of this shoes i was amaze of how confortable they are. It was incredible the softness inside and how flexible they are. Also they look very cool without socks.
The boots arrived before expected, which was good. The boots fit very good and I wear them almost every day.Couldn't have a better pair.

I really haven't had these boots long enough to rate anything other then the comfort, I got them for Christmas this year 2012 and have only wore them a few times up until now but, I have to say even though they aren't broken in yet, they're one of the most comfortable boots I've ever worn. My wife and I went into the city on the day before New Years eve to do some shopping and see a movie and I wore my new Elk Trackers to try and get them broken in, we were gone from 12 noon until 9:30 that night and my feet felt as good or better than if I'd worn my regular foot ware. I figured because the boots weren't fully broken in my feet would be killing me by the time I got home but, surprisingly that wasn't the case. They fit perfectly, I was told before I ordered them to get a size bigger because they are a tight fit but I didn't take that advice and ordered my size and the fit is right on. All I can say is if your thinking about getting these boots get your size and you won't be sorry, you'll have a very comfortable boot for, I expect, a very long time.

I got these boots for my boyfriend for Christmas and he loves, loves them. He has sensitive feet and is discriminating when it comes to shoes, but he says his feet feel great in these all day. They are very high quality and made in the USA, which makes them worth the price.
Bought these for my son who is a law enforcement officer, he really likes them.

OK, I thought that these things were going to be OK, my wife raved about her pair for weeks now. They are actually pretty great. I just got back inside from shoveling out long driveway which is always a hazard due to the section with a pretty steep slope. It's an extreme hazard when we get snow on top of ice, like this morning. I'm slipped and fallen several times shoveling that slope. With these things on I didn't slip one millimeter. The traction on snow and ice, even on wet ice is incredible. It's essentially like walking around with a lot of cleats on your shoes.A word of caution though, these will be VERY slippery on a glazed tile floor, and will damage most other kinds of floors. Wear them outside ONLY. They give good traction on ice, wet ice, and snow. They don't slip on dry concrete, or our flagstone walk.I saw a review where someone said that they are fragile. My wife has been using a pair for weeks in sub zero temperatures, and she hasn't caused any wear on hers yet. This is the first time I used mine, and they seem pretty tough. If the were any tougher it would be very difficult to get them on a pair of shoes. Also, I don't care if I go through a couple of these a season, they are inexpensive and a LOT better than falling and breaking a wrist or anything else.all in all, a great value. We will probably be getting more.

This has been my first dedicated running shoe in a while. I would say that I have been very pleased with this shoe. It is light, flexible, and very comforable. I suppose that a hard core runner could recomend a better shoe for 3 or 4 times the price, but for a shoe around $50, this is fairly good.
Bought these for my son, and he adores them. He wears them all weekend long, and switches to them as soon as he gets home from school. Comfy, and easy to take off and put back on ...

I have flat feet and have trouble finding shoes that are comfortable.The bone on the side my foot would hurt and nothing seemed to help. I bought a lot shoes in hopes of getting some relief. I was hoping to order these in 10 1/2, but that appeared to not be an option. I have a difficult time with many shoe manufacturers not offering my size. I use extra inner soles & that helps, but I wish my size was available.
This shoe is as to be expected strong and durable for my teenager - she loves it and I am very happy with this purchase

When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.

Super comfortable, I got these in this color because they were cheap. I mainly use them for walking around the barn and after I'm done riding horses and want to switch into something other than my boots.

These shoes were so highly reviewed that I got them, but to be honest they are no more comfortable than any other work shoe I have ever had, maybe even less so for a nurse shoe. They seem sturdy though, so I am hoping the fact that they are average in comfort will not matter because they last a really long time. Fingers crossed.

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. Have owned the white shoes in this style and love them. Was not aware they had black. I got them and they are just like the white. I have no doubt they will perform like the white version.

This is my second pair of Keen Newport shoes and they are my favorite shoes! You will not find a more comfortable pair of walking shoes. I bought my first pair before a trip to Washington D.C. On this trip I averaged 8 miles a day of walking and my feet were fine. This summer right before a trip to New York City I ordered my second pair. This is a beautifully classic shoe and quality is nice. The heel composition is the exception. It is a hard, hard plastic or rubber. It is very slippery on tile or brick floors. Be careful. As other reviewers indicated, the sizing is off. Consider ordering a half size larger.

Actually allowed me to put my orthotics inside these shoes. Usually my orthotics only fit in athetic shoes, so I was pleased. I do have hammer toes, and got a few red spots on top of my toes, but I don't know how I could have avoided that.
the combination of black and white is versitial and its workable
When i saw it online i was happy with the shoe that i got it and was nice,but the sizes are small so you will need to get a biger size then normal.

The shoes were better than I expected. Going by the reviews for this product, I was expecting a lot of dark spots on the leather, but surprisingly there were none. :-)However, the shoes are a little tight and narrow for me. I hope it improves as they are worn more often.

I bought these shoes for my husband/son on a Saturday and they were delivered to my house on the following Tuesday. Super, fast delivery I really like the colors they have in these shoes, they are in a cute style, the quality is good,and the price is great.
Shoe is nice but was disapointed that the dye from the shoe gets on my socks,it was suprising as my feet do not sweat. This is not a good thing.Will not consider this color next time...
I like black sneakers best because you can pull them off going to casual social things like neighborhood parties, cookouts, etc. and they dont look dumpy.these are comforatable and break in nicely.
These shoes were delivered quickly and were exactly as descibed. Very comfortable from the first time out of the box. Highly recommended.

I purchased these boots in white (size 8) to wear with my Halloween costume. You can't beat the price (I paid $27.00+free shipping). The quality is good and they are comfortable. If you have skinny calves like mine, these will be great for you. They fit a little less than snug, but compared to how boots usually swallow my legs whole, I was happy. A word of caution - because these boots have a glossy finish, they will scuff easy. Also, the first time I put them on to "break them in" (which they didn't really need) they seriously scuffed up my lanolium floor. The black scuffs came up easily enough, but you may consider taking a quick stroll down the sidewalk to scruff up the new black soles before you go scuffing someones floor. Overall, I love the boots and will keep them for future wear.

I love that Minnetonka has stayed true to itself. These mocs are just as they have always been...perfect! I bought them for "grounding". I wear them to walk my dog and being out in the yard. So, comfy. Thinking about getting another pair in a different color.
The Boots are great for about two months then break down fast.I think the construction could be alot better,I hope that it can be improved on
I loved my shoes, brand new, in box, great product, fast shipping. Thanks so much!

These are really cute shoes and comfortable. The straps can be a tad bothersome until they are broken in a little and stretched to conform with your foot, but it didn't take much time to do that. I have a couple of pairs and really like the way they look on my feet.

I normally wear an 8.5 (wide, if they have it) so I ordered these shoes a 1/2 size up (and wide) from other reviews suggestions. Welp...it still wasn't enough. These shoes definitely run small, and with hindsight I would have ordered a 9.5. Because it's too small, and because I'm too cheap to send them back, I will wear them anyway and just suffer a little bit from the pinching on the top side of my foot and toe box area. They are very cute though, and the heel is low enough to walk a moderate distance, but tall enough to add a little length to the legs. I took a risk by buying shoes I had never tried on before online, and it was almost a good idea.

I was very pleased to get these shoes, they're very iconic no matter where you go and look great with just about any casual outfit. But after about 10 months of having these, rips between the rubber parts of the shoe and the cloth began to seperate. I'm not sure whether this is due to how my feet fit within the shoe. After trying to fix the seams myself, the shoes soon began to just fall apart really and just became really unwearable. If they were cheaper I would consider getting a second pair and maybe another different pair of shoes along with them. Overall they're still nice shoes, but they may need to be pampered somewhat for them to last a long time.
Best fit I have had for these shoes would recommend them to anyone who is in the market for a soft play shoe..

Its a black K-Swiss tennis shoe. This is a classic unisex style. I bought them for my 3 year old daughter. She loves them because daddy got em for her. I think I might get a pair for my self actually.Oh..and a pair for the wife too (maybe)

kinda nice, but common coloured. Did,nt have the colour that I wanted in my size. Chocolate, sorta rare in this city. Many folks r with classic red that,s cool, though I like the chocolate chuck taylors best. Maybe i'll add another sumthin, shoe strings with prints.........
I absolutely love these shoes, it was the first time I bought a pair of shoes online.

I purchased from the photo. was in a hurry that day. Glad they where the low ones he wanted. novelty item. My son wanted them , he is 30 yrs old. A fun item he used to have many years ago. the size recomendations was correct. 1/2 size smaller was just right.... Not the Hi Tops they state in the add.

I have CMT, 10 fused toes, 4 screws, a tendon anchor, and a missing fascia on one foot. After 5 surgeries in 2 years, I have been looking for dress shoes that would be comfortable for my not normal feet. They are nice to look at, and come with insoles that I could configure for each foot. The extra room for my toes and the wide toe box are perfect. They are light enough that I do not have problems lifting my feet off the ground and that should help eliminate some of my trip/fall issues.I have only worn them around the house, but after 40 minutes of being in them, they were still comfortable. Several other orthopedic brands hurt my feet within minutes of putting them on. They are cute and stylish, and are not clunky. I will be able to wear them for work and medieval reenactment.At the moment I am rating this a 4 out of 5. I am hoping to be able to upgrade that once I have had the opportunity to wear them for a full, busy day.
These are the best shoes I have owned. This is my third pair. Just like wearing slippers from the first day. No break-in period.
These sandals fit comfortably right from the start and can be worn indefinitely without any discomfort!

Dada's are some of the best basketball shoes i have ever had. The only bad thing i have found is the price difference between youth and large. $20.00 more for a bigger size is rediculous, but other than that they are really cool shoes especially how you can personalize them with your teams colors and your team name, your name, and your number. Some of the reasons they are really good shoes are because they are comfortable, have good traction, and just look good.

I love these boots. A little stiff around the ankles at first, but broke in fast wearing them around for a couple of days. True to size and fit great. Waterproof, kept my feet dry when doing activities that normally get my socks soaked. Look cool and have great traction. Excellent value for the price and would definitely buy another pair whenever these wear out.
The quality of the bag is not too good. And the color fades after a few washes.

I wear a lot of flip flops and I can guarantee that Reef's are the best quality out there for your money. I had a pair for almost 5 years that kept up very well. Even thought I try other brands I know that I will always have a pair of Reef's in my closet.
Wonderful product, great quality! I just can't say enough about how much we love them! If you are on the fence about getting these, do it, you will not be disappointed!

I was looking for a low cost, but stylish and comfortable shoe. I tried the malls and the outlets, but I still couldn't find IT! IT had to be black and comfortable, above all. Then one day while browsing through Amazon, I tried looking at Rockports, because I had remembered a pair of Rockports I had years ago. I saw the special price for these Calimesas and decide to take a chance....what could $ 44.00 buy me? Well, it bought me a very good shoe! Leather is great...a Rockport trait...as well as a comfortable fit. They're not a stylish as others I've seen, but the price is right and they have that Rockport comfort. Yes, they're made in China now instead of the USA like they used to be...but the quality is very surprising! Totally satisfied! This is really a great deal!
This is a cute, good quality boot for a little girl. My granddaughter loved them. I would recommend them to anyone looking for an inexpensive, cute, durable boot.
Pretty comfortable from day one. I wish I would have searched the web more. Found them 20 bucks cheaper after purchasing these.

These shoes are awesome. They make my legs feel so good. There was not a break in time. Just felt great from out of the box. I recommend these to all who want an extra little something when doing your walking.

I gave these a five star based on price and performance. I purchased these boots for about 50% off at 50 dollars. They have served well in the snow- waterproof and warm. I probably would have liked the black color more if it was available. As a workboot, the only things lacking are a steel toe and an oil resistant sole. Overall a great shoe.

I've been looking for that color a long time. I was about to custom make them from sears which they can personalize them on line. Very happy with the sneaker. Still looks good after having them twenty years ago

This is my 2nd pair of Propet walkers. I have the other pair that has mesh instead of solid leather, which are good for summer time but not winter when it's wet outside. I wanted a leather pair to keep the moisture out of my shoes when I'm outside & I do walk a lot so a good walking shoe is a must.I'm type 2 diabetic & was having some ingrown toe nail problems. After buying my 1st pair of these shoes, within 3 months I was able to get rid of the ingrown toe nail. The shoes have more toe room & are stable to keep my foot from rolling out when I walk. I was having lots of back pain, and if I don't get a good shoe like i said my foot rolls out & my ankles start to hurt.With these shoes I have no pain, am steady on my feet & the rubber sole is good to keep me from sliding around on wet floors: an added plus.I wanted to mention that these shoes are comfortable, they have a snug fit feel to them, but not so tight that your feet feel crammed. Earlier I was wearing these shoes because my feet were so swollen I couldn't get anything else on except slippers. These went right on, did not make my feet feel crammed, & with the heel pain I was having from the swelling i couldn't feel it.These are really some nice shoes, they are light weight & feel good after being on my feet all day walking around, even when I take the dog for a walk.I've cleaned out my closet of all the other favorite shoes I had, and only have these 2 pairs now. Nothing else can compare to how these feel for me & how well they keep my feet healthy.

wow. these shoes are awesome. they are extremely comfortable. not to mention the attention i have gotten from these (i currently own the blue ones) for instance people laugh and point out the good year insignia on the sides and back, and the distinct colors that these shoes are made in. these definitly attract attenion. and plus they just overall, look real neat. and they are unique. i am in high school, and i am the only person i know that has these shoes in a school of 2100 kids in omaha nebraska. trust me, these shoes are definatly "hip". haha.

I have purchased online through Fogdog in the past; however, the description on Amazon is incorrect. This is NOT a 3 pair pack, it is only one pair of socks for $13.99 plus shipping. What a rip-off. I am deeply disappointed.Pro Feet Mens Acrylic Multi-Sport Tube Sock - 3 Pair Pack

I can always trust Franco Sarto shoes and their quality, but I especially love this shoe. It looks like a classy ballet flat but with the kitten heel, it adds a little more polish. They are very comfortable, and the mix of suede and patent leather on the heel adds a whimsical touch dressing it up. I loved them so much, I ended up ordering 2 more pairs. A bit pricey for a ballet style shoe, but the price is worth it for the wearability and comfort.

OK, they aren't the most fashionable looking. But they are comfortable and sensible. You can walk anywhere and not feel the pain afterwards, or during. I used them in NYC where you have to walk everywhere, need support, some folks actually asked me about these shoes. Perhaps the orange helps compensate for the not so stylish. I got rid of some sandals that are as thin as a wafer, and my feet thank me every day. Love your feet, they take you where you want to go.

I only buy boots every thirty years. These are lighter and better feeling than the heavy clod-hoppers they replaced. My only complaint so far (I've only worn them once to date) is that the bow-part of the laces tends to slip behind the tongue of the boot, coming to rest on my socks.
These are a nice pair of casual work shoes. Very comfortable and decent looking worn with a pair of slacks. They run true to size and I would recommend to anyone looking for work loafer.
My wife loves these boots! She wanted them for Christmas, and was so happy to receive them from Santa. Super warm an comfortable, and she won't take them off.
My daughter loved the shoes. They are good quality and reasonable price. The vendor sent the shoes on time. My daughter says they are "very cool"

1. The colour of the shoes I got is Silver/Silver/Royal, I like it very much. But the acture colour of the shoes is much darker than the picture. So I think chromatic aberration is a serious problem. I love the colour appeared on the picture.2. The size of the shoes is smaller, so I have to return it to champs for a larger one. So please order a larger size(+0.5 at least) than what you wear usually3. The shoes are light and soft, which earning points for it. Otherwise,I think 2-stars score is exact.

I really enjoy purchasing from Amazon.com It has been a pleasure to do business with you. I always receive my purchases in substanial time. It is always in excellent condition when it arrives. Prices are very compatible with what the stores around our area sell for. I will continue making purchases from Amazon.comThank You Amazon.Renay

I have owned several boots from Kenneth Cole but this one rocks! Very slylish and sexy looking, goes great with dark jeans..almost like rockstar looks..I have gotten so many compliments for this boots.

I have absolutely loved this shoe. It is extremely comfortable and looks great. I just now encountered a problem with it though. Yesterday, after only having the shoes for a couple of months, a piece of rubber sole came off the bottom. I will have to find the right glue to reattach it. That is a shame because I really like the shoe.
Great price but lacks in comfort. These shoes are very narrow and I also find them a bit wobbly. Unfortunately, they are not worth returning to amazon for what I paid.
Shoes feel great right out of the box. I've only had a couple of opportunities to wear them so far....and I'm very satisfied!

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE COLOR THEY WOULD HAVE GONE RIGHT BACK.THEY ARE DRESSY ENOUGH FOR WORK ON IN CLEMENT DAYS BUT THAT HARD FOOT BASE ALMOST GOT THESE A 1 STAR RATING.

I think Chuck's look cool, which is why I bought these, but I had no idea they were so uncomfortable. If you can deal with a shoe that has almost no cushion and no arch, then by all means get them (I still wear them every once in a while). But if comfort is a big thing to you, I would look elsewhere.

This is an excellent light-medium weight boot. I wanted to find a reasonably priced hiking boot for weekend trips. This boot meets all of my expectations. It is light but sturdy, waterproof but still "breathes" and it fits according to the size listed. This is not a heavy boot for large pack trips but should be more than enough for light trips.The seller delivered as promised and gave link for tracking. I would defintiely buy from this seller again.
They feel comfortable and true to size. The black and white go with everything. I'll be buying this same pair again.
True to size right out of the box. Extremely comfortable. Can even wear with dress pants (no problem). Overall, great boot. Ordered brown as well after receiving these black ones.

This is a very light weight work shoe. I only wished it was a little wider. I love the heel height butthe back could have been made a little higher. It sits very low on the ankle. The company logo"Eastland" (green tag) should not be glued on to the shoe. The Eastland logo is inside the shoe and that should suffice. I tried removing the tags but its either sewn onto and also glued. We have strict dress coderegarding shoes being black without any logo's showing. I didn't want to risk damaging the shoes by removingthe green tags so I had to color it all black with a permanent marking pen. But I do love the look of the shoes. The heel gives me a bit of height
Came with "foam/cardboard" shoe tree, decent price, comfortable, stylish. It is a good purchase. Just need to wear it for a while longer to see how well it last.

Shoes arrived in wonderful shape; packaged well; exactly what I ordered.However, we ordered the wrong size. Return went well; advised my account would be credited for purchase price only; but there was no stock available nor could they tell me when they would receive more in the size we needed. If you need a specific size, order it ASAP.

I'm on my second pair of Boccas and I love them.I have a wide foot and these fit perfectly.to the person who gave 1 star. I will agree that they run a teeny bit small... but only 1/2 size, not a whole size. the 9s i have fit like other 8-1/2s fit. I have noticed that if i wear them the day after (or later in the day after) wearing heels or any other shoe that irritates my foot a bit, they fit tighter. other shoes make my feet swell, so the Bocca fits a bit more snug.No matter how many other shoes I buy, they always end up in a box ready for donation while I go to back to the Bocca.

I wear these everyday and I find them very comfortable. I have had them for almost a year and they are holding up pretty well. They have a bit of a funky texture on the upper and don't take polish very well, but they are still very solid and look good.

The ad showed a picture of the shoes with dark gray stripes, but the ones they sent were solid white; I can live with the color difference, but the shoes seemed to fit kind of tight and were hard to break in, so you may want to order a larger size in this one.

I have wanted a pair of Doc Martens for the longest time,but simply cannot afford them. Then while browsing Amazon,I found theses skechers,and figured I would give them a shot. I am so glad I did. They are stylish,well made,and most important,sooo comfortable. They are half the price of doc martens,and in my opinion,a much better shoe. Highly recommended !!!!
Great! Bought it for my husband, can't stop him from wearing them every day. They look elegant with short and long jeans, even with cool khakis.

1/26/2010 I purchased one pair of the 802 which is almost exactly like the 801. The bottom of the sole on the 802 is slightly different and the 802 came in black and hot pink with a small amount of a mesh type fabric on the top of the toe area. Other than this the 802 is the 801. I purchased the 802 sometime last spring and liked them so much that I purchased 2 more pair and put them away in case this shoe is discontinued. They are extremely comfortable. I really use them to wear around the house. Obviously, the slip in style is convenient. There is a review of March 2008 giving the shoe 2 stars which I don't understand. I don't know what this person was using the shoe for, but it makes no sense. If you can find them, good luck, I can't imagine that you won't be happy with them. I just purchased for my fiance the 801 mens which arrived yesterday. He has never worn a slip in before, but he liked the concept of my 802 so I thought I'd get him a pair. He opened the box late yesterday afternoon, put them on and that was that. I think he might be sleeping in them! Again, if you can find them, you will more than likely really like them.
I've been wearing this shoe for years. It has always been very comfortable and long-wearing.
My son loves them! So confortable, easy to use, easy to clean and dried super fast.... it's our best sandals ever for summer time! Of course Amazon put them in our door as fast as always!

I have the genuine leather ones, and I see that these say they're faux leather..apart from that,they look identical to mine, which I acquired when someone on a parent cyber forum decided to sell off some mint-condition Birkies in my size.Well, so I was pleased by the arch support etc and wore them home...but had to stop and take them off with big blisters. After that, I was leery...but now i've gone back to them. Again, they are wonderfully supportive of your foot but SO painful on top where the uppers chafe against the skin, no matter what setting you have the buckle at, so you have to carry around boxes of bandaids, and even so my right foot is very red and tender a day later, and I am deliberating whether to give up on this 'breaking in' experiment/torture.i'm not sure why the uppers can't be made super-soft in some way, but it's a real shame because it lets the shoe down. I should think the rigidity of the soles, and the weight they have, makes the problem worse. I've now tried wearing them a number of times, and I don't see any improvement. I may give up on these shoes now. I'm not one of those who walk around in socks and sandals...just looks awful.

Great looking shoes, husband loves these and finds them very comfortable .. Run true to size - gets a pair or two every year!12/27/21 Well they still are a good looking shoe BUT my husband wore them for the first time this morning and the top of both shoes started peeling and cracking -within first hour of wearing!! Be warned something is up with the "leather" ..I read some other reviews seems we are not the only one who has had this problem!

I sit at a computer all day. My left leg was getting bloated and painful. These stockings work just as described. The swelling is gone and the sharp pains are nearly gone. They are nearly identical to the prescription stockings sold at pharmacies.

i received the crocs 2 days after i ordered them. what a pleasant surprise. they fit beautifully and are sooo comfortable. this is my 3rd pair of crocs this year. i wear them everywhere. i highly reccomend them.

have never bought any shoes on this site so have no idea why they have showed up in this items bought

As i say i bought it for a friend and he says that is great. He wasn't wait too long for it (thanks!). He got a RDV with girl, he planned to wear it at the rendez-vous. He was worry thinking will he get it at time.

You can't find a better made boot than this one.I have been in the trades for 25 years and have tried alot of boots out.None have compaired to thorogoods!!(and they are made in america)Quality and american made with pride.I'M SOLD FOR LIFE. You can also resole them!!A+
The purchase took place as expected in estimasdo time, and with respect to the product announcement being sold agrees with what is expected without any complications or problems arise

I ordered three pairs of these over a space of three weeks. I finally got the size I wanted. My experience is that they are a full two sizes larger than what I wanted. I went from a size 13 to a size 11 1/2 before getting it right. The quality is outstanding and with the discounted price it was worth it to return two pair (sizes 13 and 12). kinda nice, but common coloured. Did,nt have the colour that I wanted in my size. Chocolate, sorta rare in this city. Many folks r with classic red that,s cool, though I like the chocolate chuck taylors best. Maybe i'll add another sumthin, shoe strings with prints.........
These shoes have been some of the best I have ever bought. I have been wearing this brand shoes for many years and to find them at this price was great.

Love these shoes - could not find them in ther stores in my area. They hae every color but white. Have a pair but they are really old and wanted a pair that looked nicer. The shoes are comfortable and they look a little more dressy than the normal tennis shoe. Paid a little more than the price at our stores but, they are worth the extra cost.
I love Easy Spirit walking shoes. They aren't a sneaker and don't look like one but that is what they feel like - very comfortable!

Disappointing is the word I'd use to describe this purchase. I had a pair of identical shoes that were about 8 years old. They were pretty worn but I had enjoyed wearing them so much I bought them again.The leather on this shoe is not nearly as soft. Also, there was so much shoe polish on the shoes that it seeps through the leather and if you wear light-colored socks for more than a couple of hours you will take off a pair of socks with brown shoe polish all over them. I've ruined two pairs of socks already thinking that it was just a slight remnant of the assembly process.I'm going to wear them a few more times in hopes that the leather softens up and the polish diminishes but I've already worn them for about 40 hours and there has been little improvement to either problem.
I have been a loyal customer of the ASICS GT-line for over 10 years and I have not yet been disappointed.
Rockport shoes are always very comfortable. My husband has trouble fitting his right foot because of an injury but always find that the prowalker is true to size and a good value for a walking shoe.

The 10.5B fit exactly. I ordered based on being fitted and using other shoes from high quality store, ie. Johnson Murphy, Cole Haan & previous purchased at store: Floresheim.Nice style for relax or work.

I've been wearing Wolverine Work Boots for more than 10 years and have had nothing but great luck with them. They are very comfortable and they last a long time. I personally like the Durashock boots but I've owned both types and they are all great. You won't be disappointed.

crocs Classic Clog,Black,Men's 9 M/Women's 11 M; I never thought I would see the day I would by crocs! I think it might be middle age, and my back injury, lol. They are decently comfortable and easy to slip on and off.They also clean easily in the sinkThe sizes are near exact so if you wear a half size, like 10 1/2, order an 11.

Came on time, store did a great job getting my order to me on time.The shoe on the other hand seems to be made more for a man than a women.The strap does not stay forward, if you decide to wear them without the strap in the back.I have an old pair of these crocks and they are just not the same.

For some reason it was not the right size so I am rating it 3 Stars because of that. The shoe itself looked well made but the aggravation of having to return the shoes and therefore not keep them makes this 3 Stars (average) rating. Please do not let this rating deter anyone from buying the right size. Thank you.

I have been a Rockport consumer for many years and have never found better products for comfort and value. The fact that the wide model fits my feet extremely well with no heel slippage is great. The Prowalker is definitely a very fitting name as I do a lot of walking. Amazon.com does a fantastic job in delivering the product and keeping the customer informed; I ordered the shoes on a Friday and they were delivered the following Wednesday.
I seriously love these shoes. so comfortable. I really don't know how much I can personally write about a shoe but this pair makes me feel like rambo and brad pitt all at the same time.
this was a very good product the fit was good and it came in when it was supposed to all pricing was correct

I plan on wearing this show hiking in Costa Rica. I will update this review with my experiences. I wanted a hiking shoe that could dry quickly in a humid jungle environment, offer foot protection from thorns, and offer decent sole support.About the shoe:This is really a sandal with a proper hiking sole. I am surprised by how heavy duty the sole is - nearly an inch thick, and with greater cushioning than any tennis shoe. The sole performs wonderfully well whether you are carrying a 20 lb pack or walking around with no weight.The upper is extremely well constructed. It will not break and is built to last. See other reviews for the durability of the shoe - one reviewer logged 1200 miles in these.Could not be happier with a shoe for hiking.
Quick shipping, and no problems at all. They have all the colors so you can mix and match

If you plan to use this thing in your hotel room at night to dry boots or gloves, better pack earplugs also!It blows cool air into the boots and dries eventually. Have used it with the AC adapter, expect the batteries would not last too long and make the until quite heavy.

I have owned a pair of these shoes for over 3 years now and am currently going to buy the exact same pair again. I am a nurse and spend hours on my feet and these are the most comfortable shoes I've found. They've held up great! You'll love them too!

I own three pairs of boots made by Double H, all Packers, so I obviously like them a lot.This is my third purchase of the boots. My first was the 9622 which is, sadly, no longer made: I love them and wish Double H would bring them back.In fact, this boot style the 9625 is the replacement of those but I far prefer the 9622's.What guided my buying choice were the following five factors: Waterproof, Made in USA, Price, Comfort, Quality.Price first: These boots are an overall good value.Country of Origin: It is increasingly difficult to purchase boots made right here in the good old USofA and I've about given up on making this a priorty. In fact, my most recent purchase was of Carolina boots that I thought were made here; alas, they are in nearly all sizes but mine. Sheesh.Waterproof: I need waterproof boots, these are supposed to be waterproof, but I do get a surprising shot of water every now and again when I splash water up onto the tongue area.Comfort: This particular pair of boots has just never broken in to a comfy fit; a year later a toe on my right foot still gets sore before a full day of wear. This bugs me.One nice thing about them is that they wear a bit cooler than the model 9635 Gel Packers by this company that I also own. This is especially nice because I wear boots year round and appreciate the relative coolness of this pair.Quality: Part of the reason that I want Made in USA products is that I want high quality. These boots are high quality. I've owned them for about a year with no apparent quality problems.Note that I wear boots on a daily basis and never wear these two days in a row.I recommend these boots with reservations as noted.

This shoe is aesthetically superior to anything on the market, particularly the latest version, a unrivaled gem which sports a navy blue faux-suede. If you don't actually want to PLAY basketball in these, definitely get a pair.However, if you're using the shoe for its intended purpose, I hope you have narrow feet and strong ankles. As a huge fan of the original T-Macs (didn't get the T-Mac 2's because they were too narrow), I was hoping that the 3's would restore my faith in the shoe. I'm a serious baller - I play just about every day and participate in 3 corporate/city leagues.That being said, after only owning these shoes for just three few weeks, I had to return them because I sprained BOTH ankles (never happened with the T-Mac 1's) AND severely bruised my medial and plantar nerves (never happened in my life - ever). Though ankle injuries are all too common in basketball, these injuries did not occur in the typical "landed on someone's foot" fashion, which is cause for serious concern. I consulted my podiatrist on the issue and she informed me that my shoes provided poor support and suggested I look into a pair of New Balances.Additionally, the outside of the shoe will dig into your ankle if you lace your shoes up tightly, as there is no cushioning around the top rim of the shoe.Proceed with caution - do not be wowed by looks, particularly if you need support or have wider feet.

I bought these for powerlifting, as an alternative to much more expensive lifting shoes. They are legal in the organization I lift in, and they are exactly what I need. The flat, thin sole is perfect for squatting and deadlifting with stability and safety.I could see durability of these shoes being a problem IF they were worn as an everyday shoe, i.e., outside, or to work / school. The canvas material is thin, and this is by no means a rugged pair of shoes. But for what I uses them for - strictly in the gym - they are excellent.
Great shoes. I wear an extra wide for Rheumatoid Arthritis but returned for just a wide because they stretch.

I've been a longterm Redwing Boot wearer. I decided to give these boots a try, because there price was about half what you would pay for a pair of Redwings. After wearing the boots for several months I am very impressed. They are just as comfortable as my Redwings were. I've noticed that the leather on the boots isn't quite as tough as what was on the Redwings though, and tends to take deap scratches easier. Only time will tell for sure though.
I'm very happy with my purchase. Columbia is a good brand and this boots fit just perfect. I recommend buying this product.

The boots are comfortable and easy to wear. Are not heavy, which was the main reason I was looking to replace my other pair. The boots are durable and appropriate for the snowy winter in Boston. Water does not penetrate them at the bottom. Nice buy!
Not what I expected but I was pleasantly surprised once they arrived. Delivery took forever because of the processing of the order...

Much like some of the other reviews I found they do run a little large. I'm usually a 9.5 (my barefoot measures 10 inches) so I ordered the 9 and they fit perfectly with enough room for socks. The colour is darker than the pic (I ordered tobacco) but I read that in another review so was expecting such. They are more like milk chocolate brown. I also have large calves and these are fine. Bit snug around the top but not uncomfortably so, I'd imagine being leather they will stretch a wee bit too. Will update when I have worn them a bit and exposed them to a New Zealand winter and see how they hold up.
I have plantar fasciitis and these are simply the most comfortable shoes. When I wear these all the time, I have no problems with my plantar fasccitis. Highly Recommend!
I bougt it for my husband, he wears a size 14, but 13 crocs fit him fine. Although this one is a little too small, but crocs are always crocs :)

I have had Uggs before and loved them. The thing I love about Uggs is that I do not need to wear soxs. However, these black uggs are a big disappointment. The black dye comes off on my feet and it makes my feet look dirty. Not only that the dye doesnt come off easily even after scrubbing with a pumice stone. I threw the box out because I thought these uggs would be as great as the light brown. My sister and niece both have black uggs and they said there's never bled the black color onto their feet. Really disappointed if I had not thrown out the box I would've returned them.

Purchased these boots for backpacking. So far I have backpacked across the Grand Canyon in these boots. There are holding up great, excellent traction in all conditions. Well made with great ankle support. They are a little heavy, however they appear well made. Comfortable. I would recommend these boots for the serious hiker, not you typical walking the trail boots.

I bought these shoes in a 10EE size but should have bought a 9EE. The width makes the difference in fit.Inserts have allowed me to wear them. I love them so much, I did not want to return them and reorder.They add a dash of color when I am wearing jeans. Very nice casual shoes.

I got these shoes for my boyfriend, and there was absolutely NO other place that had these in his size!! I ordered them, and they came in WAY earlier than I expected! Even earlier than the shipping expectancy! Ill buy Chucks from here for now on!
it looks really cool and really comforible. everything on it is great except sometimes there will be some dirt that sticks to the dark black part in the front even if im not walking by dirt.

I am on my fifth pair of these sandals, yes 5th. pair!! they are the BEST!!!! Bought my first pair in Old Branson, Missouri and in love with them ever since,hope they never discontinue these planning on purchasing another pair,like to have an extra pair on hand!!!
Great! Large size 16, cheap, comfortable and my fiance will look great wearing these shoes at our wedding. Thank you!

They need to note on this listing that in Capezio world woman's size 3 is a child's size 1. So if you buy your kid with size 3 feet a size 3, you are going to get a shoe that is way too small! It's very irritating, cause at this age/size, you can't buy from the listing that have child sizes anymore. Otherwise the shoes look very nice. You do have to start sewing on the elastic now - not like the Daisy's that come with it presewed. Just do the math and make sure you get the right size.
I love these crocs. Soooo comfortable. There is plenty of room in the toebox for those like me with painful feet.

I bought a pair 2 years ago. Been to the beach, fishing, shopping and even to work! The double strap makes the sandal more secure than average flip-flops and all the colors offer a wide range of choices. You will love these!
Very nice shoes, true to size and nice colour. I got a lot of compliments for them. I strongly recommend them to young people.
My husband is so pleased with these boots. He loves timberland and we were so lucky they had his size. Absolute great buy.

My granddaughter absolutely "...had to have, more than anything in the world..." a pair of Converse Purple High-tops for Christmas! Ordered them on 12/19 & they arrived on the 22nd, in plenty of time for me to once again be "the greatest grandpa in the world"!

As someone who is more than a little bit over weight, I've found myself experiencing foot issues in the last few years. I wanted to increase my exercise, but due to my foot issues, I was having a hard time pursuing that goal until I found the Propet Stability Walker. This shoe has worked wonderfully, providing excellent support and accommodating my custom orthotic insole. I no longer have any foot pain and walk several miles every day.This is my second pair of Propet Stability Walkers, and I've found that the second pair had really LOUD squeaking when I walked (due to the orthotics rubbing against the inside of the shoe). A little quick internet research and I found out that putting a little powder in the shoe solves the squeaking problem.
I've bought these Converse shoes (both navy and white) for my son. They came on scheduled time. He liked them, wear every day.
Unfortunately these run a bit tight. Length is fine but width is actually tight. I wish I could fix this issue but I really do not want to have to send these back...
I've been wearing this brand shoes for over ten years. They look like dress shoes but feel like sneakers. And the last a long time. Highly recommended!

Wearing a AAAA shoe, it is very difficult to find a nice shoe in such widths. I have purchased several pairs of this shoe in many colors over the years. Goes with both skirts and pants. Just wish it came in silver!

I ordered the size that I usually wear in Saucony's (which I wear quite a lot). Since it is hard to find leather Saucony's I thought these would take me thru the winter months. Well, unfortunately they were way to wide for my foot and too long, as well. I had to return them. I have never had this problem with any of my previous Saucony's and was disappointed that I had to return them.

I bought these based on reviews. First pair of shoes I bought online just from reviews. I went off the sizing in other peoples reviews and they were correct. I bought a 12 and my feet are a 11 1/2. I wasn't used to high heel hiking boots so that was an adjustment. I felt as though I was stepping into Ski Boots. I bought them six days before needing to use them enough time to try them out and go to a local store to buy another pair (which I didn't need to do).You WILL need to break these in. Don't expect to go and hike in these without doing this. For me I broke them in by wearing them to work for three days straight. I work at a desk most of the day with a walk during lunchtime. I would say four days would have been ideal but the shoes were very comfortable during the hike minus the minor bruise i had on my heal because I wasn't use to high heal shoes. It was bearable though and I wrote it off to me not breaking them in enough (or breaking in my feet).These are gortex and waterproof and I tested them out with a wide brook crossing. There were some rocks that the water was running over and I was deep enough to cover my toes. My feet stayed as dry as advertised. The hike had all the terrain you would find. Soft needle filled trails, moss covered rocks, old dry brook beds, roots, steep slabs and gravel.Heres where the shoes loose the fifth star. Compared to more pricey boots the sold are very hard and I was wavering on the steep slabs that were slightly wet. They gripped but just barely. Some better soles would be solid such as my buddies. But and this is the big BUT - for a starting out hiker these are fine and would be FIVE stars for their purpose. I only spent around 80 bucks on these and my buddy spent over 200 on his.If you are interested in reading about my first hike my buddy blogs about all his hikes in New Hampshire. We hiked Mt. Potash in the White Mountain region. It was a great trail for a first hike or even an experienced hiker who wants to do a quick hike. It took us about two hours up and two hours down with about 1.5 hours stopped. [...]Overall I think I picked the best first book, I expect to use them for shoveling in the winter because they look nice enough for me to wear to work (Business Casual). Give yourself plenty of time to break these in I would say at least a week. If you haven't worn high healed boots before you will probably get a small bruise on the back of your heal. I think it is normal and it goes away as you wear them more. The support in your ankle is key for any harsher terrain and slab walking you will do in your hike.

I LOVE CHUCKS. Have them in many colors and styles! Have been buying them for years, and know what to expect. Sizing differences can be handled if you pick one size, usually one half a shoe size for tie ups, and one shoe size for slip ons.
It's the first time when I bought this type of shoe, but I'm telling you, I love it; comfortable, cool, nice, I can't take eyes off them; Yes I'm talking about "CONVERSE" by Chuck Taylor, baby.

Fue una muy buena compra, excelente calidad, tallas ideales, lindos diseños actuales. Recomiendo a todoas a comprar este producto, se llevarán una buena sorpresa y le encantará si es un regalo para alguien.

I have fat feet, and I wear a size 12 wide. I ordered the 12 E, and they were long enough and wide enough, but not "tall" enough. I couldn't get the tops of my feet crammed in them, even when I loosened the laces. There's just no stretch to the canvas. They seemed like they'd be comfortable if I could just get them on! So those of you with fat feet, get something else!Returning them was so easy though, and only took a few days.

This is the best bag for travel. There are three major compartments and each is large enough to accommodate a laptop. The bag is lightweight and stays clean and fresh. There are six zippered pockets for your passport, cameras, makeup, notes, brochures, maps, phones, pdas, and a change of clothing. The bag is also comfortable: even filled to the brim, it hangs nicely on the shoulder. Stylish enough to serve as a purse and yet it is low-key enough that it doesn't scream "tourist!."
These are awsome. just like shown. shipping took a while but it was over christmas so it makes sense. Just as nice as the pictures showed! Love the new CHucks

I've never ordered sneakers off the internet, but I trust adidas and thank goodness these were true to size. I got blue, and the color is really light and not too "girly." There is a lot of ankle support, which some people don't like because you can't wear the lowest socks. There is also a lot of arch and heel support, which I always require because I have had a heel spur in the past. I'm a moderate runner--maybe 10 miles a week, and these have been great. Enjoy!

I bought these for my 9 year old son. He is very sensitive to shoe fit, so finding something he will wear can be a bit of a trial.I had him try on numerous different brands and styles hoping to find something which would provide sufficient support for a rapidly growing body while fitting comfortably enough to be worn regularly. All of the others that we tried were flip-flop flat (no arch support to speak of and a nearly flat sole) and/or had rough stitching on the straps that rubbed.Teva seems to realize that kids' shoes need to have the functionality and support of adult sizes. The other brands and styles that we looked at did not instill confidence that they would be suitable for daily wear by an active child...hiking, jumping, hopping, leaping, running...while the Teva Hurricane 2 appears to be ready for anything.
Sent it back because it made my feet look even bigger. Did not fit well either. The support was comfortable but did not like the look on me.
Goods received on time and in excellent condition, would certainly buy again. Thanks!!!
I always buy easy spirit shoes because they are so comfortable and fit my arch perfectly. I love these and will keep buying them.
Questionable quality, already beginning to look worn out in less than a month. I expected much more for the price paid.
I personally prefer to buy a leather shoes for the small feet, but for the summer it is really good. Plus they learn how to put them on very quickly.

after only 2 months the shoe sole fell apart. Then the stitching on the side of the shoe came loose. I have worn Justin boots for over 25 years(same type of ropers - different colors). I have never had a defective boot like this. I called and e-mailed papa shoe, They said I had to return it to the justin the manufacture. If I would have bought it at Cavenders or Sheplers, They would have exchanged the boot and did the return for me. I called Justin, They told me to mail my boots in to them and it would take up to 6 weeks to get a response. I will not buy from Papa Shoe again.

I first heard of Keens when studying at an outdoor science station last summer. A number of my classmates had them and raved about how comfortable they were and how readily they were able to meet the elements. I was impressed, but found the $100 price tag daunting.I then saw my outdoorsy brother wear them wherever he went. He never buys things of low quality, and so I knew they had to be good.When there was a big Keen sandal sale, I started looking for which Keen sandal I would like to buy. I read up on reviews stating how the KEEN Newport and Newport H2 tended to be hot, smelly, and unbreathable, so I decided to go with the Venice.The Venice turned out to be a great, breathable alternative to the Newport. I bought this shoe knowing that my feet get sweaty and that I would need more breathability.The Aegis Microbe Shield works wonders, as my other shoes tend to stink up easily and my KEENs haven't. Because of the Microbe Shield alone, I think the KEEN Venice has an edge over the Venice H2. I also like the more traditional waterproof leather straps (vs. the H2's polyester webbing) in its more traditional look and its ability to be worn into.The only cons have to do with my hard-to-manage feet (though the cons are still worth mentioning). If your feet are sweaty (like mine), after a long day of walking you'll start to feel the footbed sticking to your foot, which feels gross and uncomfortable.Though KEENs do tend to run wide, be aware that if your foot is extra wide, the sandal can be initially very uncomfortable -- the strap was chafing at the side of my foot. So, if you buy this shoe and feel that it's a bit too narrow, I'd recommend breaking them in with socks first (that's what I did and I'm glad). Regardless, the ingenious strapping system allows you to adjust the sandal, which, done even very slightly, can make a huge difference in comfort.

This boot is like having toasty pillows on your feet - so cozy, and perfect for chilly weather. And a really great, unique look. Good quality manufacture and materials. It was an impulse buy and is now one of my favorite winter shoes.
[[ASIN:B0002LTGE8 Naturalizer Scout]]As difficult as it is to obtain a Narrow size, I was able to purchase this beautifully crafted shoe at a very reasonable price. Thank You.

The quality doesn't look as good as I hoped - you can see the glue and a space where the base is attached. I bought these looking for something that might hold up a little better than the cheaper canvas shoes I usually buy at Target - hopefully they will last a little longer otherwise they may not be worth the price. On the other hand they fit just right and are very soft and comfy on my feet. I like the color and the lining and stitching look pretty good.

I ordered these recently ( November 2012) after a lot of research and buying several pair of other brands only to waste my money... These boots fit true to size. I am a size six and bought the size 6. They go on just the way a boot should with having to use the little loops to pull on and the "popping" sound you get when you heel slides in. The instep area is fitted like it should be too. They are so comfortable it is hard to believe. Wore them right off the bat to line dance in and they are awesome. I bought the black and they are beautiful. I will be ordering only Ariat from now on and plan on purchasing this same style in a brown color next. Break-in time is minimal and painless.

I have always found the ladies width on Ariat boots too narrow, and have had a hard time finding men's Ariat boots small enough to fit. The size 7 wide fit perfectly; very comfortable for everyday wear around the barn, running errands, and riding.
These shoes are well worth the price. They are comfortable, made of good leather, and stylish.

The style of this shoe is exactly what I was looking for. However, the size I ordered was too small and unfortunately it was not available in the size needed, so I had to return it and couldn't get another. Otherwise, I definitely would have kept it.

After 49 years, I finally have a pair of shoes that convinced me to go out and buy another pair like them (but in a different color) and buy more shoes of that brand. I will not buy another pair of shoes that are not Earth shoes!I have a swollen nerve in one foot that prevents me from wearing high heels or any shoe that has a narrow toe box. The Earth shoes all have wide toe boxes that do not squeeze my toes. The Earth shoes are made with the heel lower than the toes which gives your calves a nice workout, but it also allows for a much more natural walking gait (like you are barefoot on soft dirt or sand). I can now walk and stand for hours without my feet hurting! I also have fairly high arches that receive good support in the Earth shoes.I have bought my daughter the same shoe as well as some Earth winter boots. She has also loved these shoes.

The shoes I purchased for my feet are confortable and realy look neat. These softspot sandal looks good with my outfit, standing and walking, and even when I sit. The service on packaging and shipping was great, the shoes came on time and was not late. Thank You!

I love these boots. I get a ton of compliments on them. The design detail (buttons, heel overlay) make them appear much more expensive than they actually are. Very comfy, I can go all day in them without feeling like I'm wearing "heels". Sadly, these boots are not going to last very long. There is visable wear around the toe (scrapes, scratches) and I have already lost a button. Another button is loose. Nevertheless, I like them so much I'm willing to take my chances and purchase a pair in black.

I waited 6 months in order to give a fair review, and hoping somehow the soles would soften up and "wear in". But not happening. No softening up going on. The black color and style is fine but the sole is very hard and uncomfortable. These shoes are terrible, and maybe I got suckered with a knock off or something (no way to prove). I'm very disappointed with these shoes. I expected better from Rockports. Now I just have to "make do" with them. But maybe this is what $40 Rockports are. If you like even a hint of cushion in your shoes, these ain't for you. Instead of walking shoes they're more like "walking" shoes. If you walk a lot at work, these will kill your feet. This is my first ever extremely negative review of any Amazon item, but this is how bad these shoes are. Don't be regretting like me. Youre way better off buying athletic walking or running shoes. Peace out bro.

Definitely order at least 1 size up- they run small and seem very narrow. If you have a wide foot, then these probably are not for you. I am a 9 and ordered a 10, but I wish mine were a half size larger. I've only worn them a couple times and they seem comfy enough- I do notice the difference in arch support between these and my cheapo Target flip flops that needed to be retired this year. I would definitely buy these again, but I would order a size 11- a full 2 sizes larger than I normally wear.
The shoes looks like in the picture, except for the rubber sole. It looks a little bit "yellower" than expected
Product fit well and was comfortable and sturdy. My daughter wears them all the time.
muy buen producto, se concreto la transacción muchas gracias, mercancia en buen estado, la entrega demasiado rapida, vale la pena
Shoes are different and take a bit of getting used to. So far, my back and legs feel better.

I had to return these boots because of the unfinished inner seam on the shaft. It rubbed my ankles adn felt uncomfortable. Thicker socks helped, but then felt it too tight in the foot. Overall, the boots looked great and were otherwise well-made. Would probably work well if you can wear with thick socks.

This has been a decent winter running shoe with plenty of stability, fair amount of cushion, and decent traction. My primary gripe has been the insert not staying in place and riding back in the shoe.
Sweeet!...my boy is flipping over these. He wants to wear them everywhere - I drew the line at church.
My fifth pair same quality as always. Used to buy for hipness. Now Podiatrist says never go barefoot. My new house slippers.

I really like these shoes. They look great. The only thing I would change is that they take a while to break in - they are not at all flexible. That sounds like they wouldn't be comfortable - they are, they just feel like new shoes - even after I've worn them 7-8 times.
I love these! Softspots knows how to make them comfortable right away. Yes, they come a little snug, but it gives them the ability to shape to your feet. Very attractive! Highly recommend!
These sandals were just what I was looking for. They were a little tight when they arrived, but have now stretched out just enough. These will be a favorite this summer.
I have worn these shoes for a while now and they are the most comfotable sandal I have ever owned. I am about to buy another pair. Oh, did I mention I have foot probems? Not with these sandals.
Crocs are the most cofortable shoe ever. I wear mine everywhere rain or shine. If your in need a clog and a sandal buy crocs.
Great to just slip in but still a good foot bed that supports my feet.

I had the originals back in grammar school in 1969 & always loved them.I have gained weight in the ensuing years & needed a very supportive shoe, so I looked into these again.This is a great shoe with lots of support for very overweight people, & highly recommended for them.

My hiking involves work. As a UPS driver I step in and out of my truck about 180 times a day. On top of that I deliver a lot of apartments, up and down roughly 800-1000 steps a day. I hoped these boots would have been more comfortable based on other reviews. They do fit well and may be ok for a few hours but beyond that if you are on your feet all day I can't recommend.
shoes are very light, comfortable and good price from amazon. just the look is not as nice as otehr shoes i like , but for the use purpose, thay are great.

I own 3 pairs of Hunter's, and will never stop wearing them. I get more use of of these than any of my other shoes living in Pittsburgh where rain is frequent and snow is harsh. These are both stylish AND durable--quality rain boots if you ask me. I'd say that these boots run a little big, however if you're going to put either a liner or wear heavy socks with them (highly recommended), I'd go with your normal size. I'm not a fan of the liners that Hunter makes (I find them a bit tacky looking), but high wool socks will definitely do the trick in cold rain or snow. If you're looking for a fashionable rain boot that will last you forever (literally) BUY these! They are so easy to clean and also very convenient for walks to work in the rain/snow. I get compliments every time I wear these!Also an FYI: the "glossy" kind are VERY shiny in my opinion... Almost too much for a rain boot. I'd suggest going with the normal ones :)

I love the previous pair of janet sandals that I purchased about 6 years ago, but the newer ones were not true to size overall for me. i was saddened to return what I thought was a welcomed replacement for my very worn favorite.

The Keds sneaker is a classic, same style as always, and worn by everyone. I was surprised, however, that they tend to run a little small! My foot is between 9.5 and 10 in size, so I bought 10, and I can't wear them with socks. I am trying to stretch them with shoe trees in hopes of being able to wear them more often. I have to say, that's a little disappointing.

I love these shoes! And after you get them broken in (takes a little while), they are adorable and comfy! But they are definitely not for people with wide feet. They seem to run a little narrower than shoes I normally buy. But they're fantastic shoes nonetheless!
The best one. It looks great, the size I ordered was prefect for me! The product arrived perfectly to Colombia.I'm alsy willing to buy more sperry shoes

Sketchers have been the only shoes I have bought for years. They fit as though you have broken them in as soon as you get them and they last a long time. I really like these all white shoes. They look classy (as long as you keep them clean) and really pull outfits together. My only complaint would be that I can't figure out a way to get the tongue of the shoe to not scunch down. I have to keep pulling it up. I even ran the laces through the loop but that didn't help either. Maybe once I get them fully broken in.

They take a while to break in but once they do they are amazing, if not a tad heavy. I work in a prison and during extractions or even walking on wet cement or tile floors these boots are deadly slippy. I am going to get them resoled at a cobber with different soles. Also, they are not as waterproof as I had hoped. Popped sprinklers and my feet get wet in 3-4" of water when others stayed dry in their Bates and Rocky's.

Ordered 2 pair in 8.5 wide; way too small. I reordered 9 medium because all wides were sold out, but this one too was too small, so I gave up. Great quality, but research the sizing before you order...I apparently didn't do a very good job at that. If you already have Trotters and know your correct size, the price is right.
I love these shoes! They added to my new years eve outfit. I'm soo glad that I used amazon.com to find them. Took me a long time of looking to finally find these shoes and at a great price.

I know I wear these shoes more often than I should, there are days when I should probably wear dressier shoes, but I wear one of my pairs of Easy Spirit Motions Sport Lace-ups everyday because they are so comfortable. They seem quite durable too.

I was looking for a good walking shoe--at a reasonable price, for I have read that price has little to do with quality in a good brand.Rockport's last fit my feel best of any brand I've used.This pair is satisfying me greatly woth everyday use.

Converse are great for your feet. They contain little padding, so you maintain a natural walking motion. Its basically one step above being barefoot. I actually use them to weight train. They are also very stylish. Who doesn't love converse?
I bought them as a gift for my husband and he really likes them. They are a little stiff and need to be broken in but other than that they are nice.

This shoes is one of the cutest I ever seen. It looks just like shown in the web. Unfortunately, for me this shoes run too big. I usually wear either 7 or 7.5. I bought these shoes for my mom, and she is the pickiest shoe shopper ever! She absolutely loves the comfort of these shoes and hadnt been able to find them for years! Good thing there is amazon! Love my sandals, have them in brown, chocolate and white. Very much unhappy that MBT is no longer making this style. All of the MBT shoes tend to run a bit different than regular shoes on size. My Sport tennis shoes are 1/2 size larger, my Kisumu sandals are 1 size larger.
First time using Amazon and my package cameRight away. Took about 5-10 business days andI have no complaints.
tHESE BOOTS WERE THE FIRST THING ON MY GRANDDAUGHTERS CHRISTMAS LIST. cHRISTMAS MORNING WAS REALLY GREAT WHEN SHE GOT TO OPEN THE UGGS. THANK YOU FOR A GREAT WAY TO PURCHASE AND RECEIVE MERCHANDISE.

These pilot sun-glasses from the far east are one of my best buys. Had many other brands, more expensive, but the way these are put together, leave the super expensive and exclusive ones way behind. Sexy, tough ass looking.... THese are good for work or play. I love them, You can dress them up or down. Very nice

These boots are well made and comfortable. They are reasonably warm, OK down to maybe -10 F, and waterproof as advertised. The zippers work really well.They are great for mud, snow and slush. However, the soles let go entirely as soon as they encounter any ice. My ordinary shoes perform far better. Now I have the choice of dry feet or broken bones.

These Boots are it! I bought a pair (Non-steel toe) about 10 years ago for working around my hobby farm. I loved them, but when I tried to get another pair a couple years ago, I found out they were out of production. Tried several other brands/styles since then with poor results - I work on concrete floors all day now and need something that feels like a walking shoe, but can handle oil spills and such. So, a few months ago while about to buy yet another brand, I looked for these Carolina's again, and much to my surprise, I found there are back!! I immediately bought a pair to see if they were the same. Not quite, but still better than any others I've tried.PRO:Glove leather-ish soft.Very comfortable sole that is flexible, not stiff as steel, VERY MINIMAL break in period.Very sturdy lace hooks (better than my first pair).CON:None yet.
Estoy muy contento con mis nuevos zapatos. Estoy ansioso por las nuevas rebajas de Clarks

I had been looking for an SAS outlet online without success, and found these shoes which looked VERY similar, but cost about $40 less. I decided to try a pair and they are pretty comfortable but much tighter than the SAS shoes. I use a 9W in SAS and ordered a 9 C/D in the Softspot version, although the box they came in was labeled as the same size as 9W, the same size as the SAS. The Softspot shoe is smaller and tighter than the SAS, so next time I will order a wider or bigger size.

I've been buying K-Swiss laceups for my daughter since she was first walking. They're very stable and are not so easy for her to remove as shoes with velcro. The teachers at her daycare really appreciate that! I had a good local discount source for these shoes but couldn't find a 5 -I was thrilled to find them on Amazon at such a reasonable price.

The title says it all. These shoes appear to be well-made. Lots of cushion and padding on the inside. But, as another poster has mentioned, they run small. My recommendation is to order them in a size that is 1/2 size larger than your normal shoe size. For that reason I gave them 3 stars.

I bought these boots after reading reviews. I am not that impressed with them. I like that they are lighter than my danners and have the side zip which is a ten. These boots would be four stars if the insole was better. After wearing them for 2 ten hour shifts my feet hurt bad. There are no support provided from these boots and this is the first time the arches of my feet have hurt. I will be trying out Dr. Scholls or something to make the boots feel more comfy. I usually like 5.11 products but will not buy another boots made by them.

Bought these for our 15yr old son at the beginning of High Soccer season. Best soccer shoes he's ever owned. Made it thru August, Sept and Oct with either 2 hours of games or practices at least 5 days per week with minimal wear. The insoles were the first to go, however, he's still playing in the shoes over the winter because they are more comfortable than the Diadoras he wanted to try next. The shoes come with leather conditioner - we used it about every two weeks plus we kept cedar shoe trees inside the shoes when not in use. Some other brands may be a few ounces lighter, but I doubt you'll be as happy with them.
I had similar shoes to these before I bought these. Theses are my replacements. They fit perfect and were shipped out quickly. I have no complaints.
This seems to be the new fad in our school. My granddaughter askedfor them for her birthday and was very happy to receive them.

this is the second pair of softspots, but this pair the leather is not as soft it is stiff, and hopefully will be more comfortable when I break them in. The other pair exactly the same that I had purchased years earlier was and is so soft.
