An added bonus: this company was so kind and sent a purse sized hand sanitizer. That was very thoughtful of them. I highly recommend this seller to anyone that loves great shoes, great prices and super fast shipping. Thank you for making this a happy friday.
this is a really good shoe for the price. it is comfortable. a little thin unless you run on PERFECT level ground.
Good boots, my only complaint is that they have stretched significantly and are now a bit loose after so much wear.

I was so happy to receive it on the day it camebecause my other sneakers was worn out becauseit was torn, and I finally put my other sneakers inthe trash because I finally got this new sneakersto wear.

Just throwing my 2 cents in here - these shoes are fantastic. Great mature look with jeans. The bottom will become black very quickly but is only noticeable when you have your legs crossed or feet on a table or something. I get lots of compliments on them. I prefer these boots to the lower cut ones which I also have. I normally wear a size 11.5 but a 10.5 works perfectly in these, so maybe take that into account.

Mono-Black Chucks are amazing utility shoes. I wear mine when:* working (with tie)* sledding* partying* hiking* gardening* attending black tie formal events (yes really)Ironically, the thing Chucks are bad for is the shoe's original intended purpose: athletics & sports.

THESE ARE NICE AND SPACIOUS BOOTS AND THE BURGANDY IS A HARD COLOR TO FIND BUT MY GOD THEY COME WITH NO INTERIOR CUSHIONING SO BEWARE.....IT TOOK 2 SETS OF INNER CUSHIONS TO RENDER THESE WEARABLE. IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE COLOR THEY WOULD HAVE GONE RIGHT BACK.THEY ARE DRESSY ENOUGH FOR WORK ON IN CLEMENT DAYS BUT THAT HARD FOOT BASE ALMOST GOT THESE A 1 STAR RATING.

Clarks has been my favorite brand for a long time, because they make footwear that is comfortable, wears well, and is stylish and attractive.These boots are no exception. The heel is not too low nor too high. I can put them on and not worry about how much walking I might be doing, and they look great. I have gotten many compliments on them.

I bought these shoes for my husband/son on a Saturday and they were delivered to my house on the following Tuesday. Super, fast delivery I really like the colors they have in these shoes, they are in a cute style, the quality is good,and the price is great.

The boots looked durable, and had a very nice sole. The issue was that they were huge :/ the same size in a pair of Ariat riding boots fit him, but these gave at least an extra inch or two of space in the toe box. I hope to get a proper refund and possibly order again in the right size...
I purchased these boots for my father who lives in Maine. They were exactly what he wanted. He says they are warm and very easy to pull on and take off.
These are excellent shoes with a lot of support. I wear them at work and to hike in. They're very tough.
These sandals are a great buy. They are really comfortable, look great and feel like they will last a long time. I may get another pair!

I like these type of shoes for when I travel and I have to visit the gestapo at my local airport. It makes compliance with this regime a little bit quicker. I don't have to untie my laces or anything like that before the minimum wage federal employee sticks his hands all over me.

Classic Vans. The style hasn't changed in more than 10 years. I've had mine for that long. I've skated them for that long too. Super comfortable when they're broken in and will last you for years. Vans for life.

I ordered these for my 14 yr old daughter. She absolutely loves them. She says they are very comfortable - like walking on clouds. They look really good on her and keep her feet nice and warm. I would definitely recommend these boots.

This is the 2nd pair of these same shoes I've purchased (from Amazon), and I love them! They fit just as expected, are lightweight, and have a really versatile color. Since they're a neutral color, I can wear them with both casual clothing and slightly nicer clothes like khakis with an untucked polo. I may even buy another pair in 3 or so years when this pair wears out!

The Naot Fiord is absolutely the best quality and most comfortable shoe that I have ever worn! I have had several pairs and they never dissapoint. I have several foot problems including: plantar fasciitis, old sports injuries, flat feet. But with these shoes, I can stand and walk all day and my feet don't hurt.Pros:1. Easy on/off2. Lots of airflow to keep your feet cool3. Very comfortable and conforming to the foot4. Fast break-in5. Wear extremely well - very sturdy6. Very good valueCons:1. None with this shoe!!! However, like with any clog, you have to be smart as to when and where you wear them. For example, it's not adivsable to wear these for trail hiking. You also have to be a little careful up or down flights of stairs that you don't have one slip off.Conclusion:Absolutely recommended!!!

I bought these for my boyfriend. Very comfortable and true to size. He thought that the low back would be bothersome but it isn't. I have bought him other slippers in the past and the Tamarac are best by far and at a good price.
I love these, they are great for walking on slippery areas. I feel very confident when wearing them. Still have to be careful on glare ice but better than nothing for sure.

I've had these out on two long hikes now and all I can say is that these boots are perfect. Super comfy on the inside and super tough on the outside. My feet stayed cool and dry all day. Great boots, highly recommended especially for the price.
Love them. Very cold here today in DC. They keep my feet very warm. Great for winter weather anywhere. Like!!

These are great shoes for work in an office. They are comfortable all day and look very nice with several styles from business casual to professional. Thanks for another great pair of shoes, Softspots!
Exactly as advertised the famous Converse Chuck Taylor All Star Sneaker is a great buy! Looks great, fits great and is super comfortable. I highly recommend it!

I am on my feet 12 or more hours a day. Cement floors and high activity have destroyed multiple sets of shoes. I have bough some brands and totaled them in 3-4 months. The only thing showing wear is the finish. The toes are scuffed up from crawling and moving around working on equipment. If there is work to be done I am all over it. My shoes better be prepared to take it all. These Wolverines are comfortable and solidly built.When I do finally give them more then they can handle, I will be buying another set to replace them. I would love a more durable toe area for lasting beauty but I don't want to give up the comfort that these shoes offer to my hard working feet.

Boat shoes. Brown. Do not wear on anything slippery unless you want to fall. Somewhat comfortable but they feel very thin. I guess boat shoes are like this but i have worn other sperrys that feel better and safer.At least they look pretty good and seem well made.
This was a Christmas gift for my husband. He loves them, says they are really comfortable, and slide on easily!

Love them, just can't wear 'em. They run 1 size too small. I have the black size 9. Yes, I Should have bought a 10. What do I do now, try to swap someone? Any suggestions? Also, Is it me or do most boots run smaller now? On the positive side, they have a great zipper that runs all the way down to the soul. The buttons are merely decorative. If you have a larger calf, I wouldn't go with this style. Attractive heels are 3" high with souls that aren't slippery. An affordable yet solid boot.

I hadn't owned a pair of Frye boots for more then 30 years when I purchased these Frye Engineer Boots recently. I had forgotten how comfortable Frye boots are. It took about a day to break them in. The sizing was good and of course Amazon was right on time with delivery. I won't buy any other companies boots from here on out.

I needed a pair sneakers that were extra wide (8.5 EEEE) and had good arch supports. Propet sneakers are comfortiable, run true to size and have good arch supports. Plus they have a guarantee to last one thousand miles of walking.
This is my first pair of Danner boots, and I must say that they are the most comfortable boots I have ever owned.
I have bought this shoe for work, play and just plain walking for 5 years. They are the best. I use special insoles inside and I have the best fit and feel ever. Highly recommend them to everyone.

I have worn Hi-Tec boots for many years now. This is my third pair of Altitude boots. They are comfortable, durable and relatively inexpensive. The boots are great for day hikes these are a good boots for light to moderate loads. If you are looking for a stiff boot for heavy backpacking I would recommend looking at another model of boot. Hi-Tec makes other model boots specifically for backpacking with heavier loads.

I usually get the more target brand converse in a size 8, which fit great, but when I ordered these in a size 8 they were uncomfortable. They felt just slightly too big and didn't fit well around my foot, I don't think ordering a half size down would have helped. I tried to break them in, but they gave me blisters, twice!

Bought a pair about 6 years ago from Sportsman Guide for about 1/2 this price .Weared well for about 5 years before they gave out , wished I had bought several more pairs at that cheap price .Because of my extremely wide , but short foot size I don't have much choice in selection of shoes/boots .After replacing the foot incert with a better arch , softer surface they fit pretty nice and know it will break in pretty good .Even though they are black, they vent/breath pretty good and are water resistant up to 2 or 3 inchs .They are also very lite to wear , and if they are as good as the other Propet boots i hope to get another 5 years of use from them .
These were a good deal for the price paid, though they seem to run a half size smaller than labeled.
Good and quick. Love the shoes although it was a bit confusing whether it was hi top or not as it showed up differently on my order form. But it was hi-tops and I'm happy :-)

This has been a decent winter running shoe with plenty of stability, fair amount of cushion, and decent traction. My primary gripe has been the insert not staying in place and riding back in the shoe.

I use this shoe for training and for racing, for long runs and for interval workouts. My weekly mileage is in the 30-38 mile range, and the Green Silence is a nice, light ride. I believe the weight is advertised as 8.3 ounces, and without getting out my wife's food scale, I'd say that's a pretty accurate estimate. My sense is that there's a limit to the number of miles I'd take this shoe. The cushioning is limited, but the overall feel is pleasantly surprising. Short distances feel really smooth; longer distances slightly less so, compared to traditional trainers. The payoff, though, is the lightweight feel and speed--the exact qualities I want in a shoe when I'm looking to do faster training.

Actually allowed me to put my orthotics inside these shoes. Usually my orthotics only fit in athetic shoes, so I was pleased. I do have hammer toes, and got a few red spots on top of my toes, but I don't know how I could have avoided that.
Bought these for my husband and was wondering why they were so cheap. We love New Balance. But these were made in China!! What's up New Balance? We love you cause you're made in the USA!!!

The shoe is exactly what it is supposed to be. The only issue i had is that the felt on the front of each shoe started to come off after just a few rehearsals. I glued them back on and they are fine now. A little annoyed I had to do that for the amount these shoes cost
Love these boat shoes. A+++++for comfort in the front toes and back heel. Hope they sell other colors. Nice construction.

When I opened the box, I was very happy to see how totally cute these shoes were. But when I put them on, the toe was very narrow. I didn't want anything that I would need to stretch, so I sent them back. BUMMER!
MY GRANDSON ORDERED THESE FOR HIS CHRISTMAS GIFT AND WAS VERY HAPPY WITH THEM. THEY WERE THE PERFECT FIT AND VERY COMFORTABLE FOR HIM.
Ordered these for my husband, it's his 2nd pair. He wore the 1st pair into the ground over several years so pretty good value.
I bought these shoes for my Granddaughter, she loves it. She said "they are so soft and comfy, I can dance all day and night and they do not hurt".She is happy and so am I.
If you buy a Chuck Taylor, you know want you want, they are the classics, fits right usually I use 7 1/2 but in this case the 8 size fits better, most comfortable.

these shoes are classics and I can't fault the style. My son actually wore them for a wedding (with suit and all), however, they run large (long) and had to be sent back. I found them at the last minute at a local store in the right size. We ordered the 12 but he ended up buying 10.5. It cost me $12.50 to send them back so it was kind of an expensive mistake. Always get free return shipping where you order. Just saying.
Super comfy and light. I like the zipper sides, easy to put on and take off.Always been a fan of 5.11 products because of the quality. Shipping was fast.

Bought this for my cousin, he said it an big about half to a whole size. He's an 8.5 and i bought him the 8.5 and its big on him but he was fine with it since he wears thick socks anyway. The color black was really nice and the design as well. As for the quality, can't speak for it right now since we just got it but so far upon close inspection when i got the shoes, it look durable and made well so hopefully it'll last long.

These were my first pair of boots. Bought them for motorcycle safety training (needed footwear that covered the ankles) & been using them sparingly over the last year. The shoes are a nice dark shade of black but the lace rings are a little too shiny for my liking. Price could be cheaper too. No other complaints.

I got these a few weeks ago and have loved them. Good support in the arch and heel and no rubbing. The spikes are pretty sharp so they make good trail running shoes. You can take the spikes out with a key (provided) and they make good track shoes.

I loved the way the boot looked with jeans/pants; however, I could never wear them with a skirt because there was about an inch or more of a gap at the top where it should have been flush with my calf. I do not have abnormally skinny calfs, so this was a big let-down. I love the fact that these boots were all leather! Fine quality just not the right fit!Wish that Nine West made the same boot with a smaller upper! I'd buy em in a heart-beat!
These are classics. I used to rock these back in my high school days. I saw some legit colorways so I picked up a few of them. They are very comfortable and light.

CROCS "BEACH CLOG" model is just as awesome as the "SPECIALIST" model which I love so much. This model averages $23 and may be the model so many people think about when they say Crocs are ugly. I have news for you, but you should believe your own eyes: CROCS ARE NOT UGLY.No matter how ugly you may think they are, once you try on a pair, you will never want to take them off - guaranteed. This model as you see is riddled with Swiss-cheese-style holes. It's good ventilation for summer, but I think you'll be pretty hot under the collar if it rains. That cold rain gets into these holes faster than spinach into Popeye!Otherwise, you can't pass up the chance to own a couple of pairs of this style. It is comfort, good support, ease of maintenance, hard-wearing, and you will find your color and size, just read the options carefully.CROCS: THEY AIN'T UGLY, THEY'S SNAPPY!

This shoe is well made, comfortable, and stays looking good. You can wear this shoe everyday if needed and it will last a long time and stay looking new. It goes with everything, so it's perfect for your everyday shoe.

Based on previous reviews about these running big, I ordered my 'normal' size 11 knowing a bit big is far better than a bit small. When the shoes arrived, they were very snug. I had to return and order a half size larger. (good thing Amazon's ordering/return system works so well) Receive the 'right' size as promised. The shoes are pretty comfortable but do have a few quirks. First off, there is a slight pinch on the top of the big toe where the leather bends while walking. Secondly, there is a decided 'pop' in the leather with each step, again in the toe area as the leather bends then relaxes with each step. I'm hopeful that once worn a bit, both issues will remedy themselves. The shoes are very nice looking and I've had several compliments on them already. The toe pinch does seem to be going away and I hope the popping sound does as well. The shoes appear to be very well made. They are not light as the sole seems to be very durable. All in all, I'm glad I ordered them as I expect them to be great shoes. Just not the slipper feel I'd hoped for, but are very comfortable none the less.
I'm a nurse, I work in the ER and in the hospital med-surg. I have bought these shoes over the past 15 years. They last and last and then I buy them again. They are like walking on clouds!
Great shoe! Love the selection of colors! A must have!

I ordered these boots because of the wonderful reviews they'd gotten. We found them to wear very well here at the farm. Worn nearly everyday for cowboy boots intended purpose, our only complaint was that the toes came detached from the sole. This happened with both pairs we ordered. After a little super glue to repair the problem, they've been great and appear as they will be outgrown before they wear out. They're certainly a 10 on the cute scale and will wear like steel if they're being worn in an urban setting and not the pasture and barn. Would order again.

I LOVE the style of Converse, always have. But the quality of the shoe is going down :(. I have had my black pair (They look just like the ones in the pic) for about 2 years now, and they're pretty much starting to fall apart already. I dont even wear them everyday! Very disappointed in the quality nowadays, but they are still stylish. (Until they fall apart)

I have to say that I don't like crocs on adults. They are comfortable, sure... but there are other shoes that are as comfortable and not so ... absurd looking.But I did buy a black pair for my 2 year old daughter. She looks totally cute in them and she LOVES them. Unfortunately they are a bit large around the toe box and she tripped over her feet while wearing them. So now we have relegated them to bedtime shoes (meaning she can wear them to go to bed at night only, concessions, concessions).I think when she's a bit bigger and her foot fits inside them a little better, she will be able to wear them out and about. But right now the size 6/7 is too big for her 5.5 narrow feet and cause injury.
Lasts about 6 months with daily 4-mile walks on pavement. Lasts about a year in the gym with exercise equipment. I get good angle support and good arch support. Washes well.

Having a wide foot they fit a little on the narrow side - I kept them knowing that canvas will probably stretch without to much problem. Also my shoes make a slight hollow sound from one of the baby toe tips; I'm assuming with time that too will abate.
These boots for perfect for my daughter costume. They are well made and look adorable. She now wears them often. Well worth the money!

I have worn out one pair of these boots and am now on a new pair. I love that they are tough, warm, and comfy. They continue to look good for a long time. I wear them to work in the winter months with dress pants. I get compliments about them a lot. If you want warmth and duribility - here's your boots.

TROOP Footwear is back for the 2k3 and they are hot. These shoes not only look amazing, they some of the most comfortable shoes ive ever wore. they are definately worth ever penny i spent on them. Anyone who knows the TROOP story will tell you that these shoes were one of the hottest shoes to come out back in 85'. This new line out is made by averix and they have totally done justice to the name. I recommend you pick yourself up a pair or too, either on here on Underground station, Shoe City, or any other store you can find them. Hope you enjoy them as much as I do.

My husband loves the look, fit, comfort, and durability of these boots. He has been wearing the Hi-Tec Altitude IV in Dark Brown for at least 14 years. He enjoys working outside and gives these boots a run for their money. The waterproofing works great. A pair of these last him at least a year. The dark brown doesn't show the wear and the boots generally still look ok when he throws them away, but he actually wears out the padding in the soles. I order these boots at least three pairs at a time, because I'm scared they will stop making them. I want this boot that he loves to remain popular and not be discontinued.

I never thought I would find something like this especially in time for Christmas, thank you so much- they are awesome looking and the recipient will absolutely LOVE them as a Christmas Gift. I will be a returning customer for life.

I have put about 15-20 miles on the boots already, but they seemed to work well the first time out. The sole is structurally sound, and the uppers supportive. I am confident to hike over rough, rocky terrain with these boots. They looked especially good after applying Danner's Boot Dressing suitable for gortex lined boots. The uppers are a little stiff if laced tight; which is good for steep downhill to keep your toes out of the end. However, on flat ground I have installed 2 sets of shorter laces. The first set for the first five holes (like a low hiking boot), and the second lace for the upper four holes ...tied looser so I don;t spend so much energy flexing the uppers all day long.
These boots are very appealing and comfortable to wear. They are also very reasonably priced. Would recommend to my friends.

I bought these shoes because I'm an aspiring hipster and I thought they would make me cool. Well, they did, but they started falling apart after about two month. I have pretty wide feet, but these fit me fine. They just decided one day that my feet weren't getting enough ventilation, I guess, so they popped open on the sides and just above my big toes. Now they're even more comfortable, but I look like a vagrant--which is very hip, I guess.

I bought 3 pairs of Minnetonka brown hardsole slippers for my Grandkids and nephew. I could not find them in stock anywhere for Christmas until I went om Amazon.com. The kids love them and wear them outside. I would recommend these slippers to everyone. I had to send a pair back for size and my Mother-In-Law was here for Christmas and i showed them to her and they fit her so i gave them to her. When she went home she told me she wears them outside all the time and loves them. I also bought a wireless printer,Kodak Camera with 30xzoom which is amazing. My husband collects Invictus Watch's and i got a great deal on the watch.
I love these shoes. Have been wearing them for years and hope Easy Spirit does not EVER stop making them! Great support for tired feet!

These shoes were exactly what my son wanted for Christmas. He loves them. They run true to size and they are comfortable. He has a hard time keeping the tongue straight on the shoes. When he tightens the laces, it will stay in place.
I have another pair of these shoes and loved them; therefore, I purchased the pair through Amazon at a good price.

This very attractive little sandal would probably be very satisfactory, but it runs both short and narrow. It is not true to size by any means, so rather than return them, I gave them to a cousin with smaller feet. They were on sale. Now I know why.

For all of those people who would rather pet the animals than wear them, these are the shoes for you! Converse has been making "Chuck Taylor's" longer than I have been alive and not one animal has lost it's life to make them! The only downside to Converse is that they are not the most comfy shoe, however, a insole insert fits rather nicely into them and then your good to go.

I bought these for our trip to Maui since we were expecting to do a lot of walking and hiking. I fell in love with them the minute I put them on. They have good support which I need since I have high arches. They were perfect for hiking and dry well when they get wet. I will definitely buy these again!
This are super confortable shoes if you do not mind the 'men' look. Great with pants. Wear for 8h or longer with no pain, padding is extraordinary. The brown is beautiful.

Received these boots today and I have to tell you they are great. My feet after 74yrs hurt after taking my walk but i went today for a mile and my feet feel great. Now if i can get my hips to stop hurting we will be ready for that five mi.Thanks Hi-Tec AND AMAZON For the great price and fast shipping.

Just purchased those shoes for my brother andhe is satisfied above and beyond.A very light and comfortable feeling he told me.New Balance were and always will be the best sport shoes for me.You wan't be sorry for purchasing this particular one.5 stars !

The shoe itself is cute! Very bright colorful...and well pink. The only worry/complaint i have is that maybe its a bit too big? Maybe the reviews i read after i bought the item scared me making me wish that i would have gone down a size. So instead of an 8 maybe a 7.5 would have been nice? Well what can you do...you cant shrink em and they are cute. Im sure i can work it all out! The delivery estimate of the package was right on time. The seller was awesome! So all in all its pretty good :P
Great quality for the money. Hate the heaviness of most tennis shoes, these are light weight and good support without making my feet feel heavy

I love this shoe because it is dressy, classy and comfortable...and a flat. I search extensively for the shoe with the proper look to wear with my suits. This shoe is it!! In addition to coming in various colors -- it comes with a patent tip/heel. And did I say comfortable? There is no traditional break-in period. The shoe just molds itself to your foot (soft leather). A must have.
My son like the boot, it fit well and is water proof. We received the boot just a few days after ordering it.
Wonderful experience! I received my package in one day. The shoes had one flaw in the leather but other than that it was a great experience.

I always buy Reeboks (black).1. I have big feet so they dont stand out as much when I get black ones2. They always last a long time3. They are comfortable and I can wear them to work even though we cant have gym shoes
These are the most comfy pair of thongs (flip flops)I have ever owned plus you never have to look for a bottle openner.

These are the most comfortable shoes I've had in recent memory. I have both the black and dark brown. The black ones especially are dressy enough for work and most things I do, yet are great to take a nice walk. They seem well made, though I haven't had them long enough to know for sure. Great shoes, though.
My daughter is small size that we could not find it in a sport store. She is using it a lot for competition and she love them. Arrived on time.
Nice-looking shoe, but too expensive. For big foot guys like me, makes your feet look a lot smaller.
Bought these shoes for my teenage son.He loves them - still wearing them after two years.The great part of Vans is that the size is consistent around the world.

I thought the straps on this would bother me after parting with my old leather-strapped Reefs, which are no longer sold. I bought these along with a newer version of leather straps, and I favor these, surprisingly. I love them, and haven't had any problems with them yet!

This is a pair nice pair of boots with very comfortable inner lining of soft leather and an apparently impossible-to-damage sole. However, this pair will be a living hell for anyone for the first 2-3 days! I read some reviews about this pair of boots being very tight and smaller than normal size, and initially I regretted my decision of buying this. The first day of wearing this to work, I had to remove this pair towards the end of the day (after first removing the sock, and then go on limping for the entire day) and go home barefoot. But the second time I wore it, it was a little better and now it fits snuggly and comfortably. I now know why it happened.First, I had this problem only on my left foot. I am a prominently left handed (though considerably ambidextrous) person and so, the left side of my body is a little bigger than the right side. For a right-handed person, it will be the other way around. The second and most important point is that, unlike lace shoes, there is no option of pulling and tightening in the boots with zipper, and so they must fit perfectly once they are broken in. As of today, I can wear a thin pair of socks and this boots comfortably, though the first 30 minutes of so, I feel a mild squeeze on my left feet. Mind you, I have worn this pair only on a total of 6 days until now, and I am pretty sure that within the next couple of weeks, it will be 100% perfect for my feet.For those who said that this boot gets a worn-out look with the leather developing many creases, I could get it all shiny simply by using a brush of medium hardness (without using any polish).My suggestion: If you want to buy this pair to go out on a date, attend a party of a wedding, probably you are headed for pain and agony (and bad mood, and some swearing too, if you are as uncivil a person as I am!). But if you are a man with patience to wait and break it in, and this is not going to be your only pair of boots, probably this is a nice pair to buy and enjoy, with an occasinal little squeeze notwithstanding.

Our third pair in 10 years.....my husband's absolutely favorite slippers......Kind of expensive for slippers, however, they last a long time and are more comfortable.The sheepskin keeps your feet warm in the winter and cool in the summer.

The Supernova Cushion by Adidas has been around for years, and there's a reason why it's so popular among runners--comfort! I run about 25 miles a week, and i absolutely love this shoe. I have narrow, high arched feet, and the Supernova Cushion makes my long runs a breeze. It fits true to size, but remember to buy a 1/2 size up when purchasing running shoes if you plan to run greater than a few miles at a time.

These shoes are much more soft and flexible than they look in the picture. I thought they looked rather firm -- kind of like those adult clogs made with cork soles and very firm wool uppers, if you're familiar with those. But one of the reviews said they had a flexible sole, so I took a chance, since these are just so adorable. I'm glad I did!The shoe is a little heavier than average, but by no means too heavy. The sole is a soft, grippy rubber that flexes very easily, and there's even arch support! The upper is a cotton-poly blend that has the soft texture of well-worn khaki pants, with a terry lining. I got the medium, which looks to be equivalent to a size 4.I got the pink dragonfly version; I just wish they'd bring back the green dragonfly version, as I think the frog looks a little strange (and unhappy!).
These shoes were beautiful. My sister loved them today at Christmas. They arrived in plenty of time for Christmas and were packaged neatly. This was a great gift.

I have wide feet, so the fit could be a little better, but I did order regular sizes... I wear a 10W-11M, and ordered a 10M and it fit just fine, I can't imagine how baggy and slippery anything bigger would be. It's adjustable with the tiny bow elastic. I wish I would have stain guarded them before wearing, they do pick up everything you are near. my 9 yeah old niece tried to get me to give them to her maybe 30 times, haha. I ordered her her own set for her birthday. Shh! I'm pleased. I'm not a dancer, well not in 15 years anyway, I ordered them for folding up in my purse to have when my high heels get too uncomfortable. They're gonna be way cuter than any other foldable flats!

I wish shoe makers would make 1/2 sizes. i purchased a 9b and it fit a little loose. I wear a 8 1/2 shoe and a 8 would have been to small and a 9 is a little to big. What is the problem with shoe makers making 1/2 sizes in these type shoes. Other wise the shoe feel good and since it is hard to find a red shoe in that style I like it.

Good product for a great price. I felt the difference in my comfort the first time I wore them on the dance floor. As a beginner, I did not want to spend a lot of money on a pair of shoes. I wasn't sure I would survive the dance lessons! That was weeks ago. I am still taking dance lessons and the shoes are still serving me well. I am more than pleased with my purchase.

These shoes are incredibly comfortable. One of the few shoes I've ever purchased that I can stand in them all day, and not complain about my feet hurting. It was a great buy, and the quality is excellent. Highly recommended.

the N width is almost impossible to find in stores, these guys have them & the shoes fit perfectly.I give this store & shoes an A+ across the board. Great price, great size, long wearing & very comfortable.

I have had foot problems for over 15 years. Heel Spurs, neuromas, ruptured heel gel capsules. My feet are a mess. So I am always on the lookout for a comfortable pair of shoes. I bought a pair three months ago. They have not been off my feet since. I love these shoes. They are great looking and are incredibly comfortable. If you are inclined to wear Ecco shoes, I would strongly recommend you give these a try. They are simpley the best ever. So much so now I need to get a pair in black.

These shoes are great and comfortable for my daughter. Just be sure to order about 1 1/2 size UP with these. We ordered a 13 1/2 for my daughter and they were VERY tight! She needed a size 2 to have a little space in there.

Great looking pair of Oxfords. Extremely comfortable as well. I have a slightly broader foot, so the bicycle toe fits like a glove. And the funky graphic sole adds to the zing. Got a great price on amazon, just $40 as against the regular $130. How do these guys do it? Thanks amazon for the great price and free shipping to top it!!
You would expect a name like timberland to have reached a certain level of expertise to be able to build a $ 100.+ shoe that can compromise between comfort and toughness... ,but it doesn't .
I have been wearing these and the T22s for seven years. I buy a new pair about every 6 months and I play 3-4 times a week. They have a nice wide toe box and are unbelievably comfortable!!!!
The customer service provided by Orva has been great in light of my poor feedback last week. They were very helpful

These shoes are incredibly light and wearing them after wearing construction shoes all day, make you want to run ! The material does not seem very strong but I guess all light weight shoes are like that. The sizing is a little screwed up. Size 10 is really size 9.5. So buy 0.5 sizes up. But You can still fit into "your" size and the shoes easily expand.The only annoying thing I found is that the footprint is so small that it feels like your feet are touching the ground at an angle. Maybe this is the right way to be running .. I dont know. I have run about 10 miles with these shoes so far and they seem to be adjusting ... so maybe after a few more weeks, I will get better used to having my feet touch the ground with these shoes. I am just used to shoes that touch the ground flat and your feet inside the shoes cannot rock them back and forth sideways ... but I guess a shoe this light and contoured does allow extreme flexibility and I am just not used to that.And note that while they provide very good grip on all sorts of wet and gainy pavement, they dont provide very much support at all so I can see a lot of potential ankle twists if you run with them "out back" like the name suggests. The small foot print I think will easily let your foot pivot in unnatural ways on loose soil.On tar and concrete though, they are excellent. An excellent and light running shoe. Just the sizing is screwed up and has a very bounded footprint.
Hush Puppies Mall Walkers are an excellent product. Fit well. Good support. True to size. Highly recommend them for casual wear.Hush Puppies Men's Mall Walker Oxford
I ordered my usual size, but they were too small. Once I reorded a larger size, I am very happy with the shoe.

These shoes a nice looking and feel good. I am diabetic and there is plenty of toes room. This also rest my legs which have been operated on because if bad circulation. I would recommend these shoes to anyone who has or doesn't have leg and foot problems.

These shoes are much more soft and flexible than they look in the picture. I thought they looked rather firm -- kind of like those adult clogs made with cork soles and very firm wool uppers, if you're familiar with those. But one of the reviews said they had a flexible sole, so I took a chance, since these are just so adorable. I'm glad I did!The shoe is a little heavier than average, but by no means too heavy. The sole is a soft, grippy rubber that flexes very easily, and there's even arch support! The upper is a cotton-poly blend that has the soft texture of well-worn khaki pants, with a terry lining. I got the medium, which looks to be equivalent to a size 4.I got the pink dragonfly version; I just wish they'd bring back the green dragonfly version, as I think the frog looks a little strange (and unhappy!).
liked these shoes because they come in narrow so I don't have excess velcro going over the sides of the shoe. The shoes start out kind of stiff but do break in.
love the boots. very comfortable and solid. seller was very accomadating when order was lost by shipper. overall, very pleased with purchase.
Great looking shoe that can be dressed up or down. True to size and great dancing shoes with the leather soles.

The Puma Men's Roma Shoe is simple but classy, yet good for everyday use. A great selection of colors assures that you'll find a pair just right to fit your personality and wardrobe. Not only do these shoes look good, but they feel good also. I assure you will be satisfied with these shoes that will make you and your feet smile!

I first bought these on my honeymoon many years ago. We are now fortunate enough to live at the beach and I live in these shoes and have many colors of the same style. Shape to your feet wonderfully!!!!
I love these shoes!I treat mine with SNO-Seal which waterproofs these shoes and makes cleaning them much easier!These run .5 size larger.

I just got these in the mail today, and I am unsure as to whether or not these shoes are legit. Although they came in a box, the shoes did not come with the "Converse Chuck Taylor" tags that usually come with the product. There are also some minor cosmetic issues (the stitching near the toe area of the shoes are uneven). Also, the label inside the tongue says that these shoes were made in Indonesia. The Converse that I used to wear were either made in China or Vietnam.
This is my second pair, in as many years. Comfortable, nice hieght and affordable.

I like these but I bought the 8 1/2 wide and they are a little too short - but I still wear them. I will buy more grasshoppers in future but will get them in a 9 wide. I haven't worn them enough to be able to tell if they will wash easy but I expect them to.
Happy with purchase.Customer Service was great when I emailed informing them that I had not recieved order.Order recieved 2 days later..........Thanks
EXCELLENT PRODUCT AND GOOD SERVICE PROVIDED BY YOUR TEAM, THEY ARE TRULY RELIABLE AND TIMELY I WILL RECOMMEND THIS PROVIDER AMONG MY FRIENDS.

Have been buying these shoes for about 17 years. I love shoes, but hate wearing them! These shoes I can wear comfortably from the get go. I was a little worried about size and quality changes as the last couple of pairs I bought were not true to size - I wrote the manufacturer to let them know. These are good, reliable, well made, comfortable shoes. And they come in lots of colors. Well done Enzo Angiolini for maintaining a great product and quality for all these years.
did not wash well... price was great but doesn't seem like the same Keds that you buy in dept stores. Not real happy with them.
As a tall bloke, I like these shoes are they comfortable and fit well. They have a wide fitting, last years and look good for ages. Plus great value for money.

purchased these April of 2010, am very hard on shoes, could not fault these. tips of laces haven't lasted but the laces have. they have been drenched w/water oil, sweat & are finally stretched out a bit. will buy more. wish they came with smooth soles.

These slip-on shoes are the best walking to work shoes I have had. They are comfortable to wear for the whole day. And going up and down the stairs in the train station no longer seems like torture to my feet. The design is subdued enough for work environments (no flashing silvers or any other bright colors).It was a little bit expensive at 60 bucks, but I consider it money well spent on not having to worry about heel / ankle pain. Also, the bungee laces make it easy to slip on and gives a snug fit, so reduces the hassle of laces when I am in a hurry to get out to work.I have had these for about 4 months, and they are starting to show the wear and tear of being worn every weekday. The felt is looking a bit worn out. Hopefully, these shoes will last me at least a year.

Oh man I'd forgotten how easy these are to wear! Make sure and get 1 size smaller, they do run big no matter what they say at the shoe store. A classic that never goes out of style. I hadn't had a pair in years and these are rapidly becoming my "go to" pair of shoes.PLUS THEY'RE JUST PLAIN COOL!!
Not as comfortable as the world walking classic shoe . i would recommend the latter although the pro walker is less money

When I was a kid in the 70s, there were all kinds of new sneaker designs coming out, but nothing ever beat the reliable old standards, either Converse Chucks or Pro-Keds Court Kings. Those sneakers were great for any sport, they held up under abuse, and never went out of fashion for boys and girls alike. These Pro Keds are a bit of a play on the old design, and come in a wide variety of cuts, colors & materials. I've got several pairs of low-cuts, one pair in suede with natural (translucent brown) rubber toe, another made out of bright yellow tennis ball fuzz with white rubber, and this pair, shiny navy blue leather with light blue & white rubber. There are a variety of color combinations to pick from, in fact on the Keds website you could even make a custom pair for awhile. They are some of the toughest, well-made sneakers and incredibly comfortable as well. They're the ultimate casual weekend shoe, and the most recent ones I've gotten come with a lighter, shapely molded insert rather than just a flat foam rubber & canvas insert, giving better support. I wear a lot of Vans and Converse sneakers too, and honestly, the Pro-Keds are constructed more solidly than either of the other brands. They can stand up to serious abuse, especially the ones made out of leather.
My daughter loves yellow, and loves wearing crocs to the pool. They are comfy for her!
I bought these shoes before traveling to Europe. We did a TON of walking and I was comfortable the whole time. I would definitely recommned these shoes.
This is my fourth pair of Asics Gel Nimbus shoes and I've yet to be disappointed
I was looking for some casual boots that look good with jeans, these are great, simple and comfortable! Recommend them!

I am a 13.5 and often wear a 13 or 14 depending on brand. I'd read that these run large so I ordered a 13. They are about the right length, but feel too wide in the heel and ankle. They sometimes pinch at the big toe joint.They look great, and are generally well made. They don't seem perfect for my foot apparently.

I was looking for a shoe I didn't have to tie for my toddler. I bought this one because it was velcro. I put it on my son and his foot bulged out of the top, even though it's the size he was measured for in the store. He wore them and as the day went on, the tongue on the shoe slipped down. It's a cute shoe, but just didn't fit my son the way I had hoped.

I own 5 pairs of Converse sneaks, my daughter has 3 pairs, and my son has 2 pairs. We all really love our Chucks. But this is my first pair of the low top kind. I love them so much. They are really comfortable and easy to slip on and off, and so very black so they go with any kind of casual clothing well.If you're buying Converse for the first time, be aware they run just a touch big. This is wonderful for my son who has fairly wide feet, but the rest of us usually buy a half size small.

These boots are the best I've ever owned. So good, that I own two pairs, and bought my dad a pair. And he swears by them too. If you have aching feet, soreness, or a weak ankle, these boots have a therapeutic effect! I am not into medicine or anything but I have to say, these boots are very supportive and make your feet feel strong and no strain on the joints.

The boots are very comfortable and fit well (I ordered a half-size smaller than I wear in regular shoes because I was afraid they would be too big and I'm glad I did). They are very cool and a bit trendy with the very square, somewhat elongated toes but I like them because they're not too dressy or too casual... can wear them with just about anything. I will definitely buy more Steve Madden shoes!

I've gotten two pairs of these, the vegan and the leather kind, I prefer the vegan they don't stretch out as much as the leather ones do they're very comfy, make cute nicer shoes I wouldn't say dress shoes but they're a step up from casual. They last a good year and a half with constant use which I wouldn't recommend. Not the best for work unfortunately. I like the idea and I really could feel the negative heel working my leg muscles more. Most surely recommend over the Sketchers shape ups.

these are a great classic shoe. not a ton of support but thats what i expected.when i opened the box i thought amazon had sent me the wrong color. i was expecting something more grey/khaki but got something that was more like army green. i guess i read khaki green in the description and overlooked the green part, ha. nevertheless i am enjoying these shoes. styyyyyyyyyyyylish.

The Elk Tracker 860 is a great pair of boots! I just ordered my second pair because they are the best boots that I have ever owned. My first pair lasted about six years and I put hundreds and hundreds of miles on them. I've used them for hunting, hiking, ice fishing and snow shoeing. I've even stood in the middle of streams while photographing and they never leaked a drop. I've used them on many 8 to 12 mile snow shoeing/ice fishing trips in Montana and my feet never got cold or sore or wet. The reason I purchased a new pair was because they did start to leak in very wet conditions this year.
good shoes. they are comfortable and have very classic look! I love them! I would buy another pair of them next year!

I have a wide foot, a high arch, and need good support for walking. These are perfect, offering good stability on various surfaces. I'm on my 3rd pair of these--so glad they haven't been discontinued! For me, they feel great right out of the box and last a long time. They aren't as cushioned as some shoes (as I'm 60 I appreciate cushioning), but I find that the cushy shoes just aren't good for walking.

These sandals feel really soft & comfortable. I have high arches and the contoured arch support work real well. With traditional "flat" sandals, I tend to suffer from plantar fasciatis, especially if I walk on them for most of the day. I love these sandals!

Good shoe. Wore them to and from the shower while in iraq. My only issue with them is that they rubbed my toes badly. It was probably because my feet were wet. It got so bad I stopped wearing them, but that was the only issue I had with them. Overall a very sturdy shoe.

From the first time I saw these shoes I knew I had to have them. They are very stylish, go great with jeans, and are extremely comfortable. Also didn't hurt that I was able to get them for about $35 less at Amazon than anywhere else was selling them for if they even had them. My new favorite pair of shoes.
I bought these for tap shoes for my daughter. Shoes are good quality did not realize in the fine print, TAPS NOT INCLUDED. Could have bought shoes for less else where with taps.
They are wonderful - he said it just takes a while to break them in to your own specific feet. They hurt the first few days, but loves them now. They were a gift to my son.
I have worn Easy Spirit shoes for many years and find them comfortable and durable. I have had ongoing back problems, and find these shoes to help lessen back pain.

This is not my first pair of the M109 New Balance shoe. I usually have 2 at a time. One for tennis and one for walking. When the tennis pair begin to wear out, I buy a new pair for walking. I prefer its all-white look and the comfort is great.

Once while traveling, I had a big blister on my heel and needed something that wouldn't rub my heel. I happened to get a pair of Crocs since the strap can be moved forward to look like trim over the front. I was pleasantly surprised by the Crocs - very cushiony soft, like walking on air. Also the material is insulating enough to keep your feet warm yet the air holes ventilate enough that your feet don't get sweaty either.I originally got the Crocs for temporary use but now I look forward to slipping into them everyday when I get home. It's wonderful to feel such cushioning on my feet with every step. They've replaced my slippers, mocassins, surf shoes and sandals.

I was extremely satisfied with the service on this purchase. I received the item at the front-end of the timeframe when it was expected to be delivered. If that wasn't the case, I would not have had the sandals in time for my beach vacation!

I loved these shoes, but my boyfiend hates them. They are very comfortable and go with many things, but they did my feet smell too. I had to put the foot odor powder in them at least once every 3 or 4 wears and I had to wash them frequently. I wanted to buy a pair in black, but my boyfriend wouldn't let me.

I bought these after realizing my worn out Merrel sandals were no longer built...I'm not Keen fan, and I still think they look a little funny. But, they fit well,seem well made, and they feel great. I've worn them to work for a week, andwalked 5 miles around NYC and I am still happy.I think my proper size is a 9.5, and I heard these ran big, so I ordered a10, and that seems right. I kind of have to work to get them on, and I don'tslide around in them. The elastic lace seems to do little. I imaginethey will stretch out a little (not too much I hope) and the lacewill be useful.

I am from New Zealand and buying this shoe all the way from USA was an extreme decision. I got this shoe in June 2011. I have been using it for the last few months and the following points are worth mentioning.1. Great balance and fit. though initially a bit tight and takes a bit of wearing for proper fit which is quite natural for leather.2. wear at the back heel at minimum which is a common problem for me and in some cases shoes may almost wear out in a month. (I walk to my work and return with is about daily 5kms)3. They are really waterproof! Not a even any moistness inside! Just wonderful4. Elegant and good looking!5. Just what you would expect if you owned a pair of these 10, 20, 30 years ago, except with a custom peace sign logo on the outside only.They do sure highlight however just how far shoe technology has come by comparison to a pair of ASICS running shoes - in terms of support, comfort etc. They are 30 year old or more shoe technology.I hoped that logo would be on both sides but the inseam side of the shoe bears the traditional converse chuck taylor logo.Still, 5 stars from my view. I have worn TEVA's for years. I have a high arch, but love wearing zorries and the arch construction in TEVA's works well for me.Love the MUSH "slippers". I live in Hawaii and also live in zorries, so I have quite a closet full of various colors. They are comfortable from the get-go and form to your foot after a few wearings. Give you a little bit more long range comfort because of the extra padding.One warning: They tend to squish out a bit eventually and the shoe starts looking slightly too large on your feet, so I've started to buy 6's instead of 7's (they only come in whole sizes regrettably) and just live with the fact that my feet are just fitting the shoe as I hate it when the rubber begins to spread out and then they look sloppy on my feet.The MUSH tends to be cut about 1/4 inch shorter than the new Toolani style (sadly replaced the old Ulani style), so keep this in mind when ordering for fit. I am right in between a 6 and 7, but going smaller works for me.Otherwise, adore these zorries.

That being said, these are so cute and my daughter wears them and walks in them with no problem. LOOOVE these boots!

A few searches online via Google and Amazon.com had them. I ordered it as soon as I saw it. It arrived two days later at my door and began to wear it. I gave these shoes three stars because they are comfortable and good for just walking around. However, I would not ever do anything that involves running or jumping in these shoes. The aharp edge on the bottoms make it difficult to land safely. I've sprained my ankles three times in these shoes playing volleyball (went up for spike, came down with the worst sprain I've ever had), basketball (sprained while trying to cut while running; foot sideways and my ankle gave), and once just walking (walking along a sidewalk, I stepped on a tiny pebble. my foot went sideways, and the edge of the bottom cause my ankle to go out instead of helping my foot go flat. minor roll, could've sprained). I'm prone to sprains, but I've never had this many issues with any shoe before. Here's hoping it doesn't happen to someone else, though I'm sure it has.

I'm pretty picky when it comes to buying a shoes. Typically, Adidas seem to fit my feet very nicely. These Clutch's are no exeception. This took a couple days to get use to but the added support that they provide make it worth it--especiallly for one whose knees and ankles are more prone to injury than they used to be.These shoes are very durable with nylon stitching along the toe and full leather upper, I expect them to last a long time.The one thing that would make the shoe better is more ventilation. When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.
excellent product very comfortable shoes highly recommended very happy with it, I bought one for me and one for my mom.
The air soles and support (I put inserts under the pad) have ended by back pain. I purchased a second pair as a spare.

Great shoe in the style of the old Adidas ROM from when I was a kid. They look great and are very comfortable. If you like this style, check out the Country II style also. I like them so much I bought a total of 4 pairs of the Italia and Country 2.

I really like this shoe! It's hard for me to find a shoe as narrow as I need, but this one fits just right across the toes and on the heel. This shoe is aesthetically superior to anything on the market, particularly the latest version, a unrivaled gem which sports a navy blue faux-suede. If you don't actually want to PLAY basketball in these, definitely get a pair.However, if you're using the shoe for its intended purpose, I hope you have narrow feet and strong ankles. As a huge fan of the original T-Macs (didn't get the T-Mac 2's because they were too narrow), I was hoping that the 3's would restore my faith in the shoe. I'm a serious baller - I play just about every day and participate in 3 corporate/city leagues.That being said, after only owning these shoes for just three few weeks, I had to return them because I sprained BOTH ankles (never happened with the T-Mac 1's) AND severely bruised my medial and plantar nerves (never happened in my life - ever). Though ankle injuries are all too common in basketball, these injuries did not occur in the typical "landed on someone's foot" fashion, which is cause for serious concern. I consulted my podiatrist on the issue and she informed me that my shoes provided poor support and suggested I look into a pair of New Balances.Additionally, the outside of the shoe will dig into your ankle if you lace your shoes up tightly, as there is no cushioning around the top rim of the shoe.Proceed with caution - do not be wowed by looks, particularly if you need support or have wider feet.

What else can you say about a sneaker that has been around for over 90 years. These sneakers are simply great!!! I got the classic black high top and am very pleased with them. They are comfortable, durable and stylish. On a hot summer day the don't heat up like a bread oven, like some sneakers do, keeping your feet cool and comfy. If they do get dirty or funky you can simply toss them into your washer and bada bing like new!!! They offer enough support for me to last for a long day of walking around town or work. I couldn't figure out what purpose they served, and when I pulled very gently on one to see what it was even attached to, it came right off. I'm assuming they weren't meant to be there as the other strings did the same and the other boot didn't even have them.Also, the edge of the fabric on the inside bottom of the boot, between your foot and the actual rubber sole, comes detached VERY easily, and though it doesn't make the boot look any different from the outside, it can be uncomfortable to walk on at times. The first time I wore the boots this fabric was already coming up in one boot - I've worn them a couple of times now and it's coming up in both boots. If I wasn't worried about the damage it might cause, I would rip this fabric completely out just so I wouldn't feel the unevenness where the edges have ripped up.The drawstrings untie themselves very easily and are very long, so they can get in the way of walking or drag on the floor unless you triple-knot them.Overall, they look very good and I'm still happy I bought them - they just have a few minor details I'd change.

lots of comments about size ...so much so that i anticipated having to send them back.here's my advice - don't use the size charts listed because its way off. Do this:get a tape measure - stand on it, measure from the bottom rear of your foot up to the tip of your big toe...then match that with the size next to it... (skip all the US/ EU / GB size... they are clearly wrong on the size listing)So, my daughters measurement was 10" from back to tip - we ordered size 9. Perfect fit.okay, material quality is nice for wearing around the house or art school... but from what i could tell, it won't stand up to constant use. But hey, they're inexpensive (relatively speaking) so buy a few pair.m

These have been great boots. I am on my fourth pair of the Altitude series- a version I, version II, and now 2 version IVs. All have been good buys for me. The version IV have been the best but all have been good.First, I have a high arch and have always been hard on any footwear with a tendency to walk on the 'outside' of my foot. I wear these boots to travel in and work in while traveling. Many a mile in airports, many miles on concrete, gravel, dirt, and inside simulation facilities. When I travel I tend to only take these boots - my work rarely requires dress clothes, the boots look good in an open collar work environment, they are comfortable, and taking only 1 pair of shoes does cuts down on packing requirements quite a bit for longer trips (3 weeks or longer in duration).I have taken these boots on three overseas trips - they did well in the Scottish highlands (twice), and London. They did equally well on the beaches of Hawaii, Myrtle Beach, and Cancun. They have done me well in wet and sand - hot and cold.To add to this endorsement, not only am I hard on shoes I am also quite fat these days - topping 300 pounds. For my health I maintain a walking routine of 1-3 miles a day whenever possible. When I travel, these boots are also my walking shoes.In general Hi Tec have always fit me well. I go back 40 or so years to wearing the Lite series of Hi Tecs while I was in my running the Appalachians days. Given my high arches, a tendency for very bad calluses, rebuilt right ankle, 2 knees that varied doctors have wanted to cut on since early Army days, and now my weight I am very picky on shoes. These are the best of the Hi Tec boot types that I have found.I suspect I have seen the best of my current set of boots - maybe six more months or so of regular wear till they become yard work shoes till their final demise. I have never worn out the uppers in these boots. I have worn the sole down to a smooth surface and worn out the insides (after using new insole inserts a couple of times). They are tough boots.And I have a back up pair ready to take the place of the current set.On a down side, these style of boots (in general, not just Hi Tec) are not sturdy enough for doing squats in Power Lifting circles. One needs a higher and stiffer boot than what the modern ilk of hikers provides. This is the only limitation I have found for these boots.

I bought this shoe as a supportive shoe for daily use rather than for trail running, to alleviate the pain in the heel known as plantar fasciitis. Such a shoe must have (1) a strong cupped back to keep the heel down and immobilized, (2) a rigid arch that will not bend or twist, and (3) a stiff toe, so that when walking the foot more rolls off the end of the shoe than bends. An orthotic (like Superfeet or Prothotic, etc.) is usually also recommended. The most recommended shoes seem to be the New Balance 926 and 845, but these are determinedly ugly; the 926s look like barges, and the more gracefully shaped 845s come only in a muddy black or a white, like nurses' shoes. The Montrail Hardrock is good looking and, less well-known, has the above supportive characteristics. (Columbia has since bought out Montrail, so I do know if the their recent version of the Hardrock offers the same support; some chatroom chatter suggests it does not.) I use a 3/4 length Birkenstock orthotic under the regular Hardrock footbed. I have experienced considerable relief wearing this shoe and orthotic, so I am quite pleased. (I use a 3/4 length orthotic with the Hardrock because it does not have the boaty toe of a New Balance, and a full-length orthotic will lift the toe too close to the top of the shoe. By the bye, I also get much added relief by the unlikely expedient of wrapping a single strip of 2" duct tape around my arch--my bare foot not the shoe--with about a 1/8 inch gap in the tape on the bottom of the arch; I wear it under my sock by day and remove it at night for the skin to breathe and apply a new strip before putting weight on my foot next morning.) I hope the designers at New Balance come up with a less clunky more attractive shoe in the future, but for now I am very satisfied with my Hardrocks for the purpose, and I continue to look for appealing shoes with the above characteristics. Ciao

My 6 yr old son really loves these boots and wants to wear them every day. He wanted "work" boots so he could be like his Daddy. Previously he had a pair of boots with a manmade upper and those did not last too long. He is very hard on footwear, but so far these seem to be holding up well. He even wears them to school on days he doesn't have gym.

When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.
