I have been wearing this particular style of Reef flip flops for over a decade now. I strayed away foolishly for one summer when someone talked me into buying Rainbows and they fell apart in just a couple of months. When I lived in Florida these babies would last me for a full summer and up until the beginning of the next one when I would simply buy another pair. Now that I live in New York where there's more than 2 seasons, I can get about 2 summers out of them. I should have taken pictures of the pair that this order replaced. I had worn the tread off the bottoms and almost completely worn through the sole, but even then they were super comfortable. Although their sturdiness is amazing, what I love most about these flip flops are their ability to mold themselves to your feet in such a way that after a month or so of wearing them sometimes you forget you have shoes on (minus the fact that you're not stepping on glass or hot cement). Some people default to heels or sneakers as much as possible, I default to these flip flops as much as I can.

I love these loafers, especially the Velcro closure. They are a great fit all the way around. The only reason I knocked off 1 star was because the upper is coming loose from the sole on the right shoe. Think I can fix it with some Superglue, but should not have to for an $80 shoe. This happened after one wearing, but have not had the problem on the black pair of the same style. Even with this small problem, I would buy these again.

I ordered this shoe in black and it dyed my feet black. It is super cute, but I would caution you that this may happen. The color washed off of course, but was quite a surprise when I took them off after wearing them.
These came a bit more narrow than the first pair I had bought 10 years ago (which I am still wearing!) but very comfortable still. They last forever and are light as a feather!
I grew up in keds, they have always been my favorite. Same great quality as always. Keep up the great work.

I bought this same shoe two years ago and really liked how lightweight it is so ended up buying the exact same shoe again! I run about 3 miles each weekday in warmer months, doing other workouts when it's winter. The only thing I could possibly complain about with this shoe is that it does seem to be a little light on the cushioning compared to some others. The light weight and balance of it made me go with it again however, and it is especially nice when it's extremely hot out as the material around the toe area is exceptionally breathable. Definitely wouldn't recommend it for cold weather running! But if you're like me and only run when it's warm and want to feel like you have no weight on your feet at all, then this shoe is for you.

What a great pair of shoes! Very nice looking, well-fitting and comfortable. They run true-to-size and I was really surprised at how comfortable they are, being that they are pointy-toe heels. I bought the carmel-colored ones which are a nice neutral to wear with anything.

I like the shoe--takes time to break in so shoe begins to fit the mold of your foot, like all Capezios. Comfortable. Really bought this shoe for everyday wear, since I like taupe to elongate your leg and foot. Makes you feel like a dancer!

I own seven pairs of this sandal, in six colors, and I have purchased one further pair for my mother, who is in a nursing home in Arizona, and whose feet swell. I wear sandals 365 days a year in Idaho, as due to a thyroid disease, I cannot tolerate having warm feet. I have worn out two pairs in the past. The first one I wore for four years, daily, exclusively, due to poverty, and they stood up to the abuse. (I have large feet and I am a substantial woman.)I would recommend this sandal to anyone who suffers from any of a range of foot issues, because it is totally adjustable. The sandal is well-made; after three years, I had my shoe repair person replace the elastic under the buckle on both sandals. Otherwise, everything held up, in rain and snow, daily, in Idaho. I believe that manufacturers call that "testing to destruction". I replaced that pair not so much because of their age, as because I finally had enough money to buy another pair. I did not even look for any other kind of sandal, or any other manufacturer. I will be wearing these for the rest of my life.Some of the other reviewers have mentioned that they had no break-in period with this model. Neither did I. On ONE sandal in ONE pair, there was a rough edge inside on a sewn seam. I bought some moleskin and attached it to the rough place inside the sandal, and have never given it another thought.My mother is delighted with the pair I bought her for this summer; I came to this page today to buy her another color for the winter.My only wish is that a few more colors were available in 12EE. But I cannot downgrade the sandal for that. I own and wear sandals in colors I had never been able to find before in my life. Color me a happy Propet customer for life.
Very cute pair of shoes, however, I feel they run about 1/2 a size to a whole size bigger...

Buying shoes online is always a little worrisome for me--what if they don't fit? What if they rub? With the unique model this shoe has, I was especially worried that the top of my feet would be rubbed while walking. However, I am beyond pleased. There is no rubbing at all and didn't require any breaking in to get to that point. also, the Sannibel is fancy enough to wear with slacks while pairing well with jeans and shorts, too!
Living in Buffalo< NY the boots are doing just what I need them to do< keep my feet warm and dry. Perfect as long as the snow on the ground is not too deep!!!
These are a nice pair of casual work shoes. Very comfortable and decent looking worn with a pair of slacks. They run true to size and I would recommend to anyone looking for work loafer.

I bought these for my husband's birthday because his work boots were super worn out and these ones are awesome. We knew they would be though because they are Dr. Martens. They were very high quality and good looking as well. At the time I bought these they had an awesome price probably because of some slight defect but you can't even tell. Sometimes the inside label is sewn on upside down, so they mark the product down. Don't hesitate to buy!! By the way I got the volcano colored ones.
I bought these boots for my son, he is going on a camping trip at the end of Jan. He needed a boot that would keep him both dry and warm. He love's them!
My son thought these was so nice with the cartoon character on them.

First off, I'm only giving this product three stars because of the tongue issue. In respect to every other characteristic the boots seem fine and a well made product for the price. However, my issue involves Hi-Tec marketing these boots as having a fully-gusseted tongue. They are not, the gusset only travels half the height of the boot so that's not a full gusset, it's a half. Error to Hi Tec for marekting them as such (it's not Amazon's fault, Hi Tec even markets the full gusset on their web site and Amazon mirrors these details here). If I would have known this I wouldn't have purchased, now I'll have to send them back.Update: Even though I was disappointed because of the gusseted tongue issue I was prepared to keep these boots (after all, you generally have to pay quite a bit more for boots with a full-gusset) until I discovered a fatal flaw--poor stitching on the upper inside of the right boot. This stitching was so rough that I could feel it rub against the top of my foot after nearly every step, even through thick hiking socks. It wasn't so much of an issue after a 5-10 minute trial walks but after a couple hours of walking I had a nice patch of sore skin that hurt more with every step. I returned these boots and bought a pair of much more expensive Columbia Daska Pass hikers. I'm very pleased with the new Columbias. No bias towards Hi-Tec--the gusseted thing could be a simple mistake of the marketing department and the stitching issue was likely just a random defect. I will say , however, that in the future I will only be purchasing hikers in the in the class of the Daska Pass boots as the comfort, ergonomics and durability (at least in the soles, we'll see how the uppers hold up) are far superior.
very comfortable shoe. I have worn these for many years & have many colors. Good with casual or dressy. I was so happy I found the black again. For a long time they weren't available.

The previous version of this shoe ran true to size but this newer version the width is wider than normal standards. I purchased a 10 Medium and should have purchased a 10 Narrow (if they make it in narrow). The shoe overall is excellent quality but I can't give it 5 Stars because Sebago should tell their customers that their shoe runs wider than normal. I am a Sebago fan and have worn their boat shoes for many years and this is the first time that I have run into this issue. Maybe they have changed manufacturers. I just wish they would alert their customers. I can't send them back as I have worn them for several days before realizing they were to wide. Even my older model that is worn and stretched doesn't feel as wide as the new model. It is hard to tell when you first get them because the new shoe needs to be broken in which I don't remember if the older style needed much breaking in either. Seabago please take note of this issue and do something about it. Thanks

I had been trying everything before for to attack and improve my cellulite in my legs and button,and nothing worked at all lately.I take care of myself going to work out,being vegan and organic...and i felt in the way of depression when i wanted to wear a mini short or skirt that which i love those so much and I used to wear that when i was younger...Since the first moment I started to use finulite ,just couple days after I noticed the improvement results surround my knees.It was a miracle for me cause I was getting some info about some very expensive laser treatments that they couldn't to guarantee me about the results that I was looking for.So when I,ve done with my first finulite set,I started with the second one right away for complete the professional recommendation.It,s been few months ago that I finish with the cellulite treatment and my legs looks amazing.I highly recommend this product for real.From women to women.

I bought a pair for a Christmas gift for my husband. He absolutely LOVED everything - that 1)it's made in USA, 2) it's snugly and keep his feet warm, and 3) the rubber is firm and grips the floor well...until, third week into wearing the slippers, stitches on the side on one of the foot started to come off. We didn't want to pull the thread, but as he continues to wear, the top part of the thread totally came off and now I can put my finger in the whole. I didn't expect this from all the reviews that I've read, especially when I compared the quality with other cheap brands, I certainly expected it to last a little longer....

Well, these shoes are pretty nice. I think they should have a better arch support and thats about it. They fit my needs, everything from walking to trail running. They even have good grip when I need to do a little rock climbing to get to a higher trail, or make my own trail. In other words they are simple and perfect.=)
they got here and i wear them all the time and i wear them with my dress clothes too and they look great

These are my favorite sneakers. I usually own two pair at any given time. They're great shoes for casual wear, work outs, I've even been complemented on them at some swanky benefits and social events. Sambas are classics, and I'll probably be wearing them for a long time.

They picture high tops and only write in the title that it is a converse and whatever color. Only after you order and then see the shoes listed under open purchases does it finally tell you that the item you just bought is low top. I was so upset. Deceiving and conniving company. Then you have to pay for the postage to send it back. I read an earlier review from someone who had the same problem but I thought "hey, it only happened to one person" Well, it happened to me too. Just be super careful and read everything.I have only just opened the box, so I don't know how good/bad the quality is yet. The sizing is right, I am a woman's 8, to that is a men's 6.It did arrive on time and the correct color and size i selected, but I REALLY REALLY wanted the high tops. The picture was of high top shoes.
The shoes were delivered on time. They were exactly what I wanted, and they fit well. The color matched pretty well what it was advertised to be.
The shoes arrived quickly, size was correct and shoes were exactly what we needed! Price was lower than any of the local vendors! Thanks!

I got these boot's for my son. The size was right on & look good.The only thing I had a problem wit is the wide size's! They do NOT fit like wide boot's should & they even say wide inside. Other then that they are good boot's.
I purchased these boots in september for the hunting season. I have recently purchased another pair for my father I liked them so much.
I was a little disappointed in the size, but that's my fault for not reading the description. I like and very useful for the beach.

I have worn this shoe style for a long time. I hate to admit how long (more than 20 years). Although the product has become palpably cheaper in construction, the shoes have still held up well. To be honest, the soles have fallen apart well before anything else.If you need a very comfortable shoe for everyday use, I recommend these most highly.
My mom would never wear these unless I bought them, but she loves them!!! They are uber comfortable and she feels like a teenager again!
Shoe was attractive but runs very wide. Normally I wear a Medium but this fits like a wide.Not much arch support. Newer styles of LifeStride seem to be running very wide. Shoeswere returned.

I purchased these boots for a trip to China in the dead of Winter. We endured temperatures below zero and these boots were perfect! And fashionable because I had positive comments from all the Chinese women asking where I bought them and how much. What a deal too. The cost was VERY reasonable!
I love these shoes. They're fun and comfy to wear. I wore them all over Europe recently. They make me feel young and hip!
Outstanding boots; bought to get muddy, chopping up a fallen tree in the middle of a midwestern winter. Sturdy, supporting, water resistant, & warm.

These shoes look adorable, but they're inexpensive and it shows. I bought mine in white patent and I'm satisfied considering the price. I think I'll be wearing them on Halloween or other special occasions that call for fun dress up. They're not hard to walk in, the heel is high but it's stable and the platform is high enough so that it's pretty easy if you're used to walking in heels at all. I wear a size 9 reliably but I've bought Pleaser shoes before and they run small so I ordered a 10. My feet were swimming in them. I returned them (thanks for making it so easy Amazon!) and ordered my 9 and they're a little tight in the toes, but not bad. Overall great dress up fun, but the quality is not great.
I love, love, love these sandals, they are the most comfortable sandals I have ever worn. Wish I could find them in more colors!
